story:
---- scroll down for english ----

Célunk, hogy rámutassunk a leszbikus, meleg, biszexuális és transznemű emberek történelmi, kulturális jelenlétére, és felhívjuk a figyelmet azokra a kulturális értékekre, amelyeket az LMBT közösségnek köszönhet a társadalom.

  • Segíts nekünk, hogy megemlékezhessünk Kertbeny Károlyról, a korai meleg aktivistáról,  aki 150 évvel ezelőtt megalkotta a „homoszexuális” kifejezést!
  • Segíts, hogy minél többen megismerhessék az Imre című, Magyarországon játszódó amerikai „ősmeleg” regényt!
  • Segíts, hogy méltó módon megemlékezhessünk az első magyarországi LMBT-szervezet, a Homérosz Egyesület 30. születésnapjáról!
  • Segíts, hogy több évtized után ismét bemutathassuk az egyik első magyar, leszbikus témát érintő filmet, a Hangyabolyt és beszélgethessünk az alkotókkal!
  • Segíts, hogy meg tudjunk emlékezni az úttörő német szexológus, Magnus Hirschfeld születésének 150. évfordulójáról és megismertessük munkásságát!

Magyarországon 2013 óta minden év februárjában rendezzük meg az LMBT Történeti Hónapot, közel 40 programot felölelő eseménysorozatként.

A program-sorozat keretében rendezünk:

  • művészeti és ismeretterjesztő kiállításokat
  • színházi előadásokat
  • filmvetítéseket
  • interaktív workshopokat
  • történelmi sétákat
  • bulit

és egyéb programokat, hogy ezzel is bővítsük az LMBT emberekkel kapcsolatos  ismereteket, és csökkentsük a társadalmi előítéleteket és sztereotípiákat.

Az egy hónapos program-sorozatot a Labrisz Leszbikus Egyesület és a Háttér Társaság koordinálja, közel harminc másik civil szervezet és intézmény bevonásával.

Támogass minket, hogy 2018-ban is megrendezhessük az LMBT Történeti Hónapot, és a rendezvény üzenete minél több emberhez eljuthasson!

http://www.lmbttortenetihonap.hu/

https://www.facebook.com/lmbt.tortenelem

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Our goal is to highlight the historical and cultural importance of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people, as well as to emphasize the cultural achievements which society owes to the LGBT community.

  • Support us, so that we can commemorate Karl Kertbeny, the early gay activist, who coined the word ‘homosexual’ 150 years ago!
  • Help us, so that many people can get to know the proto-gay American novel called Imre, set in Budapest!
  • Help us, so that we can honour the 30th anniversary of the first-ever Hungarian  LGBT organization, Homerosz Association!
  • Support us, so that we can screen one of the first Hungarian feature films which introduced the subject of lesbianism, the movie called The Ant Heap, and organize a discussion with its creators!
  • Support us, so that we can pay tribute to the 150th anniversary of the pioneer German sexologist Magnus Hirschfeld and get to know his work.

Since 2013 we have organized the LGBT History Month in each February in Hungary, as a series of events with nearly 40 programs.

As part of the program series, we organize:

  • art and educational exhibitions
  • theater shows
  • movie screenings
  • interactive workshops
  • historical walks
  • parties

and other programs in order to spread knowledge about LGBT people and reduce prejudice and stereotypes.

The one-month series of programs is coordinated by Labrisz Lesbian Association and Háttér Society, involving nearly thirty other civil society organisations and institutions.

Support us, so that the LGBT History Month can be organized in 2018 and its message can reach as many people as possible!

http://www.lmbttortenetihonap.hu/

https://www.facebook.com/lmbt.tortenelem

story:
About Us And Our Campaign:

 

  • Hoolipack Is the only clothing brand and music collective in the world that clothes any homeless person with every purchase of attire. The "Hooli" in Hoolipack stands for Hooligan, the reckless dreamer who goes against society to make sure that they are as free as possible to be themselves and achieve their dreams. We reside in the city of Los Angeles where skid row has been an ongoing issue for as long as we can remember. They say you are only as good as your weakest link, and here in the United States, this can be considered our weakest link. We strive to help bring awareness to this ongoing issue, clothe these individuals, spark change in our community and around the world!
  • This campaign is close to our hearts and we feel for these individuals, to the point that we structure our business around helping them. We have talked with many of these individuals and found that what they need most are hoodies, socks, and blankets. We decided hoodies would be a great place to start and with your help we can provide for our brothers and sisters in need. Every donation is a contribution to spark change by helping us to raise the necessary funds to clothe all of skid row. Our hoodies would help to keep them warm at night while also expressing their own individual ties to being a  "Hooligan" and raising awareness about this ongoing issue.
  • We are here to bridge the gap between society and what they would call "the needy" or "bums", who really are just people like any of us. Anyone can end up homeless, even YOU can end up homeless...Its all about circumstance. You can help us spread awareness about this issue to help these people that are simply stuck in the mud or could be dealing with mental illness, substance abuse, neglect, and lack of resources. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We did the research and in order to provide the homeless with our hoodies, we would need to raise roughly $60,000 in donations.
  • If you donate over $100, you will receive a Hoolipack Hoodie for yourself after we clothe those in need on skid row.

The Impact

  • With EVERY contribution, we are helping this social injustice that is forced upon our people. Every time a hoodie is purchased, we personally go down to skid row and talk to these individuals to hear their stories and  testimonies hoping to brighten up their day and leave them with a smile on their face knowing that someone cares enough to contribute. 
  • We aim to spark change in our community for others to get up, open your heart, and help those in need with open arms and shift their perspective on what community really is. By raising awareness about this situation we hope to open doors for people in other communities  with the same issues, starting a ripple effect.

Risks & Challenges

  • Since childhood, we have been aware of this ongoing issue and for many of us our parents would say "Don't give them any money, they might use that money to buy drugs instead of buying food or trying to survive", but honestly how can we prejudge these people without knowing what they have been through to bring them there. After all they are human just like us and deserve to be treated as such.
  • We have had to overcome naysayers or people who don't believe having something clean and warm to wear is a necessity. Our response to that is - Dignity is a basic human right.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out! Share our campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, fellow hooligans who may also share and/or contribute to this cause.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Much love to everyone who has helped thus far and those willing to continue helping us help others. Thank you for your support...until next time, remember to leave an email to stay updated!
story_txt:
About Us And Our Campaign:
 


Hoolipack Is the only clothing brand and music collective in the world that clothes any homeless person with every purchase of attire. The "Hooli" in Hoolipack stands for Hooligan, the reckless dreamer who goes against society to make sure that they are as free as possible to be themselves and achieve their dreams. We reside in the city of Los Angeles where skid row has been an ongoing issue for as long as we can remember. They say you are only as good as your weakest link, and here in the United States, this can be considered our weakest link. We strive to help bring awareness to this ongoing issue, clothe these individuals, spark change in our community and around the world!
This campaign is close to our hearts and we feel for these individuals, to the point that we structure our business around helping them. We have talked with many of these individuals and found that what they need most are hoodies, socks, and blankets. We decided hoodies would be a great place to start and with your help we can provide for our brothers and sisters in need. Every donation is a contribution to spark change by helping us to raise the necessary funds to clothe all of skid row. Our hoodies would help to keep them warm at night while also expressing their own individual ties to being a  "Hooligan" and raising awareness about this ongoing issue.
We are here to bridge the gap between society and what they would call "the needy" or "bums", who really are just people like any of us. Anyone can end up homeless, even YOU can end up homeless...Its all about circumstance. You can help us spread awareness about this issue to help these people that are simply stuck in the mud or could be dealing with mental illness, substance abuse, neglect, and lack of resources. 



What We Need & What You Get

We did the research and in order to provide the homeless with our hoodies, we would need to raise roughly $60,000 in donations.
If you donate over $100, you will receive a Hoolipack Hoodie for yourself after we clothe those in need on skid row.


The Impact

With EVERY contribution, we are helping this social injustice that is forced upon our people. Every time a hoodie is purchased, we personally go down to skid row and talk to these individuals to hear their stories and  testimonies hoping to brighten up their day and leave them with a smile on their face knowing that someone cares enough to contribute. 
We aim to spark change in our community for others to get up, open your heart, and help those in need with open arms and shift their perspective on what community really is. By raising awareness about this situation we hope to open doors for people in other communities  with the same issues, starting a ripple effect.


Risks & Challenges

Since childhood, we have been aware of this ongoing issue and for many of us our parents would say "Don't give them any money, they might use that money to buy drugs instead of buying food or trying to survive", but honestly how can we prejudge these people without knowing what they have been through to bring them there. After all they are human just like us and deserve to be treated as such.
We have had to overcome naysayers or people who don't believe having something clean and warm to wear is a necessity. Our response to that is - Dignity is a basic human right.


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out! Share our campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, fellow hooligans who may also share and/or contribute to this cause.
Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Much love to everyone who has helped thus far and those willing to continue helping us help others. Thank you for your support...until next time, remember to leave an email to stay updated!

story:
Yes We Cannibal is a new community institution in Baton Rouge.

It is a home for unrestricted and non-hierarchical cultural experimentation in the areas of art, music, food, social research, performance, and more.

Yes We Cannibal (YWC) is chartered as an incubator for exploring new forms of living.

It is a space for different people to encounter one another.

These encounters may take the form of:

  • Lectures 
  • Workshops 
  • Reading groups 
  • Food events 
  • Concerts 
  • Performances 
  • Art Exhibitions 
  • Demonstration projects, and more.

Anyone is welcome to attend and propose to lead events at Yes We Cannibal.

No one will be paid or will pay to attend or organize an event at Yes We Cannibal.

This is why we need your help.

In order for Yes We Cannibal to exist and to promote this kind of radical inclusivity, it must have no paywall. This is the only feasible way to build Yes We Cannibal here in Baton Rouge.

Baton Rouge is a complex, beautiful and important city yet it enjoys none of those visible counter-institutional art and culture sites which are common in wealthier cities like New York and Los Angeles, even New Orleans.

With this campaign, we humbly call on a giant horizontal network of micro-patrons to offer small donations to support establishing this space in a city that may be unfamiliar to you.

Why should you support us?

Ask yourself - what role have experimental cultural spaces played in your own life? How have they shaped you and your world? For us, they have been profoundly affirming and transformative. We passionately believe in their importance.

In addition to our large main space, we also have a fully functioning kitchen with new appliances, an administrative area, two bathrooms and a beautifully crafted reading room. Our front lot is large and paved as well.

Also, one length of our building runs down 16th St and we are already beginning a free public garden with flowers, fruits, vegetables and herbs.

This diversity of spaces allows Yes We Cannibal to host a wide range of events.

Our name is inspired by the early Brazilian modernist avant garde, and Oswald de Andrade's Anthropophagic Manifesto (1928) which proposed the possibility of devouring multiple opposing cultures - incorporating their strength and knowledge into something new and hybrid, rather than posing them against one another. This is our inspiration for an operational philosophy and praxis of consensual collective cultural synthesis.

Yes We Cannibal affirms the value of life and aims to support human liberation through non-hierarchical shared experimentation and the hard but joyful work of making possible worlds actual. 

 

Sample of Scheduled Programming

ONGOING (Weekly, Bi-Monthly, Monthly)

  • Sensory Engagement Lab (SEL) a free bi-weekly community technology and robotics salon and skills exchange that fosters collaboration between artists, programmers and other thinkers. Previously native to Washington DC.
  • Affect, Decoloniality and Materialisms-yet-to-come (ADAM) a weekly open reading group dealing with new texts in art, philosophy and critical theory.
  • Fine Young Cannibals an unconventional art club and salon for kids under ten to explore traditional 2d art forms as well as performance art, installation, conceptual art, zine making, etc.
  • Weekly Freak Films: Sweet Movie (1971) and Mysteries of the Organism (1973) by Dušan Makavejev, Brother from Another Planet, Cannibal Tours, Cannibal Holocaust, Keep the River on Your Right, Holy Mountain, The Act of Killing, etc​
  • Seed Saving and Plant Clipping Klatsch

PRESENTATIONS (Artist and Researcher Talks, Lectures and Performances:)

  • Bushmeat Sound featuring Dr. Thomas Stanley (Washington DC)
  • Anna Scime (Buffalo, NY), media artist and filmmaker
  • John P. Clark (New Orleans) communitarian anarchist philosopher and founder of the La Terre Institute for Community and Ecology
  • Kent Mathewson (Baton Rouge) lecture and comic-making workshop on counterculture freak comics from the 1960s and 1970s
  • Mini-Ethnographic Film Festival with Wes Shrum

WORKSHOPS /EVENTS​

  • Time/Space Fashion Runway A fashion walk-off event for aesthetic representatives from any time and space in human history, including imaginary ones. Berbers, Masai, Traditional British skinheads, Liliputians, etc
  • Gentrification-jamming Salon techniques you can use in your own backyard drawing on lessons from Hakim Bey, Angela Davis, Fred Hampton. Beetlejuice, Blaxploitation films, Key and Peele sketches and more.
  • Consent for Kids
  • "Don't let your plants send you to Attica" Workshop how to best and most carefully follow Louisiana State Act No 159 (2005)  which prohibits cultivation of more than 40 psychoactive plants, many of which are legal in all other U.S. states, and which risks punishment with a two year minimum sentence and forced labor.
  • Talking with kids of all races honestly about police and abolition
  • Mycoculture (Mushroom experiments, including foraging)
  • Heliciculture (Snail Farming)

story:
We have raised $540 as of August 7, 2021. Thank you for your support!

Veterinarians, pet groomers, breeders and large pet industry manufacturers all enjoy the benefits of having an organization that represents their interests. 

Pet owners need to have a united voice speaking for them on issues that impact them and their pets.

The Ontario Pet Owners Network is here to do just that.

Case in Point: The College of Veterinarians of Ontario has put a policy in place that unfairly restricts your access to online prescription drugs for your pets.  The Ontario Pet Owners Network is your advocate here. This policy needs to go.

Pet owners of Ontario unite! Join Today.

The Ontario Pet Owners Network is here to:

ADVOCATE 

  • Whenever and wherever policy issues are at issue.
  • Speaking to and for pet owners on policy and regulatory matters that directly impact them.

INFORM

  • As a source of reliable, authoritative information on how to be good pet owners.
  • The best advice on how to buy and care for pets.
  • Ready access to relevant research on what matters and why.

CONNECT

  • As a way to make lasting connections with other pet owners and experts.
  • A forum where pet owners can share ideas, insights, tips, and referrals.
  • As a means to access better deals on goods and services.

HELP PET OWNERS SAVE 

  • Exclusive member discounts on a wide variety of pet products.
  • Yelp-like consumer reviews to create a better sense of transparency around pet goods and services.
  • Information on convenient health, grooming, supply and other services that support the Network’s principles and members.

Join the Movement

If you share our belief that better treatment of pet owners leads to healthier lives for pets, and a better, more equitable pet industry for all, this membership is for you.

Help bring the Ontario Pet Owners Network to life and level the playing field for pet owners across Ontario.

Become a founding member today:

1-year membership at a prelaunch price of $ 30.00 (Regular Price $ 35.00)

2-year membership at a prelaunch price of $ 45.00 (Regular Price $ 70.00)

We look forward to you joining us!

To learn more about the Ontario Pet Owners Network visit OPON.ca or contact ontariopetowners@gmail.com 

If you're interested in simply supporting our cause, we'd also love to hear from you.

story:
Please help me raise money for supplies, medical help and transport. These funds will be used to help offset the thousands of dollars not covered by other means, to fly in medical supplies and fly out the injured and the bodies of those who have lost their lives.

I have many friends in Nepal that have been effected by the tragedy, several who are currently on the mountain helping with the rescue efforts.

Three major events in the last 18 months have had a devastating effect on the region

Please help me help them.

story:
Who are we?

Hello, it's lovely to meet you. 'We' are the team behind Kenilworth Arts Festival: a not-for-profit festival that takes place in Kenilworth. The festival is an entirely voluntary organisation - we come from a variety of backgrounds and are united by a desire to create something extraordinary in the green heart of Warwickshire. Our committee consists of students, teachers, editors, actors, jazz club co-coordinators, bookshop owners, musicians, clay modellers, composers, parents, pensioners and project managers. As well as enthusiasm for the arts, our members bring experience with community projects and longstanding connections to local businesses and charities.

What are we trying to achieve?

The idea behind Kenilworth Arts Festival is to offer opportunities for people of all ages to engage with the creative arts. We want to bring together some of the finest contemporary music, literature, theatre and art from across the country, as well as to offer a platform for bright local talent. Rather than confining ourselves to any particular genre or style, our line-ups strive to reflect exciting developments across the broadest spectrum of culture, exhibiting the current creative landscape at its best. We also want to use our programme as a way to ask brave questions of the world around us and encourage bold, new thinking. In short, we want to transform the historic town of Kenilworth into a hive of creative exploration; a celebration of art, imagination, innovation and community.

The inaugural Kenilworth Arts Festival took place in September 2016. The programme featured headline events, workshops and a free, outdoor event that attracted over 4,000 people. We hosted a number of award-winning, critically acclaimed artists from a variety of genres, including folk, jazz and classical music, nature writing, poetry, screen writing and human rights journalism. 

    Having laid these strong foundations, we want to grow the festival this year.  Our 2017 festival will run from the 17th - 23rd September. As well as the headline events, workshops and our outdoor event, we want to offer more events, run long-term projects with local groups, support organic community-led events and have a bigger presence in the town throughout the week and beyond. We want to do more to support original art and young artists by hosting showcase events, running competitions and encouraging collaborations.  In short, we want to grow Kenilworth Arts Festival into one of the most innovative, distinctive festivals in the region. We believe there is potential to build something truly extraordinary, particularly through our multi-genre approach and our commitment to supporting new work.

    Some comments from last year’s performers:

    •  “Run by people with a conscious desire to celebrate the writing, music, poetry and art they actually love, Kenilworth Arts is a wonderful home-grown festival with heart. (Rob Cowen, journalist and author)
    • “Kenilworth Arts Festival is fantastic. I do two or three readings a month in various different places, but this really stood out to me for the quality of the other acts, the warmth and responsiveness of the audience and the professionalism and thoughtfulness of the organisers."(Luke Kennard, poet and fiction writer)
    • “Kenilworth Arts Festival is the sort of festival I would like to go to all the time. I wish it was always there, at the end of a long drive. It has such good and noble intentions; bringing creativity and curiosity to the forefront of people's minds.” (Rachel Sermanni, folk musician)
    • “The Kenilworth Arts Festival was one of the very best events I have been involved in. Its ability to put world-class musicians and writers in front of audiences is so admirable, and there is a real feel of the festival being at the hub of this strong community.” (Jonathan Edwards, poet)

      How you can help

      We got things up and running last year. We have the ideas, as well as the long-term vision. What we need now is a boost to help us step up a level. By supporting our crowdfunding campaign, you'll be helping us to realise some of the ambitions laid out above. More materially, your support can help us to: cover costs of venue hire for fringe events, expand our line up, pay people fairly for their time and creativity, invest in better decorations (extreme yarn-bombing, anyone?), provide food and drink for our volunteers and improve the environmental impact of our events. 

      In return, you can get your hands on some rather lovely rewards. Even if you're on the other side of the world (*sings that KT Tunstall song*), we have something for you. At the very least, every backer will receive a handwritten note of thanks and will be acknowledged in the festival programme. We want to recognise and celebrate the fact that this is a team effort: if we work together, we can make something magical happen! 

      Other Ways To Get Involved

      There are plenty of ways to get involved beyond this crowdfunding campaign. If you'd like to volunteer or perform in some capacity, drop us a note at: info@kenilworthartsfestival.co.uk. There are also sponsorship opportunities for businesses - get in touch via the above address and we'll send you some more information.

We want to recognise and celebrate the fact that this is a team effort: if we work together, we can make something magical happen! Other Ways To Get InvolvedThere are plenty of ways to get involved beyond this crowdfunding campaign. If you'd like to volunteer or perform in some capacity, drop us a note at: info@kenilworthartsfestival.co.uk. There are also sponsorship opportunities for businesses - get in touch via the above address and we'll send you some more information.

story:
SEEDS_I play with Mozart in ITALIANO

SEEDS_I play with Mozart is a project implemented by Il Fuoco 1775 - AlphaArt, a cultural association created by Isaac de Martin (Italy) and Alaa Arsheed (Syria). The project SEEDS_I play with Mozart consists in a journey from Italy to Greece, retracing in reverse the Balkan route that refugees and migrants follow when trying to escape from poverty and war.

We aim to:

  • produce a high-quality music album “SEEDS”, in collaboration with professionals (refugees, migrants, locals and international artists) we meet along the way;
  • produce a documentary of the journey “I PLAY WITH MOZART”, documenting the trip in all its features;
  • create a photo-book and a logbook of the journey;
  • celebrate music and spread a message of hope - a Seed of Hope for Syria - with a final concert in Thessaloniki at the end of the tour;
  • raising awareness campaign about the refugee crisis in the Balkans.

What is AlphaArt?

Il Fuoco 1775 - AlphaArt is a grassroots artistic movement started by Isaac de Martin & Alaa Arsheed in 2015.

Il Fuoco 1775 implements a project, AlphaArt, which has the aim to propose the concept of an international Art Gallery, such as the one established by the Arsheed Family in Al Sweida (Syria), called Alpha. Alpha Art Gallery - Al Sweida was a place where arts, such as painting, music, cinema and theatre could find expression and be displayed. Alpha Art Gallery - Al Sweida hosted shows, lectures, concerts and performances by artists from all over Syria and the Middle East. Their library and literary cafe were accessible to the general public. Unfortunately in 2011 Alpha Art Gallery - Al Sweida was destroyed by a group of fanatics, snuffing out a vital platform for the arts and ending forever the artistic movement that the Arsheed family had initiated.
Il Fuoco 1775 - AlphaArt  Started in Italy  by Alaa Arsheed  and Isaac de Martin as a tool to light a fire of arts, and with time it has evolved into a tool to raise awareness about the refugee crisis. The effort is successful due to the various collaborations established with international artists and organizations.

Who are Alaa and Isaac?

Alaa Arsheed is musician and composer from Syria. Together with his brother and two sisters, he was part of a string quartet performing in Syria and in neighboring countries, such as Lebanon. Unfortunately, after the escalation of the war in Syria, Alaa and his siblings were forced to dissolve the group, but Alaa’s talent allowed him to win a sponsorship and come to Italy in 2015, where he produced his album “SHAM”.

Not long after his arrival, Alaa met Isaac de Martin as part of a music project. Isaac is a musician and composer, from the Venetian countryside (Italy). He graduated from the Conservatory and he is involved in many activities: production of music for theater and cinema, concerts with the "Adovabadan Jazz Band" - from 2005 - and the collective “Sound Illustrators”, AlphaArt cultural association, and he is about to release his new album “Construction Site”.

Together they started the collective "The Portrait" .

From the moment they met, Alaa and Isaac not only initiated a successful and fruitful artistic collaboration, but also developed a deep friendship which will now lead them across the Balkans together.

What is SEEDS_I play with Mozart?

SEEDS_I play with Mozart consists in a reverse journey along the Balkan Route, where refugee and migrants travel with the hope of starting a new life, away from poverty and war. However, SEEDS_I play with Mozart not only has the humanitarian objective of raising awareness among the international community about the situation of the refugee crisis in the Balkans, but  also has an highly relevant artistic objective. Through this project, Alaa and Isaac want to emphasize that art – especially music – can serve as a primary tool to connect people, acting as a universal language capable of destroying any physical or cultural barrier.

Let’s take a look at the specific activities SEEDS_I play with Mozart intends to implement along its journey. We will:

  • Conduct interviews with refugees and asylum seekers who tell us their stories, expectations and feelings, side by side with interviews with locals and humanitarian professionals.
  • Document the activities that SEEDS_I play with Mozart carries out both inside and outside of the refugee camps through videos and photos taken along the entire route.
  • Compose and record single tracks with international artists from all over the world during our journey.
  • Donate musical instruments, cameras, colors and painting material to the people we meet promoting the healing qualities of art.
  • Organize workshops and lessons for both adults and children (music, dance, theater, photography, painting).
  • Creating opportunities for playful activities for kids such as setting up face painting.
  • Develop artistic collaborations with local organizations and artists.
  • Organize a final concert and performance in Thessaloniki, Greece.

 

Moreover, we will take with us some apple-seeds, that we will plant at all the stepovers of our journey with the people we will meet and with whom will collaborate with us, as a sign of growing hope! In some years there will be a map of strong apple trees documenting our journey of hope from Italy down to Greece!

 

 

Where will we go and who will we meet?

SEEDS_I play with Mozart will start from Italy (Udine), and then travel across Slovenia, Hungary (Budapest), Romania (Timisoara), Serbia (Belgrade), Bulgaria (Sofia and Plovdiv), Macedonia and Greece (Thessaloniki) for 1 month, 8th August - 8th September. We are still completing the itinerary according to the meetings we are planning with the artists and the organizations that want to collaborate with us.

What We Need & What You Get
Why we need your help?

Give a little, to make a big impact! Through the participation of all, we can do something beautiful because every single donation can make a big difference!
With this tour across the Balkans, a rich mixture of exploration, adventure and music, we want to create a map of hope and beauty. This project actively contributes to a change of consciousness, giving everyone a signal that all of us can be active, even from home with just a click!
We provide a platform to those who feel silenced or tired of screaming! And we want to do it with music, giving voice to the silenced and transforming cries into songs and melodies, because this is what art does, CONNECTS!
JOIN THE CHANGE, PLANT A SEED OF HOPE!

We cannot thank you enough for supporting us in the extraordinary adventure that awaits us. Please accept a token of our appreciation and choose a reward among the amazing perks we will gladly send you!

 

What your contribution will fund

Budget Breakdown:

The money we will raise will be used to achieve different objectives:

MUSIC & DOCUMENTARY EQUIPMENT / PRODUCTION & POST-PRODUCTION (all the necessary tools artists will need to perform and to assemble once back to Italy the music album and the documentary):

  • music material (microphone) = 645 €
  • documentary material (such as video camera and related equipment 2300€, 2 hard-disks 400€) = 2700 €
  • digital album  (mix & mastering 250€/track, 10 tracks) = 2500 €
  • physical album (5€/copy, 500 copies, SIAE 200 €) = 2700 €
  • graphics album and DVD = 500 €
  • reimbursement for artists: tickets & accommodation up to 200€/person, up to 15 people = 3000 €
  • concert in Thessaloniki (service, security, stage, permits, advertising etc.. ) = 10’000€

ESTIMATED COST = 22’045 €

MATERIAL for ACTIVITIES WITH REFUGEES & LOCALS (all the necessary material in order to implement the activities we described above and to donate):

Drawing material:

  • 500 packages of colors 1750 €
  • 500 packages of albums 750 €
  • gift paper 300 €

Musical instruments & related

  • up to 20 packages for each item/instrument mentioned in the links above =  3840 €
  • games material 200 €
  • workshops material 500 €

T-shirts 250x10 € = 2500 €

ESTIMATED COST =  9’840 €

JOURNEY COSTS

  • Van rent  ( 100€/day, 30 days) = 3000 €
  • Fuel and maintenance  (1, 6 €/L, 12 km/1 L, 7500 km) = 1000 €
  • Generator 230 €
  • Food (30 days/8 people 10€/day) =  2400 €
  • Accommodation (30 days/8 people, 10€/day) = 2400 €

ESTIMATED COST =  9’030 €

ESTIMATED TOTAL COST = 40’915 €

If you wish to check the detailed costs and the supplier of the materials and instruments you can visit these websites:

  • For the musical instruments Thomann
  • Hard Disk 200 €
  • Electronic Generator 230 €
  • Music Equipment  645 €
  • Colours (1 pack, 12 colours) 3,50 €

When choosing your perk don’t forget to consult this list to check some of the prices!

We emphasize that we have chosen these items/suppliers by looking for the best value-for-money deals.

Special perks

In addition to the available gifts, you will be able to donate music and drawing material simply by not claiming any item listed. Therefore, all the donations where no reward is claimed, will be used to buy one of these items:
   5 € 1 set album + 12 colors pack
10 € 1 set album + pack 30 colors or 1 tuner
15 € 1 set of cases, plectrums and strings or 1 Harmonica
20 € 1 tambourine or ukulele or metallophone
25 € 1 xylophone
50 € 1 digital camera or small guitar

Those who decide to support SEEDS_I play with Mozart through a donation of musical or drawing material for the children we meet in the refugee camps, will receive from Alaa and Isaac a photograph of the instrument with the receiver, upon authorization of the parents or a representative.

The Impact

SEEDS_I play with Mozart would like to thank all the people who have already helped us spread the word; you are too many to mention, but you know who you are!!

A great thank to those who have trusted AlphaArt, Alaa and Isaac: well-known and important organizations, Universities and media, international artists but also national and international NGOs, and the general public who shows us enthusiasm and gives us even more motivation!

Here is a list of the institutions that have already supported SEEDS_I play with Mozart, and will continue to do so for the duration of the project:

Patronage:

  • UNHCR (United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees)
  • Campus di Forlì dell’Alma Mater Studiorum – Università di Bologna
  • Piuculture
  • Centro Astalli Roma - Jesuit Refugee Service
  • Un Ponte Per..

Media Partnership:

  • Piuculture

In collaboration with:

  • Refugee Aid Service Serbia - Serbia
  • Association on Refugees & Migrants - Bulgaria

Risks & Challenges

AlphaArt wants to ensure transparency and accountability to people who have decided to make SEEDS_I play with Mozart come true!

For this reason, we will keep you updated about the development of the project through the social media. Moreover, we will publish a fiscal and program report upon conclusion of the journey.  It will be published on AlphaArt website www.alphaart.org).

If our fundraising goal is not met, the organizing committee will examine and adjust the budget focusing on achieving a maximum number of aims and objectives to maximize project success. Example: Remove the final performance and concert from the itinerary; focusing on the donation of musical instruments and art supplies rather than cameras.

How YOU can help us

Every time you share this campaign with a friend, you help to seed this movement. Thank you SO much for sharing it with your community:

  • Share, share and share it on Facebook
  • Email it to your friends
  • Tweet about it
  • Invite your friends to the Facebook page and Facebook event
  • On Instagram

Stay tuned to our Facebook page and follow us on Instagram for more information about the journey.

Please contact us if you have skills relevant to our project (i.e. you are a musician, a film director, a ballerina/o ..), and you want to join us somewhere along the route or if you just want to find out more. We would love to hear from you. Just email info@alphaart.org.

story:
Our Story:

In the Summer of 2017 a group of gays decided they had enough and wanted to make a change. In a “gay” bar, quotations explained in a moment, that laid in an abandoned catacomb in Prague they saw a problem they were oh too familiar with back in California. The problem; another gay bar being overrun by rowdy straight bachelorette parties wooing and blocking the well, guys pawning over faceless profiles on their phones, people going up to the DJ to request more hip hop, and finally the Hot Mess Express picking up the victims of doing too many shots. This bar needed to be saved, but how do you save a gay bar? That is how Save The Gay Bar was born and we began our mission to raise, recover, and renew gay bars.

Who Are We?

Save The Gay Bar (STGB), is a collective movement to preserve the sanctuary that the gay bar symbolizes. We believe in the 3 R's of Save The Gay Bar; Raise, Recover, and Renew. 

Raise: We raise funds to support the local gay community through our events. Our events donate a percentage of all profit to local gay charities, as well as set up bars with the tools to hold frequent charitable events.

Recover: By working with us and implementing our Code of Conduct, Save The Gay Bar will work hand-in-hand  with gay bars to help them recover to their peak performance. 

 Renew: Helping gay bars create events that are centered around the local gay community and giving them a renewed sense of pride and purpose. 

What Do We Do?

STGB is a platform for bars and clubs to adopt our code of conduct that is designed to promote the core values of the gay bar, In return we help provide quality gay entertainment and events that are designed to improve revenue and attendance for the bars and clubs

How do we do this?

STGB has partnerships with  event producers, entertainers, drag queens, DJ’s and Go Go boys that allow us to provide event and entertainment to participating bars and clubs at no additional cost to the venue.  Our network of entertainers allows us to bring in high quality entertainment that help promote the STGB message.

Why should I support Save the Gay Bar?

Supporting Save The Gay Bar, as cliché as it sounds, can really help our chosen family. Gay bars are a crucial cornerstone to the gay community; they are were many learn about sex, develop their social habit, be one's true unapologetic self, and are were many form their families when biological families are not supportive and loving. In today's current climate, this is more important than ever. Supporting Save The Gay Bar means you are supporting our gay community by allowing bars to keep their doors open to serve as a home for the local gay community.

story:
Join our network to influence citizens, city leaders and urban professionals to create welcoming nighttime design in 1,000 cities in 10 years.

That is our big picture goal. We are requesting your support starting with funds to produce our Day of Light event and subsequently expand the International Nighttime Design Initiative. Nighttime Design is rooted in community-engagement methodologies while collaborating with municipal agencies, influencing policy and providing creativity from dusk to dawn.

Perks

For your incentive, the length of night, during mid-May, in each nighttime design location, represents the funds we are asking for your contribution.  Here, in the example of Berlin, there are 3:14 hours:minutes of night, or a $31 donation (rounded as Indiegogo only accepts whole numbers).   For your choice of London, there are 3:40 hours/minutes of full night, and we have accorded a $340 donation.  Each location has the same reward, an in-your-mailbox, postcard nighttime scene, from that location, plus social media shares.

London is an exception. Should you choose London, the Day of Light pocketmap will arrive in your mailbox.

<Example, Berlin hours of night>

And in our calculation, equitable community retail is priceless, or rather, $1,000.

 

Why NightSeeing for Nighttime Design Now?

The UNESCO Day of Light is a global initiative that aims to demonstrate the importance of light in our lives and the crucial role it plays in science, culture, and art, education and sustainable development, and in fields such as medicine, communications, and energy.

The NightSeeing in London event will introduce and inspire city stakeholders to Nighttime Design principles. With this occasion, it is our intent to ripple the message outward through media.

In the future, with your help, we aim to bring  unique vitality to your after-dark city with  three main objectives:

  1. Increase safety and security
  2. Improve public health
  3. Enhance economic vitality

 

<Images link to website>

This is your invitation to join the Nighttime Design network

 

 

Please share this campaign!

 

 

Thank you for your support

story:
About Us

We are a community nonprofit in a lovingly restored historic building in the Oakland Waterfront Warehouse District. Our mission: the cultivation of community, creativity, and a spark for life.

We host events geared towards art, music, dance and creativity. It’s what we love to do, and we are passionate about our community mission. For the past eight years we have dedicated ourselves to serving the Oakland community, by giving people a warm and loving place to come to for a variety of creative and community events.

  • For the past two and half years we have closed our doors and have been going through a rigorous process to get Oakland zoning to approve our building as a venue.
     

  • We now need to raise $450,000 in total to cover the construction costs for seismic retrofitting or we wont be able to reopen our doors. We are looking to raise a portion of that here on IndieGoGo with your help.

  • So we're now turning to you our strongest supporters to ask for contributions. In exchange, we're offering a variety of great perks. Your support will help us to reopen and continue to serve our community! Every single contribution counts and will make a difference.

We lovingly thank you and look forward to reopening our doors as soon as possible!  

  • What You Get

    Check out our exciting perks when you donate! 

If you are open to offering a short-term loan, please contact us at dan@radianceoak.org or visit http://radianceoak.com/wordpress/lender-propectus/

If we don't reach our entire goal we will be continuing to work on raising the money to meet zoning requirements.

As an essential component to our vision, Radiance has an ongoing art gallery for local artists.

    The difference your contribution will make:

    Your contributions will help us make the necessary changes to our building to allow us to reopen our doors and continue to serve our community.  There is a big shortage of legal and safe community spaces here in Oakland. 

    This space limitation intensified and became more painful for our community after the horrific Ghost Ship fire in the Fruitvale district of Oakland took 36 lives last fall. Since then many warehouses and gathering spaces have closed their doors. In light of this terrible tragedy we are even more committed to providing a safe and legal community space.

    • A sampling of some of our events:
      Annual Jack London Square Trash Bash • National Night Out • Oakland Government Candidate Forums • Meetings of the Jack London District Association Board • Land Use & Transportation Planning Committee Meetings • UC Berkeley Art Event • Self Defense class • Karaoke Night •  East Bay Burner Regional Board • Clothing Swap • Memorial Services • Annual Passover Seder • Belly Dancer of the Year • Halloween Celebration • Annual Community Thanksgiving • New Year Celebrations

    We have had a long road to get where we are today, working to gain the support and approval of our neighbors and of local government. We still have many hurdles to overcome, and with your support we can get there together.

    Learn more about us on our website: www.radianceoak.com

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know that sometimes, giving out money just isn’t an option... we totally understand that... and you can still help!

    Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

    • Please cross post on your Facebook feed and speak to others directly and let them know what we are up to.
    • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Keep popping online to check out our NEW Perk Items that will be added throughout our campaign .
    • Keep up to date with us on  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/radianceoak

    The Impact

    Here in the Bay Area the culture of community, artists, writers, dancers and celebrations has been a big part of our lives and we are committed to having it continue in spite of the challenges. This is so important to us because these are the things that generate good will and make people happy.

    The Very, Very Beginning:

    Radiance began eleven years with a vision hatched over lunch to find a way to create a warm and loving community space. A place for people really feel at home.

    When a warehouse in the Jack London District of Oakland became available we took over the lease. This building was nicknamed Radiance Factory. The story is that for about 50 years this historic building was the home of a French fry factory.
    We took occupancy and thus began our journey.

     

    • Keep up to date with us on  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/radianceoak

    A full description of the construction project is outlined here: http://radianceoak.com/wordpress/project-detail...

About Us
We are a community nonprofit in a lovingly restored historic building in the Oakland Waterfront Warehouse District. Our mission: the cultivation of community, creativity, and a spark for life.
We host events geared towards art, music, dance and creativity. It’s what we love to do, and we are passionate about our community mission. For the past eight years we have dedicated ourselves to serving the Oakland community, by giving people a warm and loving place to come to for a variety of creative and community events.

For the past two and half years we have closed our doors and have been going through a rigorous process to get Oakland zoning to approve our building as a venue. 
We now need to raise $450,000 in total to cover the construction costs for seismic retrofitting or we wont be able to reopen our doors. We are looking to raise a portion of that here on IndieGoGo with your help.
So we're now turning to you our strongest supporters to ask for contributions. In exchange, we're offering a variety of great perks. Your support will help us to reopen and continue to serve our community! Every single contribution counts and will make a difference.

We lovingly thank you and look forward to reopening our doors as soon as possible!  


What You Get
Check out our exciting perks when you donate! 



If you are open to offering a short-term loan, please contact us at dan@radianceoak.org or visit http://radianceoak.com/wordpress/lender-propectus/
If we don't reach our entire goal we will be continuing to work on raising the money to meet zoning requirements.


As an essential component to our vision, Radiance has an ongoing art gallery for local artists.

The difference your contribution will make:

Your contributions will help us make the necessary changes to our building to allow us to reopen our doors and continue to serve our community.  There is a big shortage of legal and safe community spaces here in Oakland. 
This space limitation intensified and became more painful for our community after the horrific Ghost Ship fire in the Fruitvale district of Oakland took 36 lives last fall. Since then many warehouses and gathering spaces have closed their doors. In light of this terrible tragedy we are even more committed to providing a safe and legal community space.
A sampling of some of our events:Annual Jack London Square Trash Bash • National Night Out • Oakland Government Candidate Forums • Meetings of the Jack London District Association Board • Land Use & Transportation Planning Committee Meetings • UC Berkeley Art Event • Self Defense class • Karaoke Night •  East Bay Burner Regional Board • Clothing Swap • Memorial Services • Annual Passover Seder • Belly Dancer of the Year • Halloween Celebration • Annual Community Thanksgiving • New Year Celebrations
We have had a long road to get where we are today, working to gain the support and approval of our neighbors and of local government. We still have many hurdles to overcome, and with your support we can get there together.


Learn more about us on our website: www.radianceoak.com

Other Ways You Can Help
We know that sometimes, giving out money just isn’t an option... we totally understand that... and you can still help!
Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Please cross post on your Facebook feed and speak to others directly and let them know what we are up to.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
Keep popping online to check out our NEW Perk Items that will be added throughout our campaign .
Keep up to date with us on  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/radianceoak


The Impact
Here in the Bay Area the culture of community, artists, writers, dancers and celebrations has been a big part of our lives and we are committed to having it continue in spite of the challenges. This is so important to us because these are the things that generate good will and make people happy.
The Very, Very Beginning:
Radiance began eleven years with a vision hatched over lunch to find a way to create a warm and loving community space. A place for people really feel at home.
When a warehouse in the Jack London District of Oakland became available we took over the lease. This building was nicknamed Radiance Factory. The story is that for about 50 years this historic building was the home of a French fry factory.We took occupancy and thus began our journey.
 


Keep up to date with us on  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/radianceoak
A full description of the construction project is outlined here: http://radianceoak.com/wordpress/project-detail...

story:
CURRENT SITUATION

At Art With Me *GNP, our mission is to be a platform for impact and change. We consider it one of our main responsibilities to help support our local communities and inspire others to do the same. Currently, Tulum is facing a food crisis due to the mandatory lockdown. Thousands of people are struggling to feed themselves and their families on a daily basis. 

 

OUR GOAL

We are proud to say that during these challenging times, so many members of our community in Tulum are embodying our mission and doing all the good they can to help those affected by this pandemic. From providing food banks, community kitchens, food care packages, building community gardens to provide nutritious food, gathering and coordinating volunteers and even collecting food for pets.

Our main goal is to support these ongoing initiatives that are contributing to feed more than 500 families by the day. The 100% of the funds raised will be destined to aid local activists and initiatives that are fighting hunger in Tulum and neighboring communities.

 

YOUR HELP

With your support 100% of the donations will go towards providing funds and products for those in need at the following initiatives:

 

Botanica Community Project

Volunteer based initiative focused in creating a community kitchen for people in extreme poverty. They cook and deliver an approximate amount of  150 daily free meals for people in marginated areas inTulum.

https://www.instagram.com/botanicacommunityproj...

 

Farm To Table in Collaboration with Makers

Their initiative has the goal to provide healthy, local sourced meals for $1 USD. Project created to support the furloughed community that depended from the tourism economy in Tulum. 

https://www.instagram.com/farmtotabletulum/

 

Tiempo de Dar by Encanto Cantina & EcoBicicletas

Free food program in support of unemployment, focused on children and adults. They currently provide 120 meals per day, delivering food through electric bikes directly to the people in need.

https://www.instagram.com/tiempo_dedartulum/

story:
Join us in marrying sports and education in a way that's never been done before.

There is something interesting about sports that we don’t often consider.  Sports connects to our lives in so many ways—not only the expected lessons of teamwork, competition and learning how to win and lose.  But, to physics.  Biology. History.  Race relations.  Medicine.  International relations. Law.  Politics.  And much more.   Thus, sports can be used as the connective tissue to provide a broad and vast story about all aspects of our world. 

The U.S. does not have a great sports museum. We have individual sport halls of fame, but nothing that brings all sports under one roof—and certainly, not in the manner we propose. 

Sports are the bait

Sports unite us. Sports excite us.  Sports are our passion.  

More than that, sports can be the bait that draws people in. Sports can bring people in to see something they love, but lead to an even greater experience that opens their eyes (and minds) to much, much more.

For example, in the baseball gallery, see Babe Ruth’s mitt and also learn the physics of a curve ball.  In the football gallery, relive Super Bowls past and also learn what an ACL is, what happens when it tears, and how it heals.  In the Olympics gallery, touch a real gold medal and hear about the 1968 Black Power salute or the Munich Massacre.  In the auto racing gallery, sit behind the wheel of a real NASCAR car and learn how a combustion engine works.  And so on.  The possibilities are limitless. 

It will not be a place to simply“walk, look and read,” but rather a venue that marries objects, knowledge, stories and interactivity in a truly engaging and exciting manner.

It will be a public-serving museum, using the latest tools of education, storytelling, and beautiful design to address some of our most interesting and pressing issues.

Disrupting the modern museum

Over the last 10-20 years, the world’s economy has been—and continues to be in explosive fashion—radically transformed.  Industries from retail to personal transportation to financial services to healthcare and countless others have undergone nothing short of a revolution.

Not museums.

Most museums, especially in Chicago, are still housed in early 20th century buildings, and many are still managed with 20th century methods.  They are about objects, not experiences.  They give information, but don’t tell stories.  They teach, but they don’t excite.  They view technology as a necessary evil.

Museums have an absolute role to improve communities.  They have a responsibility to supplement primary and secondary education.  And they can provide jobs and other economic benefits to their host cities.  

The American Sports Museum (ASM) will attempt to show the country what disruption in this field looks like; it will help define what the partnership between schools, communities, and museums will look like for the next century; it will be a museum of the future that looks very different from the museums to which we are accustomed.

Help Build the Museum of the Future

Sport is a human institution, a universal phenomenon which serves to instill a sense of belonging or meaning to many individuals lives.

Education is the silver bullet to reducing poverty and growing our economy—and education is changing before our eyes.

Join us in marrying sports and education in a way never been done before.

What we need and what you get

Eventually, you'll get a museum! 

You'll have the opportunity to be part of a museum from the ground-up.  New museums don't come along every day— this is your chance to be part of something special, something significant and something one-of-a-kind.

Check out our perks!!

For larger donations, major gifts or corporate sponsorship, please email info@americansportsmuseum.com.

The Team

The ASM team is composed of museum professionals from major Chicago museums and an experienced board of directors. Each one has a track record of success in the non-profit or business world. We've run museums before, learned many lessons, and are ready to build something spectacular.

Marc Lapides, Chief Executive Officer
Marc Lapides is a 20+ year marketing and museum professional in the great City of Chicago. Most recently, Marc was the Chief Marketing and Development Officer at Chicago’s Adler Planetarium.   Marc is a veteran of leading Chicago companies Cosi Restaurants and Redbox, and top advertising agencies Leo Burnett, DraftFCB, Razorfish and TPN (The Promotion Network).  

Board of Directors

Roger Germann, Senior Advisor 
Roger Germann is the Principal at Four Lions Strategies, a national strategic consultancy that focusses on cultural attractions. He's also is a long-term veteran of one of the nation’s top cultural institutions: Chicago’s Shedd Aquarium. For over 16 years, Roger served in a variety of positions at the Shedd, rising to the level of Executive Vice President. 

Ira Stahlberger, Senior Vice President, IMG Worldwide
Ira Stahlberger is a Senior Vice President at IMG Worldwide where he began working in 2009. At IMG, Ira helps top athletes build their brands and manage their marketing endeavors. Before joining IMG, Ira was the Senior Vice President of Strategic Partnerships at Intersport Television. With IMG, Ira has worked with a plethora of top athletes including Joe Mauer, Peyton Manning, Matthew Stafford, Terry Bradshaw, and Erin Andrews. 

Gary Cohen, Chief Executive Officer, EZLinks Golf Inc.
Gary Cohen is the Chief Executive Officer of EZLinks Golf, a PGA Tour affiliated company and the leading developer of golf course technology. A specialist in growth acceleration of consumer entertainment companies, before joining EZLinks, Gary held executive roles with AOL, Redbox, Six Degrees Capital Management, and MusicNow.    

Willie Wilkov, Chief Marketing Officer, PlayFusion
Willie Wilkov is the Chief Marketing Officer of PlayFusion, a start-up pioneering the next generation of connected interactive entertainment.  Willie is a global marketing communications executive with 20+ years of experience growing $1B brands. Prior to joining PlayFusion, Willie spent six years at Tomy International, also as Chief Marketing Officer, as VP of Marketing at the Sun-Times News Group, and Chicago ad agencies Draft and Leo Burnett. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please donate if you can.  If you can't,  that doesn't mean you can't help.  You can help spread the word about what we're up to and about this crowdfunding campaign.

ASM is a 501 (c) (3) organization and donations are tax deductible as permitted by law.  Please discuss your particular situation with your tax advisor.

story:
The Road Starts Here

At a time when shallow celebrity litters the cultural landscape, it's essential that America celebrates its writers, artists, musicians, and thinkers who expand consciousness and broaden the horizons by which people might live their most fulfilling lives.

Two such heroes of the human soul were Neal Cassady and Jack Kerouac, whose life-embracing odyssey was best captured in On the Road...Kerouac as the author, and Cassady as Dean Moriarty, the book's main character. Their freethinking ideas influence lives to this day, but their specific roles and contributions are fading from our collective memory.

It is therefore time to formally add Neal Cassady and Jack Kerouac to the pantheon of pioneers. Our proposed monument is based on Carolyn Cassady's iconic photo of friendship and joie de vivre:

 

Who We Are

  • Mark Bliesener: Director of the annual Neal Cassady Birthday Bash
  • John B Lane: Award-winning author of The Beatin' Path - a lyrical guide to lucid evolution
  • Sutton Betti: Nationally-renowned sculptor
  • You: Like us, fans of the Beats and their personal courage

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our $2,500 goal funds the creation of a 21" tall maquette, based on Sutton's sketch, that will be cast into plaster.
  • Casts of this plaster model can then serve as a source of funding for the follow-up phase: a life-sized statue. Funds raised beyond our $2,500 goal will be applied to the full-sized version.
  • Contribute $50 or more and receive an electronic version of the Cassady-Kerouac monument sketch
  • Contribute $125 and receive a customized mousepad for your computer with Sutton's portrait of Neal Cassady
  • Contribute $250 or more and receive Sutton's limited edition charcoal portrait of Neal Cassady, matted at 11x14.

The Impact

Neal Cassady grew up as a self-educated street kid in Denver, Colorado. Because of the connection Neal, Ed White, Hal Chase, and other Denver natives made with Jack Kerouac and the Beat nucleus in New York, Denver became the first main stop in On the Road, and remained a crossroads of Beat activity.

It is therefore appropriate that the monument be located in Denver, where it will:

  • Celebrate artistic innovation
  • Serve as an iconic attraction
  • Provide interactive photo opportunities

Next Steps

Creating an outdoor permanent bronze monument that serves to educate and honor takes a lot of time and therefore cost. We are breaking down the costs into two different fundraising campaigns; the first, to raise $2,500 to create a 21" tall maquette that will be cast into plaster. The second, to fund the more costly life-sized statue.

Once funded, the process of creating the life-sized bronze sculpture (based off of the maquette) will take 9-12 months. The life-sized monument will be donated to the city of Denver, where it can educate the public on these larger-than-life figures and the role they played -- and continue to play --  in our arts and culture. The permanently-installed bronze sculpture will be the only outdoor sculpture that honors these two men in a public setting.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing money isn't the only way you can be part of this exciting initiative. Please help spread the word though your direct personal and social media networks, and by using Indiegogo's share tools.

Thank you for your help!

story:
"For me, Grittah's Camp is a totally unique venue in Malawi. It's got a similar vibe to when the Old Blue Last was the coolest place to go in London. A place where everything from small local artists to big international acts come and do small and intimate, but amazing shows. It's a place for the alternative young adults to hang out, a place that is badly needed to nurture an original music and art scene in Lilongwe. I think, for Malawi, Grittah's will be one of these places that goes down in history of being, 'the place', where everyone played and started their career."  - Johan Hugo, THE VERY BEST

There aren't many places left in the world that focus their energies on promoting the talent of upcoming artists. It's not where the money is. But without such a platform, new artists have no way to develop into the valuable members of society that they may become. Malawi doesn't have a highly developed music industry as you may find in other countries, and Grittah's Camp provides one of the very few stepping stones available.

How the place looks when we have pro sound and light, during a British Council Funded concert of Gaika. Production cost £1,000 for one night. If we raise the £10,000 we'll have this quality at every event.

 

What we need

    Just as a cinema needs a screen, so does a music venue need a sound system. There currently isn't a cinema in Malawi, so we can forget about that, but there is a music venue, and we desperately need to buy our own sound system for live shows. We're not looking for the highest quality system in the world, just some speakers and microphones that give a clear sound, a drum kit that has all the parts, and cables that don't crackle and cut out. But even these basic things are very expensive in Malawi, and there is nowhere to get such goods second hand.
    We have stayed open for 2 years without our own gear, but this was much easier in the first year, when were able to call in on many favours from those in the music world, so thrilled with what we were doing. But such favours become burdensome after a point, and in our second year we've had a lot less events, due to the struggle to find the necessary equipment to put on a show. The positive side though, is that in those two years we've managed to put together a fantastic events team, as well as garnered a brilliant reputation both locally and internationally. With our own equipment we'll be able to move wholeheartedly towards out dream of having a world class music venue in Lilongwe.


   Drum kit has seen better days    
 

Who Benefits

    "One of the artists that has benefitted a lot from Grittah's Camp is me, apart from being in a band called Krazy Colours, I also perform as a solo artist. Grittah's Camp has helped me grow in music. I no longer fear whenever I want to perform, I now go place to place within and outside Lilongwe, it has given me courage to work extra hard. It has helped me to meet a lot of big artists who encourage and teach many things I didn't know. Grittah's Camp has brought big artists to perform in a ghetto area like CCDC-Chilinde, and has given hope to a lot of people, especially the community. They have a chance to watch big artists, international artists and even upcoming artists. Grittah's Camp is just like a second home to me." - Cynthia Phiri, KRAZY COLOURS

Krazy Colours have grown massively through playing over 20 concerts at Grittahs. They're a unique, all girl rock band, who all come from the area. Here shooting a music video for 'Moyo Wanga' - My Life

   I decided I wanted to be a musician when I was 20, and during those first years, I played two to three nights a week at open mic events, and small concerts around London. On the other side of the spectrum you have The Beatles, who played 5 nights a week in Berlin for 2 years, which is how they became so good. It can't be underestimated how important it is for musicians to play in front of an audience in order to develop. When I arrived in Malawi there was no such thing as an open mic. It was through such an event, that we started, that Madalitso Band were discovered, who are now touring the world through their music. By putting on regular shows for younger artists, we offer them a space to grow, as well as to connect with new audiences.
    There are also not may places around that are capable of bringing together such a wide demographic of people. There are nights at Grittah's Camp where a Norwegian Ambassador may be sitting next to a shoe shine boy from the ghetto, where a world famous jazz musician shares the stage with a young hip hop artist. The fact that we're located just at the edge of the ghetto is very important. The people from the area had no option to see cultural events before we opened, but because it's also not far from town, the middle class folks also love to come, as it's a way of getting back to their roots. Music bringing people together!


    

 

   "Grittahs Camp is a beautiful combination of art, culture and music. It's an amazing platform for all musicians, upcoming, local, and international. It is the perfect place to meet new people and interact with the community while enjoying the rhythms and sounds of Malawi." - Yolanda Ng'oma LAKE OF STARS FESTIVAL
    

    Apart from putting on music, theatre, dance and poetry events, Grittah's also runs an affordable rehearsal space, conducts workshops with local schools, and as the venue grows, we hope to build a library, have music camps, record and produce live show dvds, and eventually become the first ghetto spot in Malawi to have free Wi-Fi.

 Rewards

    If you're new to crowdfunding, it works on the principle that you give us some of your hard earned money, and in return, you're able to support something that you believe in. In addition we offer certain rewards that are unique to the particular project. Since it's a music venue, these rewards will be things such as free entry to events, downloads of a compilation of music from bands that play here, t-shirts, having a room in the venue named after you, and free hire of the space for your family and friends, with a band of your choosing.
    Anything you can manage to support us with will be greatly appreciated. In addition to money, just the fact that you're reading this is amazing, and if you are inspired, please share with your contacts, as it's like this that the campaign will grow, and that we'll have a chance of making our dreams a reality.

 

T-shirts can come in a variety of colours, with a simple text on the back. 

    Risks and Challenges
    
    Running a music venue in Lilongwe is a risk in itself, and having our own equipment will surely bring in new challenges. Number one of these will be to make sure the equipment is well maintained, so that it can keep functioning for many years to come. Since we have built ourselves a solid events team of people knowledgable and experienced when it comes to live sound, we're sure we'll be able to achieve this. The equipment will be kept in our safe lock up at the camp, and only used by our highly trained and careful personnel.
    Another challenge will actually be to acquire the equipment, as there is only one music shop in the whole city. We've been in there several times recently, and have picked out exactly what we need. There are other things that we'll have to get from South Africa, but we also have reliable people to bring such things over. 
 

Legendary South African bluesman Albert Frost being interviewed by Rainbow TV

"Performing at Grittah's Camp was the best experience we had in Malawi. The audience welcomed us with a warm heart. We sang and danced along together. It was such a great day. I will remember it for years" - Fuyuki Hiroyoshi, IYCO & KAKA FURAHA

 

Equipment List

Sub speakers x 2 - £1,450

Top speakers x 2 - £750

Monitors x 2 - £750

Amps for subs, tops & monitors- £1,750

Drum kit - £1,850

Cables, mics & stands - £800

Mixer - £750

Guitar Amp - £400

Bass Amp - £500

£9,000

 

In addition to this campaign, we've also been reaching out to PA companies in the UK, to see if there is any equipment we can source this way. It may be that we use the money raised by this campaign to transport goods over here. Whichever saying happens we'll be 100% transparent how any money raised is used. 

 

If we manage to raise above the target there are so many things we can do. The first priority will be to set ourselves up for recording of live shows. This means improving our lighting, getting a digital mixer and a few go pro cameras. Then we go towards our future dream of getting better quality recording done of live music in the country. Other than that, with daily power cuts, we'd love to be totally solar powered, again, a big cost. More money will also mean more opportunities for outreach projects with the local community, as there is no music or art education in the schools in the ghetto

 

Thanks once again for being with us on this journey. We'll keep you updated with the progress of the campaign, and beyond that with all things at Grittah's Camp. It's been an incredible journey so far, and the future is an open road.
story_txt: "For me, Grittah's Camp is a totally unique venue in Malawi. It's got a similar vibe to when the Old Blue Last was the coolest place to go in London. A place where everything from small local artists to big international acts come and do small and intimate, but amazing shows. It's a place for the alternative young adults to hang out, a place that is badly needed to nurture an original music and art scene in Lilongwe. I think, for Malawi, Grittah's will be one of these places that goes down in history of being, 'the place', where everyone played and started their career."  - Johan Hugo, THE VERY BESTThere aren't many places left in the world that focus their energies on promoting the talent of upcoming artists. story:
Background

Womanby Street and Cardiff's live music scene is under threat. We have just lost 3 venues in 4 months and for us, the closure of The Full Moon was the last straw. 

Creative Republic of Cardiff is made up of former staff and friends of The Full Moon. We believe that the venue, and the cultural heartbeat it adds to our city, are worth saving and developing. 

We have taken on the lease of The Full Moon's building and we won't let it die - the downstairs venue was viable, and it's vital. But we need your help and this is just the beginning. 

The details

We now have the keys, we're signing the lease and are getting ready to open.

You contribution will go towards securing the lease, licensing, legal fees, and various costs associated with opening as a fully functioning venue.

The previous venue was viable, however it became clear that it needs to be a non-profit, community-focused music & arts space, in order to realise its full potential. 

Additional funds will allow us to improve the venue, carry out maintenance and provide us with basic working capitol. 

Creative Republic of Cardiff will use the venue to establish an environment of collaboration, networking and knowledge sharing. It will nurture, develop, organise and showcase talent from Cardiff and beyond. 

Please note that all donations of any size also receive a Moon badge. 

If you would like to discuss any aspect of the campaign in more detail please email lizhunt1980@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

A completely new and unique concept, Borneo Bengkel: Hornbill and Elephant is a creative exchange hosted by HAUS KCH, Sarawak’s first creative community hub, and conceptualised by Catama Borneo, a social enterprise and design house showcasing the work of indigenous artisans.

It is a highly ambitious grassroots project created by young, energised and passionate community-builders who want to develop and showcase the creative potential of Indigenous Borneon artists, musicians, craft makers and performers.

Part of What About Kuching Festival, a month-long community created celebration of all that Kuching has to offer, Borneo Bengkel runs from 16 - 22 October 2017.  The project will feature an artist residency with 30 collaborators from Sabah and Sarawak, anthropology talks, story-telling sessions and exhibitions alongside an art market, creative masterclasses, art demos, live performances and Sup4Good, a crowd-sourced micro-financing event.

Borneo Bengkel aims to highlight the talent of Sarawak and Sabah, to build strong networks between artisans, craft makers and creative practitioners and present exciting and expressive new works to a diverse audience.

We want this project to have a lasting legacy and empower indigenous artisans with their creative identity. We hope you can join us in making this happen!

What We Need & What You Get

Completely self-funded, Borneo Bengkel is reaching out to you to help support this exciting endeavor.We are working hard to secure funds for the programme, but urgently need to raise enough to cover transport costs for our artisans who are travelling from all over Malaysia, as well as feed and house them and provide art materials and tools!

  • We need to cover the flights of 24 artists travelling from jungles, towns and cities across Malaysia, provide them with accommodation  and buy pens, paper and paint to help us make new work.
  • Sada Borneo, the famous Bornean band who represented Malaysia on Asia's Got Talent want to come to Kuching to play. Help us to raise funds to fly 9 of them from Penang!
  • In return for your financial support we can offer a number of perks. From Borneo Bengkel merchandise to original art works, discounted tickets and VIP passes, we have gifts and incentives for big and small donations, from local and international supporters!
  • Every penny will go towards supporting the artists involved in this programme and getting the wheels in motion for this creative exchange.

The Impact

As the elders of Borneo age and pass away, we believe Borneo Begkel is a timely inititiave to help preserve and invigorate Borneo's creative and cultural heritage before it is lost forever.

  • Borneo is a hugely diverse island, steeped in mystery and stories of dense jungles, wild orangutans and colourful tribes.
  • However in modern times the beauty and ingenuity of our culture and art is in danger of becoming extinct.
  • Borneo Bengkel will connect young artists, performers, craft makers and anthropologist who are all working hard in their field, and create a new dialogue and network on contemporary Bornean identity.
  • Conceptualised by Catama Borneo, an award-winning social enterprise with a strong track-record for community building and craft development, our partners and collaborators have dedicated years to their craft.
  • Check out our social media to learn more about Borneo Bengkel, our collaborators, and to see the amazing work they create at www.facebook.com/hauskch

 

Lets Make This Happen!

  • Each and every donation big or small will help us to achieve our goal
  • For those of you outside Malaysia, foreign currency and a strong exchange rate will have even extra impact! 
  • Please, Please, Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about Borneo Bengkel. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools too

Together we can do this, Aramite and Oooooo Haaaaa to one and all!
