story:
Who We Are

  • Alberta Printmakers is a non-profit, artist-run centre in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, that cultivates an inclusive and collaborative environment to:

    • learn about printmaking,

    • to create and exhibit contemporary print-based media, and

    • to pursue exciting artistic opportunities.

  • We do this through:

    • Our studio facility and professional exhibition space for artists to create and showcase traditional and contemporary print-based media

    • Offering quality hands-on instructional workshops for all experience levels

    • Public artist talks and exciting community events

    • Seeking and providing opportunities for artistic growth and development

Visit our website and follow us to learn more.

 

Our Fundraising Vision

  • Fundraising and donations are vital sources of A/P Revenue.

  • This year, in celebration of A/P's 30th, we've launched this indiegogo campaign as a way for us to say THANK YOU, and GIVE BACK to our VALUED DONORS

    • check out the combination of donation perks in the sidebar.

  • Your donation dollars help to:

    • ​STRENGTHEN A/P's quality artistic programming;

    • SUPPORT artist/writer fees for exhibitions, artist talks, and essays;

    • ENSURE that workshop and studio rental fees remain low and accessible;

    • ASSIST A/P'S ability to offer FREE PUBLIC lectures, demo's and print events;

    • BUILD A/P's capacity to create exciting professional opportunities for artists;

    • SUSTAIN A/P's operations for the years to come.

Every donation counts, and we are so very grateful for all of the support that we receive.  
 

 

Campaign Perks

A/P Swag and Original Mini Prints

  • We've launched a brand new logo and are giving away our new buttons and bags

  • Many perks packages also include original mini prints created by A/P members, showcasing a broad range of styles and techniques including but not limited to: letterpress, silkscreen, etching, intaglio, lithography, and relief.

 

FUTUROLOGY Portfolio Prints 

  • A tradition among print studios including A/P, limited edition print portfolios are often created to celebrate anniversaries and to showcase exceptional work by current members.

  • The portfolios, and the prints within them, become treasured pieces of local and regional print history, containing works by many artists who rise to become notable in their medium.

Prior A/P anniversary portfolios for example, include works by well-known artists and former directors and members such as D. Helen Mackie RCA and Bill Laing RCA, among others.

  • Each of the 25 artists participating in this year's FUTUROLOGY portfolio were selected by an independent juror with expertise in original works on paper that are each 11" x 15" in size.

  • The full list of artists is provided below, and includes university instructors and other established and emerging professional artists.  

Kate Baillies  /  Marnie Blaire  /  Carole Bondaroff  /  Katie Marie Bruce
April Dean  /  Graeme Dearden  /  Nicole Edmond  /  Alison Frank  /  K. Gwen Frank
Iren Gibson  /  Trevor Gieske  / Jacqueline Huskisson  /  Heather Huston
Eveline Kolijn  /  Irena M. Konguswan  /  Cate Kuzik  /  Heather Leier
Carol Mannas  /  Shinobu Mitsuhashi  /  Sara Norquay  / Carrie Phillips-Kieser
Ryan Statz  /  Robert Truszkowski  / Heather Urness  / Tracy Wormsbecker

 

Limited Edition Printed FUTUROLOGY Posters

 

  • To commemorate A/P's Anniversary Portfolio, A/P artist and board member Kellen Spencer has designed and printed a limited edition poster.

  • This poster incorporates reduction linocut and photopolymer techniques and was printed on A/P's Vandercook Proof Press.

 

Thank you for supporting A/P's lasting impact

After 30 years, A/P remains committed to supporting artistic excellence, inspiring artistic growth, and fostering community through printmaking.

In 2016 - 2017 alone:

  • A/P hosted 11 workshops, 12 exhibitions, (including 6 satellite exhibitions for emerging artists), paid $25,967 to visual artists and writers, and served an estimated 2437 visitors through our doors;

  • Partnered with Loft 112 to create a highly successful artist-book project entitled Print(ed) Word that was funded by Canada Council for the Arts, and is now permanently installed in Calgary's landmark New Central Library;

  • Began expanding our workshops to include letterpress, and polymer plate making thanks to equipment donated by the University of Calgary, and the Banff Centre.
     

  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by sharing the campaign with you friends and family or volunteer with us!

Check out our website or send us an email for more information.

You can also keep up to date by following us on social media: 

                  
 



  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 


A/P would like to thank our sponsors, funders and

supporters:


Indiegogo Campaign Sponsors


                                      


A/P Funders 

          

 

Additional Thanks

 

We also acknowledge the support of the Canada Council for the Arts for funding Alberta Printmakers' transition to non-toxic printmaking practices and adding letterpress and polymer plate making capabilities to our studio.

Nous remercions le Conseil des arts du Canada de son soutien.

 

PLUS, a very special thank you to Ian Gregory, Jasmine Atay, Kate Baillies and Penny Colton for the photography in this description, to Kellen Spencer for designing the FUTUROLOGY limited edition poster, and to  Ian Martin Gregory from Feast Letterpress for creating the promotional video.

  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
story_txt:
Who We Are


Alberta Printmakers is a non-profit, artist-run centre in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, that cultivates an inclusive and collaborative environment to:

learn about printmaking,
to create and exhibit contemporary print-based media, and
to pursue exciting artistic opportunities.



We do this through:

Our studio facility and professional exhibition space for artists to create and showcase traditional and contemporary print-based media
Offering quality hands-on instructional workshops for all experience levels
Public artist talks and exciting community events
Seeking and providing opportunities for artistic growth and development



Visit our website and follow us to learn more.


 
Our Fundraising Vision

Fundraising and donations are vital sources of A/P Revenue.

This year, in celebration of A/P's 30th, we've launched this indiegogo campaign as a way for us to say THANK YOU, and GIVE BACK to our VALUED DONORS

check out the combination of donation perks in the sidebar.



Your donation dollars help to:

​STRENGTHEN A/P's quality artistic programming;
SUPPORT artist/writer fees for exhibitions, artist talks, and essays;
ENSURE that workshop and studio rental fees remain low and accessible;
ASSIST A/P'S ability to offer FREE PUBLIC lectures, demo's and print events;
BUILD A/P's capacity to create exciting professional opportunities for artists;
SUSTAIN A/P's operations for the years to come.



Every donation counts, and we are so very grateful for all of the support that we receive.   
 

Campaign Perks
A/P Swag and Original Mini Prints


We've launched a brand new logo and are giving away our new buttons and bags
Many perks packages also include original mini prints created by A/P members, showcasing a broad range of styles and techniques including but not limited to: letterpress, silkscreen, etching, intaglio, lithography, and relief.

 
FUTUROLOGY Portfolio Prints 


A tradition among print studios including A/P, limited edition print portfolios are often created to celebrate anniversaries and to showcase exceptional work by current members.
The portfolios, and the prints within them, become treasured pieces of local and regional print history, containing works by many artists who rise to become notable in their medium.

Prior A/P anniversary portfolios for example, include works by well-known artists and former directors and members such as D. Helen Mackie RCA and Bill Laing RCA, among others.

Each of the 25 artists participating in this year's FUTUROLOGY portfolio were selected by an independent juror with expertise in original works on paper that are each 11" x 15" in size.
The full list of artists is provided below, and includes university instructors and other established and emerging professional artists.  

Kate Baillies  /  Marnie Blaire  /  Carole Bondaroff  /  Katie Marie BruceApril Dean  /  Graeme Dearden  /  Nicole Edmond  /  Alison Frank  /  K. Gwen FrankIren Gibson  /  Trevor Gieske  / Jacqueline Huskisson  /  Heather HustonEveline Kolijn  /  Irena M. Konguswan  /  Cate Kuzik  /  Heather LeierCarol Mannas  /  Shinobu Mitsuhashi  /  Sara Norquay  / Carrie Phillips-KieserRyan Statz  /  Robert Truszkowski  / Heather Urness  / Tracy Wormsbecker
 
Limited Edition Printed FUTUROLOGY Posters
 

To commemorate A/P's Anniversary Portfolio, A/P artist and board member Kellen Spencer has designed and printed a limited edition poster.
This poster incorporates reduction linocut and photopolymer techniques and was printed on A/P's Vandercook Proof Press.

 
Thank you for supporting A/P's lasting impact
After 30 years, A/P remains committed to supporting artistic excellence, inspiring artistic growth, and fostering community through printmaking.
In 2016 - 2017 alone:

A/P hosted 11 workshops, 12 exhibitions, (including 6 satellite exhibitions for emerging artists), paid $25,967 to visual artists and writers, and served an estimated 2437 visitors through our doors;
Partnered with Loft 112 to create a highly successful artist-book project entitled Print(ed) Word that was funded by Canada Council for the Arts, and is now permanently installed in Calgary's landmark New Central Library;
Began expanding our workshops to include letterpress, and polymer plate making thanks to equipment donated by the University of Calgary, and the Banff Centre. 

  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Other Ways You Can Help
You can also help by sharing the campaign with you friends and family or volunteer with us!
Check out our website or send us an email for more information.
You can also keep up to date by following us on social media:                    
  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

A/P would like to thank our sponsors, funders and

supporters:

Indiegogo Campaign Sponsors                                      

A/P Funders  


          

 

Additional Thanks

 
We also acknowledge the support of the Canada Council for the Arts for funding Alberta Printmakers' transition to non-toxic printmaking practices and adding letterpress and polymer plate making capabilities to our studio.
Nous remercions le Conseil des arts du Canada de son soutien.
 
PLUS, a very special thank you to Ian Gregory, Jasmine Atay, Kate Baillies and Penny Colton for the photography in this description, to Kellen Spencer for designing the FUTUROLOGY limited edition poster, and to  Ian Martin Gregory from Feast Letterpress for creating the promotional video.
  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sarah DeWoskin . I am a Jewish educator in South Florida and the Director and Founder of LCM. I am a mom to an almost 13 year old and twin 10 year olds. I am a student, gaining my masters in Jewish educational leadership through HUC-JIR . I am a passionate human being working to change my little corner of the world and I would love your help!

A tiny home craze has hit our nation and it's about to hit the Jewish community, not with tiny kitchens and bathrooms, but with unique pieces of a Jewish children’s museum where kids can climb aboard and explore!

LEV has the capability of making an enormous difference; In helping more people find a connection to their Judaism, in infusing added creativity into traditional institutions and in offering a setting where all families, regardless of background, can explore Jewish culture. 

What We Need, What You Get & The Impact

In order to build LEV’s first tiny home, I need to raise $250,000. I have currently raised $100,000. I am looking for someone who is willing and able to take a leap… to financially support something not yet fully proven, to trust in the power of passion and innovation.

Are you someone who cares about the Jewish people, about people travelling along their own Jewish paths, and about the importance of people working to better this world? Please help us reach our goal of building LEV’s first tiny home, of effecting change in our little corner of the world and far beyond!

As a Rabbi’s kid, a Rabbi's wife, and an educator who spent the last 20 years working in various Jewish settings I believe in the importance of legacy institutions. I also have this passion burning inside of me for this startup being my way of engaging more people in writing their Jewish stories. LEV is a mode of collaboration between innovation and tradition. We are all out for the same goal and need to work together. 

Giving a gift to LEV Children’s Museum is one way to make your mark in ensuring that the Jews of today and tomorrow have opportunities for hands-on Jewish exploration; of making your mark as a pioneer of this startup that will work tirelessly toward an exciting and engaging Jewish future for our children.

Other Ways You Can Help

 I hope you can see the potential in this exciting venture. Please share this link and spread the word about LEV. If you would like to learn more, please reach out to me!

Thank you for your time and for helping bring this innovation to life!

story:
Hallo, liebes Rock&RollBar-Publikum

 

Vorab möchte die RRB bei dieser Gelegenheit allen danken, die als Besucher oder als Veranstalter seit Jahren dazu beigetragen haben, die Location zu unterstützen!!!

 ★ In Sachen Stimmung und positiven Vibes seid ihr unschlagbar ★

Wer die RRB noch nicht kennt und sich selbst noch kein Bild machen konnte, dem sei gesagt:

Die RRB wurde zusammen mit der Skatehalle im Jahre 2006 eröffnet. Alles wurde in Eigenarbeit und mit geringen Budget errichtet. Idealismus war und ist die treibende Kraft.

Die Kombination von Skatehalle und Musik-Club im ersten Stock einer ehemaligen Fabrikhalle macht die Location einzigartig in Karlsruhe und auch weit darüber hinaus... 

Nicht nur der besondere Flair der Halle, auch die verschiedenen Veranstaltungen tragen dazu bei, dass immer wieder aufs Neue eine tolle Atmosphäre und eine super Stimmung entsteht.

Neben (teilweise) internationalen hochkarätigen Topacts, wird hier vor allem der regionalen Musikszene und ihrem Nachwuchs eine Bühne geboten, die auch schon europaweit erfolgreiche Künstler hervorbrachte!!!

    ♪♫ Egal ob Goa, Reggae/Dancehall, Techno, Drum&Bass, usw. ♫♪

Alle Veranstaltungen finden in einer friedlichen, eher familiärer Umgebung statt und ist geprägt von Toleranz und Offenheit...

Auch in der überregionalen Skateboardszene ist die Halle sehr beliebt, was sich bei spektakulären Contests mit Teilnehmern aus ganz Deutschland immer wieder zeigt.

Ein Ort für Subkultur, der aus Karlsruhe eigentlich nicht mehr wegzudenken ist!!!

_____________________________________________________________________________

Nun gibt es jedoch seit bestehen der RRB immer wieder Probleme mit den Nachbarn aufgrund der LAUTSTÄRKE...

_____________________________________________________________________________

Dieser Konflikt droht zu eskalieren, und kann dazu führen, daß der Club schließen muss, falls nicht in absehbarer Zeit eine Verbesserung des Schallschutzes gewährleistet wird!

In der Vergangenheit wurden schon mindestens 6000 Euro für Schallschutzmaßnahmen an der Fassade investiert!

Die verbliebene Schwachstelle ist nur noch das Dach. Hierzu erfordert es eine aufwändige Konstruktion, um effektiv den Schall zu dämmen.

Diese Deckenkonstruktion wird daher sehr kostspielig und ist alleine von der RRB leider nicht zu stemmen.

Es handelt sich um mindestens 6500 Euro, die für das Vorhaben benötigt werden.

Diese Summe deckt nur den Materialaufwand!!!

Die handwerkliche Arbeit wird in bewährt solider Eigenarbeit getätigt und es entstehen dadurch keine weiteren Kosten (für Handwerker o.Ä.).

Baubeginn soll direkt nach erfolgreichem Kampagne-Ende erfolgen. Ca. 3 Wochen Bauzeit sind geplant. 

▁ ▂ ▃ ▄ ▅ ▆ Jetzt seit ihr gefragt! ▆ ▅ ▄ ▃ ▂ ▁

Wollt ihr euren Teil zum Erhalt und Optimierung der RRB beitragen? 

Durch eine Spende könnt ihr dafür sorgen, dass die RRB der Szene noch viele weitere Jahre erhalten bleibt und dass wir auch weiterhin ausgelassen feiern können!!!

Eure Spende soll aber nicht "umsonst" sein und nur dem guten Zweck dienen, ihr bekommt je nach Höhe der Zuwendung ein attraktives Dankeschön in Form von sogenannten "Perks".

 ▶ Was genau dahinter steckt, könnt ihr unter der Rubrik "Perks" erfahren :) 

Falls mehr Spenden generiert werden, als für den Schallschutz erforderlich, könnte für die Zukunft in eine noch bessere Musikanlage und in neue Deko, Lichttechnik usw. investiert werden!!!

Wer nicht Online spenden kann bzw. möchte, der kann auch gerne vor Ort mit einer Spende dazu beitragen, dass dieser Club weiterhin in Karlsruhe bestehen bleibt! 

Durch teilen der Kampagne auf den gängigen sozialen Netzwerken und durch Mundpropaganda könnt ihr ebenfalls dazu beitragen, dass diese Aktion ein Erfolg wird!!!

Leider könnt ihr hier bei Indiegogo nur mit Kreditkarte und Apple Pay spenden. Wer keine Kreditkarte hat, aber die Überweisung trotzdem Online tätigen möchte, kann auch gerne seine Spende direkt auf das Konto der Rock&RollBar überweisen!

Natürlich bekommt auch jeder, der eine Bargeld Spende vor Ort oder eine Onlinespende direkt auf das RRB-Konto tätigt, das "Dankeschön" wie es hier angeboten wird!

Bankverbindung: Mathias Stäudlin, Postbank Karlsruhe, IBAN: DE22 6601 0075 0446 8157 54, BIC: PBNKDEFF,  Stichwort "Schallschutz"

Vielen Dank schonmal für eure Unterstützung und auf weitere unvergessliche Jahre!!! ❤

Euer Rock&RollBar-Team

story:
STABLE was co-founded by Caitlin Teal Price, Tim Doud and Linn Meyers, in the Fall of 2015.

The three co-founders are visual artists who are living and working in Washington, DC, which gives them a unique perspective on the STABLE studio project.  To date, they’ve secured a ten-year lease on a 10,000 square foot space have raised over $250,000, thus successfully growing STABLE from the brainchild of three passionate artists into a non-profit with the potential to address some the greatest needs of the DC visual arts community. STABLE is currently slated to open its doors in late fall of 2018.

Exterior of the STABLE complex.

STABLE is crucial for the DC visual arts community. It’s not simply a collection of artists, or a physical space,

It is the nexus.

STABLE is the point of possibility where artists with a variety of backgrounds and experiences, working in a range of mediums, can come together to create something so much larger than the sum of the parts. We are committed to taking actionable steps to support and foster a community of artists which reflects the city in which we live. The studios will be dedicated to visual artists of different ages, socio-economic backgrounds, ethnicities, career trajectories, genders, sexuality, and artistic practices. 

Rendering of artist studio space. 

Outward Facing Programming

STABLE will feature an 1100 square foot gallery that will be open to the public. The gallery space will present cutting edge contemporary art exhibitions in collaboration with partnering local and national art institutions. Additionally, the gallery space will serve as a hub for enriching community and neighborhood events and programs. 

next steps... 

STABLE needs to raise another $250,000 for start-up costs including: architectural fees, development of an online artists studio application process, and launch of an executive director search.    

The Gallery, under construction.

Join our story now! 

From day one we've been relying upon the generous support of everyday people who are concerned and invested in making a difference in the arts and in their communities.  We hope you will join in and help us reach our goal!

STABLE is a 501(c)(3) non- profit organization. Donations are fully tax deductible for the amount allowed by law. All donations go directly to supporting STABLE and the growth of arts in Washington, DC.
 

If  interested in corporate sponsorship, monthly donations, or one time gifts in excess of $500 please contact us directly at info@stablearts.org.

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

What if we could create spaces in Black communities across the country that would train and develop Media, Arts & Technology creatives and air their creative work on BOP TV generating revenue and growing the neighborhood around it by creating jobs and driving entrepreneurship?

This is being done not to drive gentrification but instead allows people to see their neighborhood through new eyes... To be inspired. 

BOP TV started in 2013 and over the last 8 years, it has been an amazing ride! We grew to almost 2 million daily viewers  worldwide and became the largest Black owned streaming network in the world.

WHY A CAMPAIGN?

We have been renting from various property owners for 8 years. Now we have a chance to give our little piece of magic a permanent home. The School District has agreed to sell us the building and we are under contract. That means we'd not only have a permanent space but the ability to build out an incredible studio facility to support Media, Arts & Technology training, productions and events.  We tried Indiegogo many years ago and while we did not have great success at that time, we learned a lot. We pulled a team together that we feel will do a great job helping us with the campaign.

THE DETAILS

To buy our building, we just need just $35,000 more to cover our down payment. By pitching in to our campaign, you will get access to some pretty amazing perks and a chance to ensure that this amazing space can thrive.

We really appreciate your consideration and support in this important effort. We have to raise the full $35,000 (or more!) and we only have 30 days to make it happen!

WHO IS BOP TV?

Those familiar with BOP TV know that it is much more than a streaming network. We are a place where people can explore their gifts, build community with others and invest in our folks. BOP TV also provides Media, Arts and Technology training for all ages with a focus on youth. 

        

 

 

There are not enough spaces where we can see and experience the fullness of Black Joy everyday. With 30+ channels covering everything from HBCU's to Business, to Movies and our own retail merchandise shop, our community comes together and shows out!

 

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING...

 

 

 

HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?

Besides donating, we need your help to spread the word. Indiegogo has some great tools that allow you to share the campaign with folks in your network and challenge people to match your gift. Please pass this on to any contacts or social media groups that you think want to support innovation driven by our community. Most of all send us good vibes and energy!

BOP TV also provides Media, Arts and Technology training for all ages with a focus on youth.           There are not enough spaces where we can see and experience the fullness of Black Joy everyday. With 30+ channels covering everything from HBCU's to Business, to Movies and our own retail merchandise shop, our community comes together and shows out! WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING...   HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?Besides donating, we need your help to spread the word. Indiegogo has some great tools that allow you to share the campaign with folks in your network and challenge people to match your gift. Please pass this on to any contacts or social media groups that you think want to support innovation driven by our community. Most of all send us good vibes and energy!

story:
The Avant Garden has played host to hundreds of events in its first year, providing a platform and gathering space for people of all ages. 

We showcase local artists by creating an environment where people of all mediums can express themselves through art shows, pop up shops, workshops & more!                                                           

The space is also providing rehearsal time, studio time for recording artists and opportunities for musicians of all genres to perform. 

Thank you to everybody for your support and we have exciting plans for the future!

story:
Our Story

Critical Mass: A Centre for Contemporary Art is a small volunteer-run nonprofit arts organization based in Port Hope, Ontario. We believe that art is for everyone and should be accessible.  

Critical Mass seeks out, creates and brings inclusive, socially-aware and engaging contemporary art experiences to Port Hope. We do this because we believe that active participation in the arts will help redefine and shape the cultural vibrancy of our community, and have a positive impact on our collective health & well-being.

This summer, Critical Mass will explore the ephemeral world of role playing games! We will explore why role-playing games, especially Dungeons & Dragons (D&D), are currently having a pop culture moment and enjoying a resurgence into the mainstream and current zeitgeist.

CRITICAL MASSIVE ADVENTURE is a summer series of artist-led workshops and an epic one-day festival of storytelling, performance, adventure and imagination through the lens of contemporary art. 

But... We need YOUR HELP to crowdfund $20,000 towards this Critical Massive Adventure!  

The Impact of your support

We believe that this festival will engage more youth, more members of the LGBTQ+ community, and will create inter-generational connections in our community, reflecting a sense of belonging and connection through collective storytelling.

Role playing games offer a level playing field to explore emotions, concepts and scenarios through your 'character' in a low stakes, safe environment. They are an inclusive way for participants to connect as a community and feel a sense of confidence and belonging.  We want to be able to create this opportunity for our community. 

Watch what these D&D players have to say about why they love role playing games.

 

 

More about CRITICAL MASSIVE ADVENTURE

Our summer series of artist-led workshops will explore an intro to D&D and role play games, character and world building, escape room development, costume making, zine creation, and some fun D&D themed crafts for kids.

At the festival, we have an epic day planned, including:

  • A Live Action D&D Performance in our charming small town bandshell - created by and featuring Ed Greenwood as the Dungeon Master!
  • Community D&D Tournament in the park
  • Artist Panel Discussions
  • RPG & D&D Demo Tables
  • Live Action Drawing & Zine Creation 
  • Cardboard Kingdom 
  • Cosplay Makers Zone
  • Escape Room / Dungeon
  • Art Exhibit of D&D Ephemera
  • Artist and Artisan Marketplace
  • Food, Music and more! 
    ... and when the sun sets, continue the adventure with us on a...
  •   19+ Cosplay Pub Quest throughout downtown Port Hope!

For more info, visit the festival site: massiveadventure.criticalmassart.com

Our Challenge

Critical Mass is a small volunteer run arts organization that does not receive operating funding.  We rely solely on small project grants, and sponsorship from local businesses to help cover the cost of expenses needed to run our programs and festivals. 

This year, we are feeling the pinch of cutbacks to these smaller grant streams. So, we also need the support from people like you to make our programs possible!

We believe that artists should be paid a professional wage. We also believe that access to the arts should be accessible. So, we offer free or low cost participation in our programs &/or admission to our exhibits and special events.  

We work hard to do this because we believe anyone should have the opportunity to participate in or experience the arts and its many benefits, including social inclusion, critical thinking, confidence building, creative problem solving, and health and mental wellness. 

In the past, Critical Mass has brought contemporary art experiences to public spaces, and has gained a reputation for doing 'big things' in our small town – pop up art events, installations, and festivals. We really want to keep up this goodwill and continue that momentum for community engagement this summer with a Critical Massive Adventure. 

We are a small and mighty team, but...

We need YOU to be the HERO in our story! 

By supporting our campaign, you will help us pay artists, while also allowing us to offer free admission to the festival. Huzzah!

 
 

What we Need & What your support will Fund

To run this epic one-day festival on a fairly lean budget, it would normally cost between $20,000 - $25,000. However, we have been crunching the numbers and we can get creative to make something magical happen for $10,000 - $15,000 if need be. That's enough to cover the costs to hire artists, musicians, sound technicians and purchase some workshop materials.

We could really use your help to get us there though! We'll also seek out funds from sponsors and do a little extra fundraising to cover the rest.

Be the hero in our story and help us with our quest to crowdfund $20,000! 

These funds will go towards covering our biggest expenses first – paying artists and covering their material costs, and towards some food and lodging stipends for their stay in Port Hope.

If there's any more money in the 'treasure chest' after paying the artists we will put your monies to work! We will rent adequate sound equipment with your contributions for our Live D&D Performance, pay some live musicians and troubadours to delight our festival goers' ears.  And we would rent large festival tents to provide shade and shelter for our community D&D tournament (we can end up borrowing these things if needed, but time is also money and it takes a lot of muscle to set these things up, store them and transport them to and fro). 

If there's even more money after we do all that... we will put it towards marketing and promotion of the festival beyond our social media networks and poster distribution, so we can share the experience with even more fans of D&D and contemporary art.

If we exceed our wildest expectations of this crowdfunding campaign, and the festival pays for itself... we will direct any additional funds raised here to support future arts programming in our Little Station gallery and creative community hub. How amazing would that be?!

We also think you will really dig our rewards! We have some truly amazing, one-of-a-kind items and experiences up for grabs! 

Here's a breakdown of our workshops and festival costs:

  • Workshop Series: ($3,000) Artist fees for 4 - 6 full-day workshops leading up to the festival.  Workshops will explore the visual arts spin-offs of D&D and RPGs like life-drawing, zine making, costume design, character development, storytelling and world-building.
  • Artist Fees & Materials ($5,000) for our illustrators, writers and actors who will be documenting a live D&D performance led by Ed Greenwood
  • Onsite Artist Fees ($1,500) to sketch D&D characters, and to do some artisan demos and provide 'make and take' souvenirs at the festival 
  • Dungeon Masters Stipends ($1,000) Our community D&D tournament wouldn't be possible without our Dungeon Masters. We will be paying our DMs ($50/each) as a token of appreciation for all their game coordination and time.
  • Sound System/Equipment ($1,500)
  • Musicians (Live & DJ) ($2,500) for a DJ to create atmospheric soundtrack and to pay fees for a few roaming troubadours, a harpist, etc
  • Kids Activities ($1,500) cost to purchase supplies for our cardboard kingdom (facepainting, labyrnth and cosplay activities) and to hire Blades of Glory for some fun and educational medieval activities
  • Tent Rentals ($3,500) for 2 x 20'x20' tents (for our workshop area and panel discussions) and 1 x 40'x80' tent (for our community D&D tournament)
  • Table & Chair Rentals ($1,500) for 20-30 x 96" tables and up to 180 chairs
  • Marketing & Promotions ($4,000) for printing of signs/posters, t-shirts, and advertising
  • Volunteer Hospitality ($500-$1,000) Our festival wouldn't be the same without the support of our volunteers. We will ensure that we have enough, food, water, and sunscreen to keep our volunteers happy to spend their day with us.

If we don't reach our crowdfunding goal...
 

We can scale back some of our ideas, and your money will go toward paying artist fees first and foremost for our live performance featuring Ed Greenwood. We will get super frugal and borrow as many tents, tables, chairs, and equipment as we can, etc.

But... we would also need to charge an entrance fee to make up the difference.  However, we really don't want to do that. We feel that this experience is pretty unique (and downright cool) and that it should remain inclusive and something for everyone to enjoy. So, we really hope you can help us reach our goal. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
 

If you can't contribute to our crowdfunding campaign right now, but still think this sounds super awesome, you can still help us by making some noise. 

Tell your friends about us and about our festival. Share this campaign with others who you think might also be able to help.

We also hope you will come play with us. Join us at a workshop.  Round up some friends (or make new ones) and come to the festival on August 17th. Together we can slay the dragon!

Please know that we really appreciate your help.
Thank you!

Huzzah!

Your friends at Critical Mass

story:
~~~

Heart & Mind Festival is honoured to present Sacred Ecology, a special event to celebrate the Fall Equinox in celebration of the interconnectedness of all life and the importance of the relationship we have with our Mother Earth. Join us as we explore sacred ecology through different traditions with elders, faith keepers, indigenous wisdom keepers, scientists, artists and musicians from around the world.

Sacred Ecology is about leaving the world a better place for generations to come. Experience music, lectures, sacred rituals and interactive experiences focusing on the importance of the preservation and education of wisdom traditions and their impact on current and future generations. 

Who We Are

Heart & Mind Festival is a quarterly festival founded by elder Maestro Manuel Rufino of M.A.I.S.C., A.U.M., the Golden Drum, and the Sacred Arts Research Foundation.

Heart & Mind Festival unites elders, teachers, indigenous wisdom keepers, and people devoted to the consciousness movement worldwide to offer their visions, wisdom, and traditional ways. 

Heart & Mind Festival is a transformational global movement.

Heart & Mind Festival is held in multiple locations around the globe including New York, London, and Poland. This year we plan on expanding to other countries throughout the world.

Our Campaign

This Fall Equinox festival will feature an incredible lineup of indigenous elders and spiritual leaders from around the world including:

  • Maestro Manuel Rufino – Taino Elder and World Director of M.A.I.S.C
  • Kahontakwas Diane Longboat – Turtle Clan, Mohawk Nation, Traditional Teacher
  • Steven Martyn M.A. – (traditional plant use), B.F.A. honours, artist, farmer, wildcrafter, builder, teacher, writer, visionary
  • Col Martin – Turtle Clan, Mohawk Nation, Six Nations Territory, Faith Keeper
  • Kawennontye Shani Martin – Turtle Clan, Mohawk Nation, Six Nations Territory, Mother, Grandmother, Haudenosaunee Waldorf Teacher
  • Ven. Dr. Bhante Saranapala – The Urban Buddhist Monk and Meditation Teacher, Founder and President of "Canada: A Mindful and Kind Nation"
  • Brian Rush – Scientist Emeritus (CAMH) and Professor Depts. of Public Health Sciences and Psychiatry, University of Toronto
  • Madeleine Marentette –  Founder Grail Springs Retreat Centre for Wellbeing, Author, Spiritual Guide
  •  Ingrid Cryns – Eco-Architect, Bio Energetic Psychotherapist, Sound Healer and Earth Steward Elder
  • Cathy Mines – Founder and Director of Wellness at Reach Yoga, Certified Yoga Instructor, Author, Peace Ambassador
  • Lauren Saville – Manager of Roots & Shoots, Jane Goodall Institute of Canada
  • Kirtan Culture Initiative – Heart-Opening Kirtan Yoga
  • Saikou Saho –  Djembe Master Owner of African Drums and Arts Crafts
  • ROUA AUOR – Sacred Sound in Timeless Space, Shamanic Sound Meditation Ensemble
  • Dream Seed –  Shamanic Sound Journey
  • More to be announced, please check our website for updates...

 

We would like to continue to make this event accessible to all people, which is why we are asking for your support! Due to the expenses associated with bringing the above presenters to the city of Toronto, this by-donation event needs an extra boost!

What We Need

Your contribution to this cause will help us to cover the expenses for:

  • Flights
  • Accommodations
  • Space rental 
  • Professional sound and lighting
  • Meals
  • Transportation
  • Advertising
  • Decor

What You Will Get

For those that wish to attend, your donation will reserve your place at the event and help make sure that anyone who does not have the funds to attend, can still participate.

For those that cannot attend, you will receive a recording of the event and access to live stream at certain moments of the festival.

Other perks include handcrafted art and jewelry, all natural body and cleaning products, nutritional counselling, healing sessions, yoga classes (in person and remote), and more...  

The Impact

We know that when incredible people come together to pray for a cause, the effect is felt around the world. This is why we want to bring everyone mentioned above to the event and have as many people attend as possible.

We have a successful track record of sold out events, including two events in New York this year, one in collaboration with The Rubin Museum of Art of NY. 

More past events can be viewed here: https://www.heartandmindfestival.org/festivals 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially you can still help by sharing the festival on social media via the link below:

  • https://www.facebook.com/events/640277146456681/

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to promote the campaign!

story:
Baggrund

LiteraturHaus ligger i en gammel metodistkirke på Møllegade, Nørrebro. Siden midt 80'erne har huset været i privateje, og i nogle år var det centrum for nogle af byens vildeste fester. 

Vi synes, at bygningen egner sig fortrinligt til begge dele, både det hellige og det festlige - og alt der imellem. Præcis ligesom litteraturen.

Derfor var det et perfekt match, da kirken i 2005 blev til LiteraturHaus, Nordens første litteraturhus. I de seneste 14 år har huset lagt vægge til utallige oplæsninger, koncerter, fester og meget mere. Listen over uforglemmelige øjeblikke er lang.   

Men det har også slidt på huset, og de seneste år har LiteraturHaus desværre måttet drosle ned for aktiviteterne. 

 

Litteratur mm.

I november '18 fik LiteraturHaus ny ledelse, og målet er at åbne dørene hver dag.

Litteraturen skal stadig danne fundament for vores aktiviteter, men der skal også være plads til debatter, workshops, fester,  morgenkaffe, quiz-aftener, foredrag, teater, musik og meget mere. 

Vi tror på, at der er værdi i at mødes med sine naboer.

Vi tror på samtaler. 

Vi tror på, at litteratur, kunst og musik kan gøre os klogere. 

Vi håber, du vil hjælpe os.

 

Hvad kan vi tilbyde

 Som medlem af huset får du rabatter og gratis entré på flere events. Du kan få øl til en 20'er, kaffe til en 10'er og et godt glas naturvin til 50 kroner.

Og så får du mulighed for at præge huset til de møder, hvor vi diskuterer husets fremtid. Hvis du har lyst, kan du endda stille op til bestyrelsen :) 

Medlemskabet er et-årigt. 

 

Derfor har vi brug for dig

Visionen, om at LiteraturHaus skal være et alsidigt og åbent hus, stiller krav til, at bygningen bliver renoveret en smule.  

Her er vores planer for konkrete forbedringer af huset, I prioriteret rækkefølge: 

  • Vinduer. Vi vil have glas i de tre store vinduer mod Møllegade, så morgensolen kan skinne ind. De skal være lydtætte og kunne skærmes. Pris: Ca 75.000 kr.
  • Udluftning. Der skal være masser af dans i salen. Det kræver frisk luft. Pris: Ca 38.000 kr. 
  • Maling. De knap 7m høje vægge trænger gevaldigt til at blive malet. Pris: Ca 30.000 kr. 
  • Gulv. Mange fødder har trampet på det. Nu trænger det til en kærlig hånd. Pris: Ca. 15.000 kr.

 

Et forvandlet hus

For os handler de her byggeprojekter først og fremmest om at danne fundament for alt det rigtigt spændende. 

Vi er i gang med at planlægge en stor, international festival for poesi. Og så småt ved at få Literaturcaféerne op at stå, så der hver torsdag er interessante litterære oplevelser at hente. Snart kommer også de første soul-aftener. 

Med din hjælp kan vi sætte yderligere skub på alle de aktiviteter. Vi kan sætte nye tiltag i søen. Og allerede til foråret 2020 kan Nørrebro have et forvandlet forsamlingshus. 

 

Andre måder at hjælpe

Vi håber selvfølgelig, at du vil købe en kop eller et medlemsskab, men der er også andre måder at støtte op om huset.

Vi er helt afhængige af, at frivillige kommer og bidrager ved f.eks. at stå i baren til oplæsninger eller lign. Som frivillig bliver du inviteret med helt ind i maskinrummet, og du kan være med til at præge huset i lige så høj udstrækning, som du orker. 

Vi vil også altid gerne have hjælp til opgaver med hjemmeside, sociale medier, istandsættelse, maling og meget mere. Skriv til os :)
story_txt:
BaggrundLiteraturHaus ligger i en gammel metodistkirke på Møllegade, Nørrebro. Siden midt 80'erne har huset været i privateje, og i nogle år var det centrum for nogle af byens vildeste fester. Vi synes, at bygningen egner sig fortrinligt til begge dele, både det hellige og det festlige - og alt der imellem. Præcis ligesom litteraturen.Derfor var det et perfekt match, da kirken i 2005 blev til LiteraturHaus, Nordens første litteraturhus. I de seneste 14 år har huset lagt vægge til utallige oplæsninger, koncerter, fester og meget mere. Listen over uforglemmelige øjeblikke er lang.   Men det har også slidt på huset, og de seneste år har LiteraturHaus desværre måttet drosle ned for aktiviteterne.  Litteratur mm.I november '18 fik LiteraturHaus ny ledelse, og målet er at åbne dørene hver dag.Litteraturen skal stadig danne fundament for vores aktiviteter, men der skal også være plads til debatter, workshops, fester,  morgenkaffe, quiz-aftener, foredrag, teater, musik og meget mere. Vi tror på, at der er værdi i at mødes med sine naboer.Vi tror på samtaler. Vi tror på, at litteratur, kunst og musik kan gøre os klogere. Vi håber, du vil hjælpe os. 
Hvad kan vi tilbyde
 Som medlem af huset får du rabatter og gratis entré på flere events. Du kan få øl til en 20'er, kaffe til en 10'er og et godt glas naturvin til 50 kroner.
Og så får du mulighed for at præge huset til de møder, hvor vi diskuterer husets fremtid. Hvis du har lyst, kan du endda stille op til bestyrelsen :) 
Medlemskabet er et-årigt. 
 
Derfor har vi brug for digVisionen, om at LiteraturHaus skal være et alsidigt og åbent hus, stiller krav til, at bygningen bliver renoveret en smule.  Her er vores planer for konkrete forbedringer af huset, I prioriteret rækkefølge:

Udluftning. Der skal være masser af dans i salen. Det kræver frisk luft. Pris: Ca 38.000 kr. 
Maling. De knap 7m høje vægge trænger gevaldigt til at blive malet. Pris: Ca 30.000 kr. 
Gulv. Mange fødder har trampet på det. Nu trænger det til en kærlig hånd. Pris: Ca. 15.000 kr.

Og så småt ved at få Literaturcaféerne op at stå, så der hver torsdag er interessante litterære oplevelser at hente. Snart kommer også de første soul-aftener. Med din hjælp kan vi sætte yderligere skub på alle de aktiviteter. Vi kan sætte nye tiltag i søen. Og allerede til foråret 2020 kan Nørrebro have et forvandlet forsamlingshus.  Andre måder at hjælpeVi håber selvfølgelig, at du vil købe en kop eller et medlemsskab, men der er også andre måder at støtte op om huset.Vi er helt afhængige af, at frivillige kommer og bidrager ved f.eks. at stå i baren til oplæsninger eller lign. Som frivillig bliver du inviteret med helt ind i maskinrummet, og du kan være med til at præge huset i lige så høj udstrækning, som du orker. Vi vil også altid gerne have hjælp til opgaver med hjemmeside, sociale medier, istandsættelse, maling og meget mere. Skriv til os :)

story:
I'm Chevon Powell, the Founder of Golden Bricks Events a event company creating special events and festivals highlighting outdoor recreation, nature and diversity. With over 15 years of experience managing events professionally, and my personal experience as an African-American women that loves the outdoors, I'm uniquely skilled to make this event a reality. 

The Refuge Outdoor Festival is the first of it's kind. This event is meant to be a safe space for POC outdoor enthusiast and novice to celebrate and explore in one amazing weekend. Studies have shown getting outdoors and participating in recreational activities has positive impacts on physical, mental, and societal health.  However, it has to be done in a engaging and safe way. In a 2016 survey conducted by the National Park Service, it was found that less than 20% of park visitors were non-white. Due to numerous reasons including economic and safety issues, the outdoors can be intimidating in particular to POC. This festival will directly address these issues by bringing together people at all levels of outdoors engagement.

REFUGE IS ANYTHING TO WHICH ONE HAS RECOURSE FOR AID, RELIEF, OR ESCAPE.

With the capacity of 500, this will be our pilot festival with the intention to expand the concept to other areas around the country in the years to come. Let's be honest, I need MONEY, KNOWLEDGE, and RESOURCES. Planning a large-scale event outside isn't cheap, but together as a community we will make this event happen!

YOUR FINANCIAL CONTRIBUTION 

Why do I need $10,000? What will it go to? The funds raised will go toward logistics and production costs to help keep the ticket price low. Every dollar counts. $10,000 is only a fraction of what the overall event will cost but it will go toward venue rental and deposits fees for items like restrooms and transportation. 

YOUR IMPACT

I'm sure you've seen the news so I don't have to tell you about all the negative things that have been going on in the world and the attacks on POC communities. This event is needed now more than ever. I believe the festival will be a life changing moment for many people. 

1. Simply put representation matters. All people face hurdles in accessing the outdoors. Many POCs have added challenges such as access to gear, transportation to wild spaces, and the lack of outdoor knowledge this festival has been developed to address issues. 

2. Life is hard and we all need opportunities to have real conversations. 80% of Americans believe it’s essential for people to come together in person to promote positive change. 

3. This is not a one-off event it is to build community and connect people with resources for ongoing engagement. 

Your contribution will not only help create this space space but will also help close the adventure gap and impact communities for a better tomorrow.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Did I mention this isn't my first event? My passion for events and the outdoors has lead me on this path and I believe it will be the community that I have built over the years that will push me through. On hard days I recall my experience in Vermont (What experience in VT? Watch the video) and I work harder to ensure this festival is a success. This event will happen rain or shine.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Remember I mentioned Knowledge and Resources? I understand that not everyone will be able to contribute financially (but if you can please do) here are other opportunities:

  • Share this campaign with your network. Encourage your family and friends to support.
  • Donate gear. Gear is one of the biggest barriers to entry, we would like to provide access to new and gently used items. Please contact us for more information.
  • Be a leader. We need POC leaders to run activities or community conversations at the festival.
  • There is plenty to do. Volunteer pre-event or onsite at the festival.
  • Follow us on Facebook and Instagram, and share our posts and events.
  • Keep in touch by signing up to the Mailing list.
  • Buy a ticket and attend… don't forget to bring your friends! You all will have an amazing time.

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

The Escritoriqueño project is an attempt, by a small group of Outer-Rican writers, teachers and entrepreneurs, to give our young Puerto Rican children an opportunity to be heard, felt and understood through the medium of writing. It is an attempt to help a generation of young Puerto Ricans heal from the devastation of Hurricane Maria.  

What We Need

$3500 - $5000 For: Supplies, travel and lodging, transportation, field trips to devastated areas, video editing and digital photography, food for group, copy editing/formatting/publishing.

$3500 - $5000 Para: Suministros, viajes y alojamiento, transporte, excursiones a áreas devastadas, edición de videos y fotografía digital, alimentos para grupos, edición de copias / formateo / publicación.

The Impact

Hurricane Maria affected every single kid in Puerto Rico, the entire population of kids...DIRECTLY! The goal of this project is simple: to gather a group of Puerto Rican kids and their parents together in order to facilitate a process that encourages the kids in the group to share their experience, strength and hope…before, during and after Maria. The documented and published true stories that these kids tell will begin a healing process for the writers and the readers alike.

El huracán María afectó a cada niño en Puerto Rico, a toda la población de niños ... ¡DIRECTAMENTE! El objetivo de este proyecto es simple: reunir a un grupo de niños puertorriqueños y sus padres para facilitar un proceso que aliente a los niños del grupo a compartir su experiencia, fortaleza y esperanza ... antes, durante y después de María. Las historias reales documentadas y publicadas que cuentan estos niños comenzarán un proceso de curación para los escritores y los lectores por igual.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need donations of: Computers/Chromebooks, digital video cameras.

Necesitamos donaciones de: Computadoras / Chromebooks, cámaras de video digitales.

story:
Short Summary

The Italian Cultural Center “Marco Polo” offers Italian classes to children ages 2 to 11 in Roxborough, Philadelphia at the Kendrick Recreation Center. The school started in 2000 as a need of Italian families in the Greater Philadelphia Area. Classes meet two hours a week and cover Italian language and grammar, as well as Geography, Music, History, and Visual Arts, We also organize several events for our families to enhance the understanding and knowledge of Italian language, culture and tradition.

So far we have been guests at the Kendrick Recreation Center, a City of Philadelphia community building. Since 2000 we have been delivering classes only on Saturdays from October to May. However, the classroom is not in good shape to host all students, especially our young kids (2-3 yr old). Also, we are not in condition to fully enhance our possibilities in this venue and we have to keep our class materials in different places. Our teachers are engaged, dedicated, and enthusiastic, so that our kids really find a good reason to practice Italian as second language. We are striving to create a community in which every learner is accepted and has an active role. Our parents always join our extra-curricular activities and are engaged in our small community.

Thank you in advance for your generosity. Please feel free to contact us with any questions via email at scuolamarcopolo.phila@gmail.com.

What We Need & What You Get

With this campaign we request your consideration for a $150,000 fundraising to contribute for our new building.The money will be an integral part of the school finances and used exclusively to finance the purchase of a new building.

In order to start this new project, we will need to reach everyone interested in supporting our vision.

Our building will be located in Roxborough, Philadelphia, or nearby area connected with public transportation (SEPTA) to Center City. The facility should have at least one functioning bathroom, a kitchen, and three to five rooms to be used as classrooms and cultural activities.

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will deposit this amount in a restricted fund to be used for a down payment, and the rest will be financed through a bank loan.

The Impact

The Scuola Marco Polo's goal is to educate students and families on the importance of bilingual education and Italian Culture.

Scuola Marco Polo believes that Italian language, traditions, music and culture are essential tools to create a unified community. We are happy to celebrate Italian and American festivities with families of diverse background and culture.

Bilingual education provides cognitive advantages:

- Developing a very active and flexible brain 
- Developing more flexible approaches because of the ability to switch between languages
- Developing ability to ignore irrelevant information 
- Focusing, remembering, and making decisions

and social-emotional advantages:

- Maintain strong ties with their entire family, culture, and community: social identity 
- Make new friends and create strong relationships in their second language: social diversity
- Children show better self-control 

Other scientifically proven benefits of bilingualism are:

- Bilingualism may delay the onset of Alzheimer’s disease
- Bilingual adults have more job opportunities around the world than monolingual adults 
- Bilingual employees earn an average of $7,000 more per year than their monolingual peers
- Bilingual citizens are active members of the global community, due to their multi-language knowledge  
- Bilingualism frees people from biases and limited thinking

Other Ways You Can Help

Please find below the list of fundamental items we would also need:

- Help us acquire school supplies, such as stationery, furniture, PC, technologies and musical instruments.
- Help us organize fundraising events in order to create awareness, raise capital and pay monthly expenses.
- Expand the school network with potential investors/donors to support our school idea.
- Donate goods we can auction online, in order to raise money for the school budget.
- Collect information and help us apply for grants.

story:
Duluth Færing Project Summary

Here's what we're up to:

  • John Finkle is the Duluth Færing Project's shipwright. He has built numerous wooden boats and has many, many years of experience teaching hand-tool woodworking. Several months ago he traveled to Norway to research historical and contemporary wooden boat building methods in the millennia-old Norwegian tradition. John, along with Justin Anderson (the project's volunteer media director) and a growing number of community members comprise the newly-formed Nóatún Community Wooden Boat Works. "Nóatún" (pronounced "noah-toon") means "boat enclosure" or "boat home" in Old Norse; it is the home of the Norse God Njord who oversees safe waters, sunny shores, small watercraft and their crews.
  • With Duluth community members, we are building a traditional lap-strake, clinker-built, Scandinavian færing approximately 19 feet long using hand tools and locally sourced materials. The frame will be hand-hewn from locally harvested Burr Oak (a magnificent tree which we have established great affection for) and the strakes of milled Cedar. This is an uncommon and disappearing art that is being passionately revived around the world one boat at a time; we want to do our part in bringing this tradition back to life in a contemporary context and to share it with our local community and the broader Lake Superior region.
  • Contributions to this fundraising campaign will allow us to continue to rent our shop space (and afford building/liability insurance) in the heart of downtown Duluth, where the project is highly visible and accessible to the public; further, with your support, we will be able to secure the continuation of our project and the construction of a SECOND færing later this year! We hope to have the boat finished for a community launching and celebration event and begin the vessels life on the waters of the Great Lakes–powered by oar and sail.

What We Need

This is a passion project for us and as such we're volunteering our time and labor (don't get us wrong, we're having plenty of fun too), so your donations will go towards:

  • Affording newly negotiated rent and other costs of maintaining the shop space
  • Miscellaneous supplies and materials that we are unable to naturally harvest, collect, or obtain as donations
  • We've got the wood, we've got the tools, we've got the hardware, we've got skilled workers and community volunteers alike; right now, we really just need help staying put in our lovely space at its new and improved cost!
  • If we fall short or exceed or fundraising goals at this point in time, the funds will still be put to the above uses and we will continue the effort as best we can!

The Impact

This craft will move people through our native waters by oar and sail.

  • We passionately want a community FLEET of wooden boats for Lake Superior moored in Duluth, Minnesota; with your help, this is very achievable!
  • People observing or participating hands-on will see and learn the satisfaction and beautiful quiet and slow deliberateness of using timeless tools in the act of creating.
  • It will be very satisfying for people to use simple planes and saws to sculpt wood and create a highly useful, “living,” functional work of art–and be able to take pride in something they had a direct hand in helping to create.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many, many ways for you to contribute:

  • Come and visit the boat shop! Swing an axe; peen a copper nail; plane a plank; say hello!
  • Please use Indiegogo's SHARE tools to help spread the word, thank you!

And that's all there is to it. Seil er Oppe!

We've got the wood, we've got the tools, we've got the hardware, we've got skilled workers and community volunteers alike; right now, we really just need help staying put in our lovely space at its new and improved cost!
If we fall short or exceed or fundraising goals at this point in time, the funds will still be put to the above uses and we will continue the effort as best we can!


The Impact
This craft will move people through our native waters by oar and sail.

We passionately want a community FLEET of wooden boats for Lake Superior moored in Duluth, Minnesota; with your help, this is very achievable!
People observing or participating hands-on will see and learn the satisfaction and beautiful quiet and slow deliberateness of using timeless tools in the act of creating.
It will be very satisfying for people to use simple planes and saws to sculpt wood and create a highly useful, “living,” functional work of art–and be able to take pride in something they had a direct hand in helping to create.


Other Ways You Can Help
There are many, many ways for you to contribute:

Come and visit the boat shop! Swing an axe; peen a copper nail; plane a plank; say hello!
Please use Indiegogo's SHARE tools to help spread the word, thank you!

And that's all there is to it. Seil er Oppe!

story:
The Amedeo Modigliani Institute, an Italian Foundation based in Rome, intends to pursue its mission of promoting the life and art of Modigliani by carrying out an extraordinary exhibition that has never been attempted before, and as it continues to grow, will see all 337 works of the Master represented by 2020, the centennial celebration of Modigliani's death. An unforgettable exhibition, aimed at showcasing Modigliani's entire art production, made possible by special backlit reproductions (called Modlight®) that we have created with the most advanced technologies, with respect to the original size and color and authorized by the rightful owners. All held by the Institute are equipped with fascinating historical evidence consisting of documents, photos, and relics of the time.

It is precisely for the production of Modlights® that we are asking for your help. We believe, in fact, that Modlights® and the technology behind them are the ideal tool to dramatically reduce the cost of exhibitions while preserving the necessary cultural and informational accuracy, thus bringing art to the people at the greatest meeting points, squares, university campuses, cafés, theater foyers, and malls. A true revolution that has already begun and was experimented with in Italy in 2015, which will make art more accessible to everyone, so that they can experience the unmistakable emotions it can generate, regardless of the traditional cultural tastes that are sometimes reluctant to innovation and incapable of interpreting modern ways of learning.

Every penny that you donate will, thus, be employed to create a Modlight artwork®, which will immediately be added to the 53 already existing ones that are part of the exhibitions already completed or underway, with the aim of reaching a total production of 337 certified works attributed to Amedeo Modigliani as soon as possible.

Help us to give light to art, build a Modlight® with us!

The face of our campaign

Cristina Moglia - Italian actress

 

A special thanks to the Italian actress Cristina Moglia, who decided to give light to art giving her face for our cause in the video.


Join Cristina Moglia, please support our crowdfunding campaign! Get a Perk now!

 

The Amedeo Modigliani Institute pursues the following strategic objectives:

  • Disseminate, publicize, and represent by various means and forms, the life and work of a great Italian artist of the 20th century, one of the most famous in the world;
  • implement in the Modlight format®, for the first time, an extraordinary show featuring all the works of Modigliani, so that in 2020, the centennial of his death, all of Modigliani's paintings will be viewable at one location for the first time in the world;
  • promote "Modigliani Houses" in various countries as true cultural attractions, places of excellence for publicizing Modigliani's life work, but above all, places that, on behalf of the Livorno-born artist (who died without ever having a personal exhibition or his own catalog of works), can support contemporary creativity, particularly among young, emerging artists;
  • promote, through technology and exhibitions in the Modlight format® , what we may call the "Modigliani Experience", providing an emotional and experiential approach able to engage thousands of young people, as well as old and new enthusiasts, in the exciting Avant-garde world of Paris in the early twentieth century.

 

Special Rewards for co-financiers

 

Everyone who will support our campaign getting a Perk will be extra-rewarded with:

  1. Your name will be included in the official thanks video that will be released at the end of the campaign by Amedeo Modigliani Institute
     
  2. Your name will be published among the co-financiers on the official digital communication materials of the future exhibition for the centennial of the death

 

International Modigliani house opening

Spoleto (PG) - Italy

 

On May 31, 2017, in Spoleto, Palazzo Montani, Piazza Fontana 3, was inaugurated the International Office of both the Amedeo Modigliani Institute and the Organizing Committee for the celebrations of the centenary of the death of Amedeo Modigliani (1920-2020).

In this occasion we launched our new exhibition, that will be open until next July 31, “Modigliani and l’art nègre” that includes some of the 53 Modlight® we’ve already realized.

Take a look at the Photo Gallery below, in order to start to imagine what we could realize with your precious support!

 

A selection of already produced Modlight®

From the Exhibition "Les Femmes"

Click here to download the official Campaign press kit.

story:
Want to walk, drink, sail and cook on the island of Santorini? We can arrange all of that.

Want to spend some time with your family or friends in a luxury villa? We can arrange that too.

We're offering all-inclusive vacation packages at reduced prices. Don't miss out!

THE BEGINNING

In 2011  we were presented with a remarkable opportunity to take on the interior restoration of a 13th century Venetian tower in the crumbling castle  of Akrotiri, Santorini. Our idea was to create a workshop, exhibition and performance space to showcase our beloved instrument – the Greek bagpipe – the tsabouna.

In 2012 we managed to do just that. In the tower’s main chamber we created a unique exhibition of Greek bagpipes that highlighted the skilled craftsmanship of makers from Santorini and the Aegean region. The main chamber also hosts Yannis’ daily musical presentations and La Ponta’s highly successful evening concert series. On the second floor we created a workshop, where Yannis constructs  the tsabouna and a wide range of Greek wind instruments, and passes on his skills to others. La Ponta’s revival of the tsabouna, the Greek bagpipe, has brought the musical traditions of Greece from the past into the present and shared them with locals and global travellers alike.

"La Ponta’s revival of the tsabouna,  the Greek bagpipe,  on the island of Santorini, has brought the musical traditions of Greece from the past into the present and shared them with locals and global travellers alike."

Our work in the tower gained pace as we invited local school children to participate in workshops and reconnected locals with their shared musical past, helping to revitalise a valuable island tradition. Global travellers also flocked to the tower and over the next five years our work at La Ponta received coverage from ET3 (Greece), OTE History (Greece), BBC Scotland, National Geographic Traveller, Songlines Magazine, VIV2 (Vietnam), NDR (Germany), RAI 3 (Italy) and TV5 (France), to name but a few.

"Our work at La Ponta received coverage from ET3 (Greece), OTE History (Greece), BBC Scotland, National Geographic Traveller, Songlines Magazine, VIV2 (Vietnam), NDR (Germany), RAI 3 (Italy) and TV5 (France), to name but a few."

Last year, at the height of our success, we received the unfortunate news that our lease in the tower was not going to be renewed. We knew that we must continue our work – as pillars of the community and as representatives of global cultural heritage. We soon seized on an opportunity to purchase new premises in the village of Megalochori, a 605 square meter turn of the century winery that had lain empty for fifty years.

"We soon seized on an opportunity to purchase new premises in the village of Megalochori, a 605 square meter turn of the century winery that had lain empty for fifty years."

 

HERE AND NOW - SYMPOSION

Symposion comes from the word sympinein - ‘to drink together.’ In ancient Greece, people would drink during a banquet – accompanied by music, dancing, recitals and conversation. Their wine was carefully cut with water so that they could maintain lucidity and gain inspiration from the nine muses.

When we entered our new premises we were struck by one thing – the nine holes suspended above the main entrance. Our first thought: here are the nine muses that can guide our work and inspire us and our guests to new heights of listening, engagement and understanding.  

Symposion will be dedicated to music, art and mythology – and to introducing its visitors to age-old narratives that offer new insight.

"Symposion is dedicated to music, art and mythology – and to introducing its visitors to age-old narratives that offer new insight."

 

THE FUTURE

Not only will our new premises allow us to continue our work – in time it will enable us to extend the reach of our educational programming, and expand our workshop, instrument exhibition and concert series.  In the future our new premises can also house an annual artist’s residency program, artist’s residence, art installations, a library, storytelling forum, lectures and conferences, interactive exhibits, as well as a Homeric Wine Café situated in the Mythological Botanical Garden in its open courtyard.

If we are able to secure the funds for refurbishing the premises, Symposion can continue to serve the residents of Santorini with innovative musical and educational programming and, over the coming years, become a global destination for cultural tourism -  fostering new approaches to the appreciation and study of Greek culture, enriching the musical traditions of the present day and creating new connections between artists, musicians and storytellers from around the globe in a sustainable, community oriented space for all ages.  

"In the future our new premises can also house an annual artist’s residency program, artist’s residence, art installations, a library, storytelling forum, lectures and conferences, interactive exhibits, as well as a Homeric Wine Café situated in the Mythological Botanical Garden in its open courtyard."

 

PLEASE CLICK THROUGH TO READ ABOUT OUR PLANS FOR THE FUTURE 

Transforming a dilapidated turn of the century winery into a fully-functional cultural center is an ambitious project.

We aim to complete the work one stage at a time. 

The funding for the refurbishment of the space can be broken down as follows:

REFURBISHMENT

Concert Hall (including Workshop, Homeric Wine Café and Courtyard): €78,000

Cave (including Reading Library and Instrument Exhibition): €32,000

Artist’s Residence: €31,000

Mythological Botanical Garden: €2,500

Disabled Access: €500

ADDITIONAL EXPENSES

Permit for Repurposing Space: €3,000

Building Permit: €7,000

Architect’s Fee: €17,000

EQUIPMENT

In-House Sound System (Concert Hall and Courtyard, Design and Equipment): €7,000

Lighting (Concert Hall and Cave): €4,000

Office Equipment (Gift Shop, Homeric Wine Cafe and Guest Accommodation): €7,000

Projector and Screen: €2,000

Security System: €3,000

Interactive Map (Design and Equipment): €3,000

Sound Bank (Design and Equipment): €2,000

CAMPAIGN

Crowdfunding Design & Management: €13,000

Incentives: €10,000

Plus 24% V.A.T.: €58,000

 

OUR INCENTIVES

Everyone who donates can be secure in the knowledge that their money is going towards the valuable work of an established cultural organisation. Beyond that knowledge – Symposion is offering some exciting incentives to donate.

Thanks to the incredible generosity of our local sponsors we’re offering some once in a lifetime vacation packages for those who want to visit Santorini.

We’re going to be adding additional donation amounts and limited edition perks throughout the campaign. Want a hand-made Cycladic Drum? We’ve got ten on offer. Want to walk, drink, sail and cook on the island of Santorini? We can arrange all of that. Want to spend some time with your family or friends in a luxury villa? We can help.

"Want to walk, drink, sail and cook on the island of Santorini? We can arrange all of that."

Help us to realise our vision for a cultural center dedicated to Music, Art and Mythology on the island of Santorini – and get great stuff AND experiences in return!

We will be adding exciting new perks weekly! Everyone who donates more than €100 will find their name on a foundational stone in our beautiful courtyard.

Help us by DONATING and by SHARING our campaign! 

 

We thank you SO MUCH for your support!

And we thanks all of our generous island sponsors for helping us to make our campaign work!

story:
This is my story...

Almost half the world over three billion people  live on less than $2.50 a day. My country, Greece, has become one of the poorest in the world and is unable to recover. Which made me think... If a 10m country like Greece is in need then a 1 billion country like India must be in much greater need and Im not talking about donating money to the poor because that will have little effect. What people need is the ability to create new business and take matter into their own hands. They need access to financing and that is what we will offer. We will offer the opportunity to the people of India to start their own businesses. On top of that we have a unique way which allows people who never got financing before to be approved now! This unique approach derives people's credit worthiness by monitoring  their interaction in social media such as Facebook, Instagram, Tweeter etc. and their everyday real life trends and habits! With your help we will be able to raise the funds to launch the Shukriyya platform. 

So far we have...

Developed an algorithm for calculating 10,000 parameters from social media and cell phone data.

We need your help to complete and launch the project by creating a...

Digital Marketing Campaign to achieve awareness of the App.

Platform maintenance and Web site hosting costs.

Let this be the beginning to a brighter future for millions of people who want to start or expand their business in India!Thank You!

story:
The SAKE crew comprises talented individuals; we lend our unique skills to produce events at scale. We are designers, coders, engineers, writers, photographers, mechanics, accountants, and get-shit-done-rs. We’ve created some amazing perks for our donors with items that are unique to us.

Funds raised will go directly to producing future events.

Thank you for your support!

story:
What is Casita Esperanza?

Casita Esperanza is an all-encompassing project; we strive to respond to the new challenges posed by the humanitarian crisis stemming from an inadequate governmental response to the disaster. The inefficiency of the official disaster response team, paired with the amount of destruction, has forced grassroots initiatives to step up and take a more important role in reconstruction and relief efforts, increasing the need for volunteer work.

We strive to facilitate the volunteering process.

That means receiving travelers in a place tailor made to fit their needs and coordinating with our partners to place them where their skills would be needed. We plan to equip them with the tools (machetes, chainsaws, gloves, etc.) that would allow them to be useful on site. In addition, we would provide transportation to and from volunteering sites, as well as to-go meals.

We are committed to making a self-sustainable space.

We would like to use the 775 square foot terrace of Casita Esperanza as a “huerto,” food garden. Through a rain collecting system, paired with a reverse osmosis water filtration, we’ll be able to collect water for the garden and provide drinkable water. Following an agro ecologic line, our garden is free of chemicals and able to produce diverse fruits and vegetables toward the consumption of our visitors. Finally, we wish to run on solar energy, severing the ties with inefficient and obsolete Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority.

We provide a space for our network.

We would like to provide our network of small organizations with not only volunteers but also a space to stay in Casita Esperanza and enjoy its ammenities when traveling to the metro area. The terrace would also be available for our network to host educational workshops and events.

 

Although Casita Esperanza is a fairly new project, it is past the theoretical stage.

We have the physical space, located in Punta Las Marias, Santurce. We have a website under construction and have started establishing relationships with international volunteers as well as the different local organizations. We are confident that this project has great potential, and we are looking forward to the support of our contributors to help us bring it to fruition.

Casita Esperanza, the vision!

 

About Us

Casita Esperanza stems from the collaboration between two friends, who moved to Puerto Rico, respectively, from France and from Texas, and decided to join forces in the wake of the aftermath of Hurricane Maria. Having worked and lived on the island for several years, we’ve developed strong ties to the community and are happy to call Puerto Rico our home.

The strength of this project comes from our diverse and complementary backgrounds. One of us is experienced in interior displays and was an integral part of the successful opening of Nordstrom on the island; while the other created and runs Sin Mirar Pa’l La’O (SMPL), a community based non-profit.

After the passage of Hurricane Maria, circumstances presented us with a dilemma. We could choose to leave to pursue opportunities outside of Puerto Rico, or to stay and try and make a positive impact. We easily settled on the latter, and this is how Casita Esperanza was born.

 

Where will your contributions go?

Along with the coordination, transportation, and work tools needed to be useful for volunteers, we would love to offer a volunteer friendly housing rate of $10 per night, instead of a $40 rate comparable to guest homes in the area, for people to stay at Casita Esperanza. We are thankful Puerto Rico is the perfect climate for growing vegetables on the terrace; furthermore, with the addition of gardening essentials, we can harvest our own food in a few months time. 

 

Your deeply appreciated support will assist us in making our vision of Casita Esperanza as an all-encompassing project a reality. This includes:

 -Volunteer ready work tools (chainsaws, machetes, rubber boots, work gloves, outdoor hats, etc.)

-Terrace food garden essentials (seeds, gardening tools, rain collector)

-Transportation and meal preparation costs

-Furniture

-Occupancy Rate (3 rooms booked for 3 months)

-Solar Energy Systems

 -Contributions past our goal will help Casita Esperanza with branding and advertising

 

Why back this project?

You want to be a part of supporting Puerto Rico and it’s sustainable reconstruction after Hurricane Maria and there are rewards involved!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone is able to donate to this project, however, sharing our campaign goes a long way. We thank you in advance for your support!

 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge right now is not having consistent central electric power. This complicates and slows down the work process. However, we are committed to keeping our contributors updated as much as we can along the way.
