This isn't just for the dedicated heads, we've got a schedule packed with creative activities where anyone can make their own art or learn some new skills. We want everyone to feel included.
The secret venue within an hour of Brissy has large grassy areas, shady trees, fire pits and limited neighbours. It's under an hour from Brisbane, but if you prefer us to chauffer you from the closest train station and back, pre-purchase a bus ticket when your getting your festival and food tickets.
The location of the camp is need to know, and only ticket holders need to know, so when you learn the secret, keep it.
 
If you would like to be involved or have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us. There are no silly questions, and we would rather you ask.

story:
Impact & History of the Exhibit

There can be no doubt that the preservation of the history and heritage of BMW is in good hands with the BMW Car Club Foundation in partnership with America’s Automotive Trust. LeMay – America’s Car Museum is an entity of the Trust. 

In June 2017, the Foundation, in partnership with BMW and private collectors from across the country curated an exceptional exhibit of rare and legendary examples of BMW Motorsport. Titled “Heroes of Bavaria - 75 Years of BMW Motorsport” they brought together an impressive selection of the most significant BMW racing machines in the company’s history. Now, with your help, several cars from amazing collection have the opportunity to be viewed for the first time on the West Coast. 

The exhibit will feature 17 rare and historically significant BMW motorsports vehicles, plus artifacts and memorabilia displayed in ACM’s remarkable Showcase Gallery in Tacoma, WA. 

The original BMW Heroes of Bavaria exhibit at the BMW CCA Foundation in Greer, SC. 

What We Need & What You Get

It's not cheap to bring these rare cars across the country for a stunning West Coast debut! Your generous gift supports the expense of transporting one-of-a-kind vehicles and memorabilia and the curation of this incredible exhibit. 

Time is of the essence! We have ambitious plans to open this once-in-a-lifetime exhibit to the public on May 12, 2018. 

Each donation over $10 will receive a special gift, in thanks for your generosity. We have many fabulous perks to choose from! Starting at a limited edition BMW poster, to tickets to the upscale Opening Night Celebration, to even "adopting" one of these winning vehicles, we're sure you'll find your perfect perk to go with your generous donation.

LeMay - America's Car Museum is a 501(3)c non-profit and relies upon the generosity of its donors to bring the best of the best to Tacoma, WA. This celebration of BMW's rich motorsport history can only be made possible with your support! Your contribution is tax-deductible.

The Cars

  • 1937 BMW 328
    • Raced for the first time in 1938. Overall winner of "Prijs von Zandvoort" in 1939.
  • 1961 BMW 700 RS
    • First 700 S built by BMW. Class winner at the 1961 races at Schauinsland, Germany and Gaisberg, Austria
  • ​1965 BMW 1800 TI/SA
    • ​Imported to the US by Max Hoffman. One of 200 built. Was completely restored in 1997.
  • 1972 BMW 3.0 CSL Group 2 Rally
    • BMW Motorsport's only factory CSL Rally Car. Owned by Peter Gleeson. 
  • ​1975 BMW 3.0 CSL Group 4 IMSA 
    • ​Winner of the IMSA race at Riverside. Driven by Hans Stuck. 
  • ​1976 LeMans Posey BMW 3.5 CS
    • ​Driven to 10th overall at he Famed 24 race in Sarthe. 
  • 1977 BMW E21 320 Turbo
    • One of five works cars build by BMW Motorsport in '77. Campaigned '77-'79 by David Hobbs & Ronnie Peterson.
  • 1981 March-BMW M1 / C
    • Built by March engineering and BMW. Driven by David Hobbs in the IMSA's GTP class. 
  • 1981 March-BMW 812 F2
    • German driver Christian Danner's first BMW works drive. 
  • ​1987 BMW E30 M3
    • First US-Spec E30 M3 built and campaigned by Korman Autowerks. Winner if the '87 Watkins Glen Six Hours. 
  • 1992 BMW E36 M3 GTS-3
    • First E36 M3 built by BMW Motorsports in '92. Races in the US. Winner of the Laguna Seca race in '97. 
  • 1994 BMW E34 M5
    • Winner of the 1994 Supercar championship at Long Beach and the Sebring season finale. 
  • 1994 BMW E36 318i
    • Initially a BMW Motorsport team Schnitzer car campaigned in the British Touring Car Championship.
  • 2000 BMW WilliamsF1 FW22
    • Driven by Raif Schumacher in eight F1 Races finishing 3rd in Austria, Belgium and Italy.
  • 2011 BMW E92 M3 GT
    • Campaigned in ALMS for two seasons with class wins in Sebring, Long Beach and Lime Rock. 
  • 2014 BMW E89 Z4 GTLM
    • Raced in ALMS in 2013 with a class win in Lime Rock. 
  • 2016 BMW F13 M6 GTLM
    • BMW Team secured a podium in its maiden podium at the 12-hour race in Sebring.

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to give? Give us a shout out instead! Use Indiegogo's sharing tools, post it on your personal or business social media or send it to your BMW-loving friends and family to help spread the word! We have limited time to make this exhibit happen and your help in sharing will make this campaign a success! 

Make sure to tag LeMay - America's Car Museum on your posts and use the official hashtag #BMWHeroesAtACM! 

Facebook  |  Twitter   |   Instagram

The original BMW Heroes of Bavaria exhibit at the BMW CCA Foundation in Greer, NC. 

Fantastic Perks at Each Level

Each donation over $10 will receive a special gift, in thanks for your generosity in supporting the BMW Heroes of Bavaria at LeMay - America's Car Museum. 

$5 - Every gift counts! We're grateful for your contribution

$10 – Thank you for chipping in! We'll email you a coupon for $2 off Museum admission to see the exhibit when it debuts

$20 – BMW Heroes of Bavaria Limited Edition Poster 

$50 – BMW Heroes of Bavaria Limited Edition Book 

$65 – 2 tickets to the 9 am Early Entry Celebration on Opening Day, Sunday, May 13, 2018 in Tacoma, WA - includes coffee & donuts while mingling with fellow enthusiasts! 

$80 – 2 "Day at the Museum" Passes - Includes Museum Admission, CXC Racing Simulator Rides & ACM License Plate Frame

$125 – America’s Car Museum VIP Tour Experience including Museum Admission for 2 

$150 – 2 tickets to the Heroes of Bavaria Opening Night Celebration on Saturday, May 12, 2018 in Tacoma, WA

$250 – Private Collection Tour for 2 featuring rare BMW's with Master Collector Peter Gleeson. Takes place in the Seattle area*

$300 – 4 tickets to the Opening Night Celebration on Saturday, May 12, 2018 in Tacoma, WA

$500 – 1-Year Silver ACM Membership , Limited Edition Book & Poster, 2 Tickets to Opening Night Celebration on Saturday, May 12, 2018 in Tacoma, WA

$800 – Private BMW Collection Tour featuring rare BMW's with Master Collector Peter Gleeson*, Limited Edition Book & Poster & 4 tickets to the Opening Night Celebration on Saturday, May 12, 2018 in Tacoma, WA

"ADOPT-A-WINNER" PROGRAM

$2000 - "Adopt" one of the exhibit cars by covering full transportation costs and receive 2 tickets to the Opening Night Celebration on Saturday, May 12, 2018 in Tacoma, WA, a 1-year Gold ACM Membership & your name or business featured on exhibit signage for one year**

*Tour date TBD, tour location in Seattle area, transportation to tour not included.

** Adoption of vehicles is first come, first served. You will be contacted to select your adopted vehicle after making your donation.

story:
My name is Contra Mestre Salim, I’ve been a disciple of Mestre João Grande for 22 years. During that time, I’ve witnessed the unwavering commitment that Mestre has towards his craft. I’ve tried to employ a similar ethic in using Capoeira Angola as a vehicle for community health, wellness, and transformation.

I now reside in Nairobi, Kenya, and I’m organizing Mandinga Ancestral, which brings Mestre João Grande to Africa to spread his knowledge to Kenyans and to forge an important cultural connection between the diaspora and the continent. Much of the work I’ve done with capoeira in Kenya has been outreach workshops to youth living in slums including Kibera (Africa’s largest urban slum) and Ngara. Your contribution to this campaign will enable these youths to participate in the festival free of charge and help make an elder Mestre’s dream, of bringing Capoeira Angola back to the continent, a reality.

What We Need

International participants register for the festival for an all-inclusive week-long experience of capoeira and dance workshops, cultural excursions, a safari, daily yoga, a workshop with youth from Kibera slum and more. As we have kept the registration costs extremely low (starting at $950 for international guests) in an effort to make the festival accessible to local and international participants, we need to subsidize our income through this campaign. Our goal is to raise $8,000 by November 10th to support the remaining costs. These expenses include:

  • Accommodation costs
  • Venue costs
  • Artists fees
  • Transportation costs

Perks for your generous contribution:

  • $15 – Commemorative Inaugural Ceramic Mug 
  • $35 –Offical Festival T-shirt
  • $50 –Reusable Large Canvas Shopping Tote
  • $100 –White or  Grey Hooded Sweatshirt with Festival Logo
  • $300 – Box Mounted Canvas Print of Orginal Artwork
  • $400-Handpainted Berimbau by CM Igor - a fully functional peice of orignal artwork
  • $500 or more – Sponosor Placement on Collateral and Your Choice of Gift

The Impact

Mandinga Ancestral will enable one of the great Mestres of our time to disseminate the philosophy and practice of Capoeira Angola in Kenya. We seek to forge a cultural bridge between Africa and the Diaspora. The practice of Capoeira Angola in Kenya holds an important place in the living history of our art and culture. In traditions throughout the world and particularly amongst African communities, the teachings of elders are the link to our past and supports our vision of the future. Your contribution to Mandinga Ancestral will help the continuity of our art and enable the Capoeira Angola community to forge a deep cultural connection with its roots.

Contra Mestre Salim has organized two major Capoeira Angola festivals including Mandinga Ancestral 2013 in Oakland, California with Mestre João Grande and Mestre Moraes. He has supported Capoeira Angola Center NY with numerous conferences and workshops in teaching and organizing capacities. In 2004, he also produced the award-winning documentary Besouro Preto (Black Beetle), which explores Central African philosophy and mysticism within capoeira. Mandinga Ancestral takes this experience to the next level with an all-inclusive international festival. Internationality founder, Yana Fleming has worked in communications and media for the last 17 years. Internationality is organizing the festival's marketing and communications. Visit mandingaancestral.com for details.

story:
(english bellow)

Votre participation est équivalente au tiers de nos besoins. Au total, il nous faut 12 000$ pour concrétiser ce projet. Voici ce que votre don peut accomplir:

500$ = On loue un camion pour aller à Sudbury
1000$ = On loue un camion pour aller à Sudbury ET Toronto
1500$ = On loue un camion pour aller à Sudbury ET Toronto ET Detroit
2000$ = On loue un camion pour aller à Sudbury ET Toronto ET Detroit ET on reviens à Montréal!
3000$ = Laurence, Marion et Gab ne dormiront pas dans la rue!
4000$ = Fanny, Alegria, Julie et Rose ne dormiront pas dans la rue non plus!

 

Les Auto-workshops sont des rencontres entre artistes et non-initié.es sur un terrain vague de Montréal depuis mai 2016, où son occupation ponctuelle sert d’atelier à l’expérimentation de la performance. C’est par le partage de connaissances et l’organisation horizontale que le collectif opère et s’autonomise. Ces journées consistent principalement en des exercices performatifs et des discussions autour de la démarche dans une ouverture au moment présent et à l’autre.  Le collectif des auto-workshops s’intéresse à l'utilisation des corps comme moyen de redéfinition des notions de (non-) lieu et de propriété, sur les capacités d’organisation en groupe ainsi qu’à la dépense de temps et d'énergie en dehors des normes de productivité. Les fissures citadines permettent une liberté d'action où émergent des performances contextuelles  inspirées par les objets et les accessoires trouvés sur leur sol, en plus du paysage atypique dans lequel les corps se glissent. En passant des journées entières dans les marges de la ville, le groupe éphémère développe une solidarité forte et un langage performatif unique.

Les Auto-workshops sur la route sera une «occupation-mobile» qui regroupera sept femmes du terrain Montréalais qui iront explorer les terrains vagues au Canada et aux États-Unis. En mai et juin 2018, le projet souhaite visiter quatre différents terrains vagues dans quatre différentes villes en Amérique du Nord afin de discuter avec chaque communauté spécifique au lieu. Des ateliers de performance se dérouleront à Sudbury, Toronto, Detroit et Montréal, invitant la communauté à s'engager dans une expérimentation corporelle de ces lots citadins délaissés. À la fin de chaque semaine, une présentation publique au terrain vague avec les nouveaux et nouvelles participant.es aura lieu. Les espaces artistiques (Centres d’artistes et initiatives citoyennes) ainsi que les artistes locaux dans les villes visitées seront sollicités préalablement pour rencontrer les communautés à l'extérieur de Montréal et relier nos actions largement.  

Les terrains vagues sont compris et perçus de différentes manières en fonction de l'histoire du territoire et des personnes vivant à proximité. Sudbury et Détroit sont porteuses d’un passé de désertion industrielle majeure qui a laissé de nombreux lots vacants et marqué la mémoire collective d’une sombre suite d'événements. Toronto est un grand centre urbain s’apparentant à Montréal dans sa réalité économique et culturelle. Nous pensons fortement que les particularités de chaque ville que nous comptons visiter nourriront nos réflexions avec de nouvelles considérations. Et nous souhaitons nourrir un dialogue basé sur les expériences acquises par notre collectif sur la route, en plus de rapporter ces recherches dans notre communauté large à Montréal pour informer la tactique de revendication des terrains vagues comme espace sociaux permettant la rencontre.

.....................................................................................................................................................................

The financial contribution we are asking for is equal to  one third  of total needs. Our project will need 12 000$ to materialize. Here is what your help can accomplish:

500$ = We rent a a truck to go to Sudbury
1000$ = We rent a a truck to go to Sudbury and Toronto
1500$ = We rent a a truck to go to Sudbury and Toronto and Detroit
2000$ = We rent a a truck to go to Sudbury and Toronto and Detroit and we come back to Montreal!
3000$ = Laurence, Marion and Gab won't sleep in the street!
4000$ = Fanny, Alegria, Julie and Rose won't sleep in the street neither!

The auto-workshop project started in May 2016 in Montreal, where we have been participating in the on-going and sporadic occupation of a forgotten lot with performance art. The collective focuses on the use of our bodies to redefine (non-) spaces and property notions, as well as questioning our capacities to organize in a group and spend time and energy outside the norms of productivity. The terrain vague, as we call it, allows us a freedom of action, which permits contextual performances to emerge. These are always inspired by the objects and props found on their ground and the atypical landscape our bodies slip in. By spending entire days in the city margins, the ephemeral group develops a strong solidarity and a unique performative language. These workshops are not just about/for artists or people who practice performance art – we strongly think that each person’s respective experiences and backgrounds can provide to auto-workshop groups with equal quality. We bring reflections, exercises and questions, but these are malleable to reflect / establish in a group. 

The Auto-workshop On the Road project is a group of seven women performers, taking the road next summer to visit vacant lots across the Canada and U.S. Scheduled for June 2018, this project will consist in our collective traveling to 4 different terrains vagues in 4 different cities in North America to engage with each specific community. The workshops would unravel for a week in every city, in one chosen vacant lot, inviting the community to engage in performative experimentations with us. Horizontally organised, they would mostly consist of performative exercises, discussions and knowledge sharing. This process will be concluded by a public presentation taking place with the new participants, as a result of a week of experimenting each space.

            The vacant lots are understood and perceived in different ways depending on the history of the territory and people living nearby. Sudbury and Detroit carry a history of major industrial desertion that has left many vacant lots and marked the collective memory of a dark event. Toronto is a major urban center similar to Montreal in its economic and cultural reality. We strongly believe that the particularities of each city that we intend to visit will feed our reflections with new considerations. And we want to nurture a dialogue based on the experiences of our collective on the road, in addition to bringing this research to our large community in Montreal to inform the tactics of claiming vacant lots as a social gathering space.

Toronto est un grand centre urbain s’apparentant à Montréal dans sa réalité économique et culturelle. Nous pensons fortement que les particularités de chaque ville que nous comptons visiter nourriront nos réflexions avec de nouvelles considérations. Et nous souhaitons nourrir un dialogue basé sur les expériences acquises par notre collectif sur la route, en plus de rapporter ces recherches dans notre communauté large à Montréal pour informer la tactique de revendication des terrains vagues comme espace sociaux permettant la rencontre.
.....................................................................................................................................................................
The financial contribution we are asking for is equal to  one third  of total needs. Our project will need 12 000$ to materialize. Here is what your help can accomplish:
500$ = We rent a a truck to go to Sudbury1000$ = We rent a a truck to go to Sudbury and Toronto1500$ = We rent a a truck to go to Sudbury and Toronto and Detroit2000$ = We rent a a truck to go to Sudbury and Toronto and Detroit and we come back to Montreal!3000$ = Laurence, Marion and Gab won't sleep in the street!4000$ = Fanny, Alegria, Julie and Rose won't sleep in the street neither!
The auto-workshop project started in May 2016 in Montreal, where we have been participating in the on-going and sporadic occupation of a forgotten lot with performance art. The collective focuses on the use of our bodies to redefine (non-) spaces and property notions, as well as questioning our capacities to organize in a group and spend time and energy outside the norms of productivity. The terrain vague, as we call it, allows us a freedom of action, which permits contextual performances to emerge. These are always inspired by the objects and props found on their ground and the atypical landscape our bodies slip in. By spending entire days in the city margins, the ephemeral group develops a strong solidarity and a unique performative language. These workshops are not just about/for artists or people who practice performance art – we strongly think that each person’s respective experiences and backgrounds can provide to auto-workshop groups with equal quality. We bring reflections, exercises and questions, but these are malleable to reflect / establish in a group. 
The Auto-workshop On the Road project is a group of seven women performers, taking the road next summer to visit vacant lots across the Canada and U.S. Scheduled for June 2018, this project will consist in our collective traveling to 4 different terrains vagues in 4 different cities in North America to engage with each specific community. The workshops would unravel for a week in every city, in one chosen vacant lot, inviting the community to engage in performative experimentations with us. Horizontally organised, they would mostly consist of performative exercises, discussions and knowledge sharing. This process will be concluded by a public presentation taking place with the new participants, as a result of a week of experimenting each space.
            The vacant lots are understood and perceived in different ways depending on the history of the territory and people living nearby. Sudbury and Detroit carry a history of major industrial desertion that has left many vacant lots and marked the collective memory of a dark event. Toronto is a major urban center similar to Montreal in its economic and cultural reality. We strongly believe that the particularities of each city that we intend to visit will feed our reflections with new considerations. And we want to nurture a dialogue based on the experiences of our collective on the road, in addition to bringing this research to our large community in Montreal to inform the tactics of claiming vacant lots as a social gathering space.

story:
CLOWN FOUNDING

A VISITA

Projecto Artístico de Solidariedade Social

O projecto A VISITA propõe visitas periódicas em estabelecimentos destinados à terceira idade. Estas visitas são realizadas pela Família Ri Alto, uma família de palhaços, composta por artistas profissionais, formados especificamente para este trabalho.

Um dos principais diferenciais do projecto é a criação de um processo de iteração através da memória, da empatia e do riso.

Estamos a trabalhar desde Fevereiro e são já três os lares visitados, em Cascais e na Amadora e existem já mais lares interessados em receber-nos.

Até ao momento, os profissionais que integram a Família Ri Alto têm vindo a realizar este projecto de forma voluntária, mas a continuidade do projecto dependerá da sua sustentabilidade financeira.

Acreditamos cada vez mais que este trabalho é não apenas importante, mas extremamente necessário na sociedade actual.

A nossa equipa é constituída por 7 artistas profissionais e 2 psicólogas que acompanham tecnicamente o trabalho realizado.

"Convidamos-vos a assistir a opinião de Cristina Ribeiro Pires, Psicóloga:

https://www.magisto.com/video/L14OO1cMHTRpXENgCzE?l=vsm&o=w&c=c

Para concretizar o nosso projecto A VISITA em 2017/2018 precisamos estar bem preparados!

 

PARA QUE SERVIRÁ ESTE CLOWN FOUNDING

Investimento em Bem-estar e Alegria

Realizamos este CLOWN FOUNDING para tentar criar condições para dar continuidade a este projecto e ajudar a família Ri Alto a tornar melhores e mais divertidas as suas visitas!

Necessitamos de 10.000 euros para financiar um ano completo de visitas em dois lares.

Com estes 10.000 euros conseguiremos:

- Contribuir para a melhoria de qualidade de vida e para o bem-estar de centenas de idosos e não só;​

- Poderemos manter o nosso projecto em 2 lares durante 1 ano;

- Poderemos investir na excelência do nosso trabalho e das nossas intervenções;

- Poderemos criar formas de auto-financiamento para poder chegar aos lares mais carenciados;
 
Assim, investiremos o sucesso desta campanha! 
 

 

LAR,

DIVERTIDO LAR

PORQUÊ É TÃO IMPORTANTE O NOSSO TRABALHO

 

Cerca de 100 mil idosos vivem actualmente em lares

O palhaço é um ser que navega nas emoções, que vai de encontro ao humano através da inocência e do humor (quando não do amor).  O riso e a espontaneidade que caracterizam a sua acção, potenciam a criação de um ambiente descontraído, leve e emotivo. 

A VISITA traz à tona o carácter divertido de situações banais do quotidiano e recria o espaço dos estabelecimentos, tornando-os espaços criativos e mais vivos. Aposta na promoção do bem-estar e um envelhecimento mais saudável e activo, aligeirando o estado de ânimo pela mão do humor e do riso. 

O público-alvo d’A VISITA são pessoas em sistema de internamento ou semi-internamento, dando prioridade às que se encontram em situação de maior isolamento e vulnerabilidade, mas a nossa acção estende-se também aos assistentes e auxiliares, assim como aos familiares que pontualmente se encontrem nos estabelecimentos.

                        

 

Esperamos por si na nossa família!

Seja parte deste projecto, A VISITA precisa de si!

Acompanhe-nos em:

www.avisita.pt

https://www.facebook.com/FamiliaRialto

Acompanhe-nos em:
www.avisita.pt
https://www.facebook.com/FamiliaRialto

story:
Dear friends!
We invite all of you to join our project 'Sponsor for Tibetan Monk'

Who we are: Gaden Jangtse Hardong Khangtsen monks and volunteers.
Our idea is to help our  young monks of Ganden Jangtse Hardong Monastery  to meet their sponsors.
Our goal is to help sponsors to find a good opportunity to take part in the life of the monks and accumulate auspicious merits by the 'Giving To Sangha'

How to donate: Choose any photo of 25 monks, who still do not have a sponsor (right column)
Click on it! "GET THIS PERK" And make your contribution!

or

We have updated the possibilities for financing.
You can make your choice: to become a sponsor for 1 month=($41) or for a year =($483)!
Also you can contribute by ordering a prayer rituals.
If you have any questions, be free to write to us to e-mail:

geshelobsangsoepa@gmail.com

If you like to donate any smaller amount $10/$15/$20/$25/  and ect. just clik on "BACK IT">> "CHECK OUT" and write your own amount!+ fill empty fields>> SUBMIT PAYMENT>> Done!

To do this, we step by step have to fundraise the amount to cover the daily expenses for the needs of the monks.

WHO ARE the SANGHA?

The Sangha originated in the group of disciples who renounced the worldly life to wander with the Buddha and listen to his teachings. After the Buddha’s death his disciples continued to live together as a community, wandering from place to place, living off the receipt of alms. 
The sangha is a part—together with the Buddha and the dharma (teaching)—of the Threefold Refuge, a basic creed of Buddhism.

Here you will find Tibetan monks who need sponsors. They are mostly newcomers from Tibet who walked across the Himalayas risking their lives in search of education, while some of them are orphans or from poor families from the Himalayan Region. We are asking your help by choosing one or more of the monks to sponsor. Just thirty-five US dollars (+ indiegogo commission+ Bank conversion commission) = $40.25 a month, per monk, goes a long way in India and helps the monks with their needs such as clothing, books, medical and dental costs and other daily necessities. We believe that this is a wonderful opportunity to practice your compassion and generosity.

After choosing a monk, please email Tenzin Yangchen at dewatsangcenter@gmail.com or Venerable Geshe Lobsang Soepa at geshelobsangsoepa@gmail.com
As soon as a monk is sponsored, the sponsor’s name (only) will appear next to the monk on the website, unless you would like it to read “anonymous.”

Be free to contact us:

Websites:

www.geshelobsangsoepa.org

www.gadenhardong.org

Email:

Tenzin Yangchen / dewatsangcenter@gmail.com

 Venerable Geshe Lobsang Soepa / geshelobsangsoepa@gmail.com

Facebook:

https://m.facebook.com/profile.php?id=591856517...

https://www.facebook.com/GadenHardong/

Youtube:

https://www.youtube.com/c/GesheLobsangSoepa

Our post details:

Lama Camp #1, p.o.

Tibetan Colony-581411, 

Mundgod, Distt North Kanara,

Karnataka State, India

*  *  *

Thank you for your contribution in helping all sentient beings by supporting the Buddha Sangha and Dharma.

For each FRIEND-Sponsor who will make a donation for 1year = $483 (Sponsor for a year) monks have a special surprises!

Please be sure to include an active email address when you donate.

story:
Short Summary

We're Traci and Kelley, a super powered sister baking duo! For the past two plus years, we've been baking up the greater Atlanta area with our pop events, catering and farmers markets. Coming up on our third year, we're ready to make that transition to a storefront. You always knew just pushing pastries was not the ultimate goal, right?! We know with your help, we can become the pillars that we desire to be with a space to not only stop by and get your sweet fix, but commune and co-create.

What We Need & What You Get

As we all know, stuff costs money. The commercial grade, honest, good stuff costs even more money. And instead of building from the ground up, we plan on renovating an existing building that needs a lil' (or a lotta) love. Renovations cost money! And we want an on-site garden ...but money doesn't grow on trees. You catch our drift LOL! And how lovely it would sound to say that our space was built with the love and donations for our fans, not a bank loan?? Just say it out loud... It sounds great. 

We're asking for $30k in 30 days! We know it's a lot, but we figure if just 10,000 of you beautiful people donate $3, we're set! And this will be a place you can come and say you helped build. All with a delicious Two Dough Girls treat in yo mouf!

The Impact

Your generous contributions will make this thing a reality. As we mentioned, we will not solely be a pop up bake shop anymore. We want to be engulfed in our community by hosting special events, welcoming other small Black business owners and co-creating. We want to be a destination for locals and visitors and a storefront will make it all possible. 

Risks & Challenges

If you've ever built anything from the ground up, then you know growth takes time. Seeing the end result can get blurry (with tears.. or is that doughnut glaze?). And things don't always go as you'd like or how you plan. But with hard work, sweat and determination, a Two Dough Girls shop will be actualized. We see it. And it's glorious.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't assist! Email us (twodoughgirls@gmail.com) if you'd like to donate your time or donate items such as kitchen appliances, utensils, dishes, furniture, artwork, etc. 

You can also help your favorite bakers by getting the word out. Make some noise about our campaign!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Charley and I'm a poet living in Peterborough. This year I launched the Freak Speak Young Collective, a workshop-style meet-up for young aspiring writers and poets aged 14-25, thanks to a successful funding bid to Arts Council England. The project is funded for a year to offer workshops and performance opportunities for collective members. The collective is free to join and meets bi-weekly at the Key Theatre.

The aim of this project is to offer other young poets the opportunities I wish I had. To create a visible, exciting, meaningful collective who will lead and shape the local and national poetry community.

The funding for Freak Speak goes towards paid performance slots, booking guest poets to deliver masterclasses, one-to-one mentorship time, and each collective member will be receive a professional film recording of one of their poems.

The funding will only keep us going for this year, so this campaign will form the start of my next plans to secure additional funding for 2019 and beyond.

The photos you see are of our two young collective members who performed their poetry for the first time to an audience of 55 as part of Peterborough Pride. They did Freak Speak proud!

 

What We Need & What You Get

£500 will allow us to provide match funding for future grants applications. It will also go towards:

- Paying guest artists to come and run workshops for the collective

- Travel expenses to allow participants with low income to attend the sessions

- A contribution towards paying fees for the Young Collective to perform at future Freak Speak gigs.

 

For our most recent gig as part of Peterborough Pride, we printed a series of t-shirts and stickers. These feature our latest monster artwork designed by Lee Mason. A totally rad way to show your support for a talented bunch of young people!

 

The Impact

The collective began in April 2018. We meet bi-weekly at the Key Theatre in Peterborough to write, learn, collaborate and develop. The group is diverse and full of motivation to commit to developing their writing. In the sessions so far, we have used poetry as a way to discuss important well-being topics such as mental health, bullying, and online culture. Poetry is a coping mechanism and a friend to these young people. 

 

So far in addition to running the workshops, I have been able to support three collective members, Leah Barfield, Adi Smalls, and Charlie Maddox, by giving them paid performance slots at the Freak Speak gigs. Quite honestly I feel like a proud mother, and to see their confidence and talents grow in such a short space of time is so gratifying. This is why you should support us, so the group can continue to grow a freaky batch of young poets capable of taking over the world.

Having successfully been supported by Arts Council England twice, this fundraiser will allow me to present the organisation with match funding to allow me to secure more funding for future projects with the group.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The Freak Speak Young Collective is always looking for new members! If you/someone you know is a bedroom poet or secret wordsmith and would like to get better in a room full of likeminded people, please tell them about us! You can contact us via our website:

www.freakspeakpoetry.co.uk

 

You can also help by spreading the word about this campaign!

story:
Join us in making a difference for independent filmmakers, artists, and social change.   

We are raising money to benefit the Pembroke Taparelli Arts and Film Festival (PTAFF), a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization dedicated to providing independent artists committed to social justice with a platform through which to share their work. Any donation you can give will make an impact! Thank you in advance for your contribution to this cause.

PTAFF is at the intersection between arts and social justice. We support artists who seek to use their voice in film, theatre, spoken word, painting, sculpting, and photography to bring to light such issues as poverty, gender inequality, homelessness, hunger, physical and psychological abuse, and racism. Presenting the works of these brave artists helps us affirm the place the arts has in strengthening our universal commitment to Human Rights and Social Justice.  

PTAFF brings together international filmmakers, performers, artist and educators to present their works and share with industry and community leaders as well as community audiences. Your assistance will make this festival a reality. We receive entries from countries such as Iran, United Kingdom, Turkey, Switzerland, Canada, Belgium, Russia and the United States. We also screen entries depicting issues such as gender identity, political unrest, gun violence, homelessness, bullying, human trafficking, and climate change.  These films and filmmakers are a voice for social justice around the globe.  

Your generosity will help us cover the following expenses:

Raleigh Studios festival location cost

Theatrical Performance of "Wedlock of the Gods"

Open Mic Night 

Publicist

Program Booklet

Honorarium for Jurors, Panelists, and Performers​

Help us give a voice to those without one. Our socially conscious ‘artivists’ deserve to have their work shared with the world. Your donation will help make that happen!

If you are unable to donate today, please share this campaign with your friends and family. We also welcome volunteers. Contact us at info@ptaff.org.

PTAFF is a 501(c)3 nonprofit; all donations are tax deductible. Tax ID: 31954.
story_txt:
Join us in making a difference for independent filmmakers, artists, and social change.   
We are raising money to benefit the Pembroke Taparelli Arts and Film Festival (PTAFF), a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization dedicated to providing independent artists committed to social justice with a platform through which to share their work. Any donation you can give will make an impact! Thank you in advance for your contribution to this cause.PTAFF is at the intersection between arts and social justice. We support artists who seek to use their voice in film, theatre, spoken word, painting, sculpting, and photography to bring to light such issues as poverty, gender inequality, homelessness, hunger, physical and psychological abuse, and racism. Presenting the works of these brave artists helps us affirm the place the arts has in strengthening our universal commitment to Human Rights and Social Justice.  
PTAFF brings together international filmmakers, performers, artist and educators to present their works and share with industry and community leaders as well as community audiences. Your assistance will make this festival a reality. We receive entries from countries such as Iran, United Kingdom, Turkey, Switzerland, Canada, Belgium, Russia and the United States. We also screen entries depicting issues such as gender identity, political unrest, gun violence, homelessness, bullying, human trafficking, and climate change.  These films and filmmakers are a voice for social justice around the globe.  Your generosity will help us cover the following expenses:
Raleigh Studios festival location cost
Theatrical Performance of "Wedlock of the Gods"
Open Mic Night 
Publicist
Program Booklet
Honorarium for Jurors, Panelists, and Performers​
Help us give a voice to those without one. Our socially conscious ‘artivists’ deserve to have their work shared with the world. Your donation will help make that happen!
If you are unable to donate today, please share this campaign with your friends and family. We also welcome volunteers. Contact us at info@ptaff.org.PTAFF is a 501(c)3 nonprofit; all donations are tax deductible. Tax ID: 31954.

story:
What We Need

We are raising funds to help us pay for a combination of speaker fees, film rights, catering, guest artists and teachers across the various events in the month. These funds help us to keep most of the Black History Month Celebration free to the public and therefore accessible to all.

The Impact

Now in its fourth year, Saxapahaw Black History Month is an important and impactful way to celebrate the unique contributions of Black people to American Society. At a moment when many of our communities are more divided than ever, the opportunity to come together as neighbors to celebrate the achievements of those who have been traditionally marginalized by mainstream American society, serves a vision for a more just and equitable world in which we all may live.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please let your friends and neighbors know about our campaign by sharing it on social media or by email. Be an ambassador for the Saxapahaw Black History Celebration, and by all means, please come and participate!

Want to sponsor a specific event?

Are you an individual or business that would love to sponsor one of the incredible events that we will be hosting? Whether financially or with specific items please contact mtende@culturemill.org for more information.

story:
Rwanda is becoming home for many black expats from around the world. With the cost of living, need for innovative business, high safety standards and progressive lifestyles…it is a major attraction for those moving to Africa. Our community is thriving, look at the various social media accounts, friendly emails back and forth and occasional outings. However, due to Covid-19 regulations, as well as the fast rate of our growth…expats are disconnected and don’t have a “landing space” to help them navigate through daily life.

We were brought up on the idea of community. We watch each other’s back. We know the “hook ups” and we share information to help each other. That is what My Cousin Connection is. It is a platform that brings us together, watches and caters to the things we need and fosters networking while we discover who and what we are in this new land.

 

And we need it. We have people landing in Rwanda every day, we are here to support, help, empower and build. We are the community that will know where you are and how to connect you to where you are trying to go.  We are the family that has your back.  

Within this network is a unique Care Connection feature that sends monthly notifications out to members, as a safety check to ensure that everything is okay. We know your emergency contact information, important health issues and will even visit the doctor with you in order to ensure that you physical being is cared and accounted for. We are the people your momma will call when she don’t hear from her baby. Basically, we got your back.

 

 

Website & App Outline

We operate with three main purposes, which are outlined in the functionality of the website/app.  

1)  To provide information to black expats who are looking to relocate to Rwanda

2)  To support black expats living in Rwanda

3)   To provide an emergency care network for those living in Rwanda to assist with contact information, allergy and medication notification, legal matters regarding personal property and details that relate to personal needs.

 

Roll Out

There are Three Phases in order to bring My Cousin Connection to full capacity.  We do this in order to ensure that your donation is used in the best capacity.  This phase roll out will help create sustainability and allow the organization to support itself, based upon member subscriptions and not donations. 

Phase One Roll Out

Phase One allows our promise to our members to be fulfilled as well, catches a large expat movement that will occur during the summer months.  By focusing first on the website we are able to have a product available within a two month span and start catering to the needs of the black expat community. 

Phase Two

Phase Two introduces the app portion, used in the same dual capacity.  Now members can be connected via website or smartphone based upon their preference.  We also make sure that this is able to be accessed for all our generations of users.  We also begin monthly notifications, when members get a push notification to "check-in" and they respond with a personalized code.  This is our first system of safety checks as well as knowing the number of expats in Rwanda.  

Phase Three

Phase Three is full incorporation of the app and website and everything working at 100%.  The Care Connection is also working at full capacity with personalized support.

 

How it Works

In order to keep sustainability, once we roll out My Cousin Connection, we will have a $5 monthly subscription fee for members.  Once we reach a minimum of 100 subscribers, we will have full capacity to run the program plus employees and build a self-generating income to cover the minimum expenses associated with the company. 

 

Why Support

We need you.  We need the community to come out and build community.  This is like that "Rent Party" back in the day,  or the passing of the church bucket.  We need you to make this happen for us.  We have the opportunity to change what life aboard can look like for people trying to explore different ideas.   In our world, we must have a watchful eye for each other and this is the way to do it.  Organized, detailed and purposeful, we allow you the freedom to explore but the support system to help guide you when you need us.  As well, we must have that emergency network system in place to ensure that we are and will be okay. 

For more information, we have information on our landing site, www.mycousinconnection.com as well, check out more videos on our creator's YouTube Page:  Jai Essence Journey.

 

Thank you so much.

story:
International Student Week in Belgrade (ISWiB) is an 8 day festival organized by young people in the capital of Serbia - Belgrade. For the 13th year running, ISWiB’s organizational team is working tirelessly to establish another great festival in July 2019. About 250 students from all over the world are gathering in Belgrade during summer to enjoy everything that ISWiB has to offer. They are ready to actively participate in cultural and scientific workshops, work on solving critical global issues and, at the same time, to represent their country in the best way possible. Through our various educational workshops and entertaining events we ought to connect young people from different cultural backgrounds from all over the world in order to prosper multicultural dialogue. In addition, we put an emphasized accent to anti-discrimination and inclusivity.

What being a part of ISWiB Community means?

  • 1000+ participants
  • from 100+ countries
  • 300+ organizational team members
  • 30+ promoters
  • 120+ moderators

 

 

“So far, I have not spoken about what it means to spend a night in Belgrade while on ISWiB. And you know what, I won’t. Because the experience cannot fit into a paragraph, a page, or some paper that can be scrolled back and forth. It’s something that words can do no justice to, and while my eloquence can go a lot further than that, I will spare you the unnecessary word count and would simply suggest you apply for a summer that can really change your life. Or at least those parts of it that are much less exciting. If you’ve come here to learn, don’t bring a pen and a notebook. Just free your mind off of all the negative energy, and get ready to inhale the miraculous redeeming air of Belgrade.”

Constantina Bandutova, ISWiB participant

 

“If you wish to visit the whole world then you are in the right place. During ISWIB you visit the whole world in a single place. I found incredible friends that I still actively keep in touch with (oh hi, Poli, Rosa, Milos T, Milos N, Ana, Bojan, Pedja, Agatka, Sonjuska, Tamara, Andjela, Monika, Perko, Ania, all of the Jelenas, Alex and the list goes on and on and on). I fell in love – with people and the city that I keep coming back to every year. I got to wave my national flag across the streets of the Serbian capital alongside people from all continents, I laughed and cried, while still feeling happy on the inside.”

Ashraf Noori, ISWiB participant

 

“It does not really matter if it would be as a participant, a moderator, an organizer or a volunteer, the International Student Week in Belgrade has the power to unite ideas and experiences and create a family of hundreds of people, brothers and sisters from different countries, from the same planet called Earth.”

Emanuele Carnevale, ISWiB workshop moderator

 

 

We need your support to be able to cover festivals’ expenses, as well as to make ISWiB 2019 bigger and better than ever before!  We hope to source $3000 from kind supporters on Indiegogo (like you!) to fund a part of the festival’s expenses. Our other sources of funding include: fundraiser events, grant funding and participation fees. Unfortunately that is not enough to organize every activity that our festival traditionally includes and that's why we need your kind and considerate help!

Your contribution will go towards paying our festival expenses, including:

  • Venue rentals and all the equipment
  • Transport
  • Food for our out of dorm activities
  • Paying the moderators of our workshops
  • Posters, banners, leaflets and info booklets
  • Advertising
  • Identity cards for all the participants, organizers, promoters volunteers and moderators
  • Bank fees
  • Website fee

 

 

This year’s slogan is ’’The future is calling!’’with the main focus on the 4.0 revolution through out information technology, blockchain and gaming. In a world where technological progress gets faster and new business profiles open on a daily basis, there is something for everyone and we can all find our own special place in the world. Therefore, it is important to prepare young people for these upcoming changes. We are actively trying to promote the attitude of open-mindedness for new opportunities and innovations by providing participants with necessary education on the latest major discoveries, which will soon be used regularly. Our goal is to make a change in everyday lives and inspire every participant to use the acquired knowledge in their own looking for innovation.

 

 

1. WE WORK!

The biggest and most important part of the festival are workshops. Full participation, of young people attending this festival, is achieved through direct work in workshops dealing with current topics, innovations and the burning problems of youth worldwide. Every workshop has a moderator whose job is to share their talents, knowledge and skills and, of course, to make workshop goals come to life.

This year the festival includes 11 workshops:

  1. Branding and sales – Strategies for Success
  2. Film making workshop – Brave new world
  3. Dance workshop – Bring the passion
  4. 3D printing – Craft your vision
  5. Comics workshop – Futuropia
  6. Ecology workshop – I am the change
  7. Gaming workshop – Level up!
  8. Musical – Piece of mind
  9. Start-up workshop – Achieve the Dream
  10. Cryptocurrencies – The currency of tomorrow
  11. Yoga workshop – Finding inner peace

2. WE HAVE FUN!

Every day, after workshops, we organize loads of other activities for our participants in order to make their stay in Belgrade as unforgettable as possible! This year a bunch of fun activities will be offered, such as:

  • Country Fair - a unique open-air event on which festival participants have the opportunity to represent their cultures through their traditional clothing, crafts, music, typical specialties and drinks.
  • Art Night - an event that's introducing young artists from Serbia to participants in the best way. This evening is dedicated to art in all its forms - various genres of music, numerous types of dance and photo exhibitions.
  • Flag parade - event in the center of Belgrade that includes all participants, organizers and volunteers of the festival who are marching through Knez Mihailova street with flags of their countries with a mission to send a message of acceptance, tolerance and multiculturalism to the public
  • Trip to Novi Sad – this year Novi Sad is the European Youth Capital 2019! Participant will get to know the city in all its beauty and have fun while doing it.

 

 

Besides donating money you can also help by following ISWiB on all platforms:

  • Instagram: @iswib_
  • Facebook: facebook.com/iswib/
  • Website: iswib.org

story:
We are raising funds to:

  • Enable professional and personal development of global change-makers by connecting them to organizations in India.
  • Develop more work/volunteering/and learning opportunities in Bangalore and Ahmadabad.
  • Bring on-board more host families that can give travelers an authentic cultural experience on board.
  • Create necessary infrastructure to build this global community.

 

Impact:

The projected impact of this service is multifaceted.

For people from coming to India via Bridge Cultures:

  • Access to employment: Bridge Cultures gives individuals the opportunities to realize aspirations by connecting them to organizations that provide short-term work opportunities that give them the experiences they are looking for.
  • Important skill development: By working abroad and in a developing economy, individuals gain diverse skills that can be imparted anywhere in the globe.

For organizations in India:

  • Access to unrecognized and untapped skilled personnel which could be difficult to reach otherwise.
  • Wider search for specific job roles.
  • Diversity in the team.
  • New ideas, perspectives and varied skill sets.
  • Reduced time and effort in finding the right candidate.

Host families:

  • Learning and experiencing new cultures.
  • Expanding horizons and gaining mutually enriching experiences.
  • Gaining additional income.
  • Developing connections with people from across the globe.

 

Perks / Rewards:

You can get some great rewards by funding our venture! See the right side of this page for all our reward options. Rewards are also transferable to friends and family who plan to travel to India, and valid until 2021. This means if you aren’t traveling anytime soon, your close ones can benefit and use the services you earn by supporting us!

You can choose any one from the options mentioned under every contribution bracket.

 

Testimonials:

 

You can also support us by getting the word out and making some noise about this campaign.

Contribute and do not forget to share this campaign in your networks (using the share tools in the link). Any support will be highly appreciated.

Thank You!

story:
Overview

Almost 1200 years ago, a king was killed in battle. He was king Audbjørn, king of one of the most important Viking districts in Norway; Fjordane. He was a wealthy king with a high status in the Viking society, and his ship was amongst the largest Viking ships that the world has seen. But this 100ft long historic treasure followed its king in his funeral, where it was reduced to ashes together with his fortune.

Now history is about to rise from the ashes as the re-build of the Myklebust ship has begun, only inches from where the ship last sailed into battle.

 

Story

The Battle of Solskjel
In the Viking Age the warrior identity stood strong, and the Vikings did not only fight on their journeys to other countries, but they also fought each other. There were numerous kings ruling different parts of Norway, and many of them were eager to gain control over larger areas. One of them was king Harald who wanted to gain control of the entire country, and gather Norway as one kingdom.

The spring of the year 876, king Harald gathered his army and prepared to sail south to Sunnmøre. A king named Solve Klove had spent the winter attacking Harald’s men in north Møre, and also spent some time with his friend, king Arnvid, in south Møre. When they got the word that king Harald was coming, they gathered their troops, which grew fast as many people held a grudge against king Harald.

Solve Klove travelled to Nordfjord to king Audbjørn of the Fjords, and asked him to join them with his army. As the choice stood between working together and create an army that was big enough to have a chance against Harald, or to surrender and become king Harald’s slaves, the choice was easy. King Audbjørn promised to come, and sailed north with his men to join the large army.

They met king Harald by the island of Solskjel on the coast of northern Møre, and they battled him from their ship. It was common practice to tie the ships together side by side when they battled at sea, and the bravest warriors, the berserks, fought in the bow of the ship. This is also how they fought in the battle of Solskjel, and men fell on both sides. Finally, king Harald became so savage that he drove king Arnvid’s army back all the way to the mast of the ship, and stepped aboard. Many of king Arnvid’s men fled, and king Arnvid himself fell in the battle. King Audbjørn also fell, but Solve Klove fled and managed to get away.

After the battle King Audbjørn’s body was brought back to Nordfjordeid where he was cremated together with his ship and other belongings. The ship burial with cremation was a pagan custom, similar to how the norse God Balder was cremated in the sagas. According to Ibn Fadlan’s descriptions of a Viking burial, the cremation was in order to ensure the king a fast journey to Valhalla, and not to leave him to rot in the ground.

The battle of Solskjel was described in king Harald’s Saga “Heimskringla”, and dates the battle where king Audbjørn fell to the year 876. This correlates well with the dating of the Myklebust grave to the last half of the eight hundreds. It is quite unique that this grave can be tied to historic sources and named persons, and this gives us an incredible insight into king Audbjørn’s death.

The Myklebust ship

The practice of rivet built Scandinavian vessels is known from older iron age, but it was not until about year 500 that these vessels were equipped with sails and rigs. This technological advancement is what made the Viking age possible, and the reason for the Vikings further expansion and military dominance in this time. The vessels were fast, went in shallow water and did not need a harbor, and they could sail even in unfavorable onshore wind conditions.

The large Viking ships that have been described in the sagas have through several ship graves in Scandinavia been found to have existed in real life, and the “Myklebust” ship is the largest one that has been excavated in Norway. The large dimensions of the split rivets and nails used in the ship reveal that this was a ship of considerable size. The estimations conclude the ship was about 100ft long, 21ft wide, and the bows raged around 22ft high. It had about 48 shields and 24 oar pairs, the number of shields most likely represent the number of crewmembers on the ship.

 

What we want to do

Our goal is to rebuild the Myklebust ship in full scale with all its original features and interior that followed it on it's journeys on the sea. The ship should be able to be rowed on the fjord, but most of the time it will be exhibited on land in the Sagastad center, which will be built specifically to host the ship. Sagastad will be built to look like a burial mound, and will be a center aimed at experiencing the history connected to the Viking age in the region.

Our goal for this crowdfunder is $100 000, which is actually less than 10% of the cost of the whole ship, so it is a huge project. But every little helps, and we would be absolute delighted if you can help us reach our goal, and support our soon to be living cultural heritage! If we reach our goal this could fund the thousands of split rivets in the ship or could go a long way on funding the dragon or serpent head of the ship. Your help could even mean the difference between getting the sail for the ship or not!

 

How we will do it

The rebuild of the “Myklebust” ship has already started on the shore of Nordfjordeid where you can follow the build through several viewings throughout the year. The ship is being built by boat builders from Bjørkedal in Møre og Romsdal, where boat building traditions go back several centuries. The building of the ship started in December 2016 and the plan is to finish it by January 1 in 2019.

Click photo to see video from the build.

We will have regular viewings at the building site, which will help fund the building and create an interest in the project. In order to ensure the authenticity of the project, we cooperate with several organizations like the University museum in Bergen and the culture department of Sogn og Fjordane County. We are on our way, but we need your support to complete the project.

 

What We Need

It takes many resources to build a Viking ship like this. We have specialized boat builders, materials produced specifically for the project and people working with the planning and viewings of the ship. The project has been lucky to receive a lot of interest and support locally, but we think this is spectacular enough to reach out to the world. As of 2017, Nordfjordeid will become a cruise destination with its own sea walk, and we need to be ready to let the world see our project in work. A pot of funding would help us pay for things like;

  • Materials for the ship
  • Our boat builders wages
  • Guides to tell the story at our viewings

  • Technical equipment like microphones and a projector to show the progress in pictures during our viewings

 

What You Get

Eventually you will get a spectacular Viking ship, which you can visit in the Sagastad center in Norway. It should also be possible to row it on the fjord on special occasions.

For those who donate $20 you will get your name on our website.

If you donate $50 you will also get a signed Sagastad thank you postcard sent home to you.

For $250 we will also include a Sagastad birthday calendar in your package which will help you remember the birthdays of your loved ones or any other important dates.

We are also going to make a book with pictures from the whole build and until the launch on the fjord. This book will be yours and sent to your mailbox if you choose this $500 perk. Also includes all perks listed above.

When it is all finished you can get a personal tour of the Sagastad center and the Myklebust ship through Skype. This $1000 perk will even allow you to virtually climb aboard the finished longship. We will answer any questions you may have, and also include all of the above listed perks.

If you donate $5000 we will do something really cool. We will put your name in the “Window of opportunity”, the window by the entrance of the Sagastad center. Here we want to present you who have given us this unique opportunity to complete our project.

If you donate $10 000 you will get a lifetime experience. You will not only get all of the above perks, we will also invite you to a special Viking event in Nordfjordeid the spring of 2019 when both the ship and the Sagastad center is finished. Exactly what this event will be is not entirely settled yet, but it will be something worthy of a Viking king!

 

Risks & Challenges

There are risks and challenges ahead, and we are making plans to manage them:

  • Economic risk. This crowd funder is a part of reducing the financial risks in this project. The more support we get from you, the less funds will need to come from loans.
  • Visiting hours during the build. We will need to be flexible to ensure that our visiting hours give us the best possible profit.

  • Launching of the ship once it is finished. There is no absolute guarantee that the ship will actually float once launched, or that it won't be harmed during the launch, but our experienced boat builders are taking every precaution. In addition, we are asking everyone for their prayers to Thor and Odin!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to funding, there are also other ways to help our project.

  • Share a link to this crowd funder with your networks
  • Like us on Facebook and share our posts

  • Share our website

We highly appreciate your support!

THANK YOU!

Overview
Almost 1200 years ago, a king was killed in battle. He was king Audbjørn, king of one of the most important Viking districts in Norway; Fjordane. He was a wealthy king with a high status in the Viking society, and his ship was amongst the largest Viking ships that the world has seen. But this 100ft long historic treasure followed its king in his funeral, where it was reduced to ashes together with his fortune.
Now history is about to rise from the ashes as the re-build of the Myklebust ship has begun, only inches from where the ship last sailed into battle.
 
Story
The Battle of SolskjelIn the Viking Age the warrior identity stood strong, and the Vikings did not only fight on their journeys to other countries, but they also fought each other. There were numerous kings ruling different parts of Norway, and many of them were eager to gain control over larger areas. One of them was king Harald who wanted to gain control of the entire country, and gather Norway as one kingdom.
The spring of the year 876, king Harald gathered his army and prepared to sail south to Sunnmøre. A king named Solve Klove had spent the winter attacking Harald’s men in north Møre, and also spent some time with his friend, king Arnvid, in south Møre. When they got the word that king Harald was coming, they gathered their troops, which grew fast as many people held a grudge against king Harald.
Solve Klove travelled to Nordfjord to king Audbjørn of the Fjords, and asked him to join them with his army. As the choice stood between working together and create an army that was big enough to have a chance against Harald, or to surrender and become king Harald’s slaves, the choice was easy. King Audbjørn promised to come, and sailed north with his men to join the large army.
They met king Harald by the island of Solskjel on the coast of northern Møre, and they battled him from their ship. It was common practice to tie the ships together side by side when they battled at sea, and the bravest warriors, the berserks, fought in the bow of the ship. This is also how they fought in the battle of Solskjel, and men fell on both sides. Finally, king Harald became so savage that he drove king Arnvid’s army back all the way to the mast of the ship, and stepped aboard. Many of king Arnvid’s men fled, and king Arnvid himself fell in the battle. King Audbjørn also fell, but Solve Klove fled and managed to get away.
After the battle King Audbjørn’s body was brought back to Nordfjordeid where he was cremated together with his ship and other belongings. The ship burial with cremation was a pagan custom, similar to how the norse God Balder was cremated in the sagas. According to Ibn Fadlan’s descriptions of a Viking burial, the cremation was in order to ensure the king a fast journey to Valhalla, and not to leave him to rot in the ground.

The battle of Solskjel was described in king Harald’s Saga “Heimskringla”, and dates the battle where king Audbjørn fell to the year 876. This correlates well with the dating of the Myklebust grave to the last half of the eight hundreds. It is quite unique that this grave can be tied to historic sources and named persons, and this gives us an incredible insight into king Audbjørn’s death.

This technological advancement is what made the Viking age possible, and the reason for the Vikings further expansion and military dominance in this time. The large Viking ships that have been described in the sagas have through several ship graves in Scandinavia been found to have existed in real life, and the “Myklebust” ship is the largest one that has been excavated in Norway. The large dimensions of the split rivets and nails used in the ship reveal that this was a ship of considerable size. It had about 48 shields and 24 oar pairs, the number of shields most likely represent the number of crewmembers on the ship.

Our goal is to rebuild the Myklebust ship in full scale with all its original features and interior that followed it on it's journeys on the sea. The ship should be able to be rowed on the fjord, but most of the time it will be exhibited on land in the Sagastad center, which will be built specifically to host the ship. Sagastad will be built to look like a burial mound, and will be a center aimed at experiencing the history connected to the Viking age in the region.Our goal for this crowdfunder is $100 000, which is actually less than 10% of the cost of the whole ship, so it is a huge project. But every little helps, and we would be absolute delighted if you can help us reach our goal, and support our soon to be living cultural heritage! If we reach our goal this could fund the thousands of split rivets in the ship or could go a long way on funding the dragon or serpent head of the ship. Your help could even mean the difference between getting the sail for the ship or not!

There is no absolute guarantee that the ship will actually float once launched, or that it won't be harmed during the launch, but our experienced boat builders are taking every precaution. story:
Who Is CONSERVATIVES' CORNER?

CONSERVATIVES CORNER is a colloquium of conservative thinkers and materials, and we are the largest repository of conservative resources online. We are military veterans and patriots of all walks of life who affirm our values of faith, family, and country.

Conservatives Corner:

 

CONSERVATIVES CORNER was established by John Moraga, a U.S. Air Force veteran who served under two presidents and during the tragedies of 9/11. He has a degree in bioethics from the University of Judaism (renamed AJU), and he has conducted scientific research at Cedar Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles, CA, as well as legal research for the Jerusalem Institute of Justice in Israel.

As a result of coordinating a team of conservative business leaders, attorneys, and writers across the country to contribute their time, CONSERVATIVES CORNER is amply equipped to provide conservatives business networking, academic research, news, and other unique features in an innovative format. We offer several free resources, as well as products and services for the conservative consumer to shop. In general, we promote constitutional rights, the free market, and a healthy military. In addition, we extend our hand of friendship to foreign allies such as the United Kingdom, Israel, Australia, South Korea, and other democracies around the globe.

What Is Our Mission?

Our goal is to champion conservative principles through a multi-faceted platform by connecting conservatives around the country and across the globe. 

  • So, how do we make this happen? Chief among many elements required are PEOPLE! Each person's contributions are valuable. However, people's most effective contributions are obviously financial. "Seed" funding is being raised for three main areas:

  1. Equipment: apps, software/hardware, audio, visual, etc. $1,259
  2. Marketing: merchandise, website, SEO, etc. $758
  3. *Confirmation: promoting conservative principles by supporting this endeavor will provide confirmation that CONSERVATIVES CORNER has the backing of genuine conservatives who believe in our efforts and desire to see our success. "We" are "YOU." 

*If our goal is achieved, this campaign is eligible to continue raising funds beyond that amount, to help support even grander projects and reach even more people!

  • Whether you're considering investing a $10 good faith contribution, or whether one of our several “perks” have peeked your interest, please understand you are doing more than just investing in OUR efforts, you're making YOUR voice heard around the nation and even to various places around the world! Financial contributions demonstrate a person's willingness to part with a portion of what he or she owns, in order to make a statement and directly impact the change YOU desire. 

"Majestic Mug" included in our PILLAR and CONSERVATIVE perks: 

  • Please share this campaign with your friends and family! Get as many people involved as you can in this new, amazing, conservative platform.

YOUR Impact

CONSERVATIVES CORNER urges you to make a contribution (another, if you've already made one)! However, we believe conservatism is too important to try to convince you we are the only true investment to support as a conservative platform. Conservatives around the country and even around the globe need to open the channels of communication, in order to speak with the loudest voice possible. Obviously, CONSERVATIVES CORNER desires your contributions and we are humbled to know you have invested in our efforts. By investing in this campaign you become part of our national and global team of conservatives, who can be more effective promoting our values together than we can individually. YOU really do make an impact!
