story:
GiveBack - The Vision

GiveBack is an initiative which facilitates the sharing of ideas, skills, talents and passions between members of the Caribbean diaspora and their countrymen back at home.

Barbadian Celia Grannum and Jamaican Kris Jobson met during their freshman year at Tisch School of the Arts, New York University. They became fast friends, aware of an energetic resonance beyond their Caribbean roots. They supported each other through the rigorous training of their program and the challenges of stepping into the world of professional dance in New York City. After graduating, they criss- crossed the globe, and their paths intersected in the United Kingdom, Switzerland and Miami. As their lives expanded to encompass new career pursuits and family responsibilities, their friendship deepened, and they continued to giggle like the freshmen of years prior. Today, they bring their combined talents, experience and creative power together in a venture that is dear to both of their hearts - sharing their light with their community back at home.

 

GiveBack - The Projects

GiveBack completed it's first project, Barbados | Be Moved, in October 2019, touching the lives of over one hundred performing artists in the course of week.  Be Moved, the documentary, is currently being edited, and a work-in-progess version of the film can be viewed above. 

GiveBack is returning to Barbados this April to facilitate three weeks of activities as part of Dance Month 2020. The program will include over  160 contact hours  with local performers, and the creation and staging of  10 different performances  for the We Gatherin' year-long community building celebration.

This project is entitled Barbados | Soul Dance. The GiveBack team will :

- Conduct technique intensives

- Mentor and coach local dancers, choreographers and teachers

- Create new choreography

- Stage and direct pop-up performances which will make dance more accessible to  the general public

- Lead community outreach programs to bring the joy of dance to people of all ages

-Facilitate mindfulness and stress-reduction workshops

- Coach and mentor members of the street dance community

- Coordinate and facilitate a DANCE AWARENESS DAY to educate the public about the world of professional dance through:

* Demonstrations of training methods for different dance styles and techniques 

*  Lectures about the life of a professional dancer and the demands of the international dance industry 

* Choreographic showcases

* Open Q&A between the GiveBack team, local artists and the audience 

 

 

Our aim is to raise the profile of dance in Barbados so that it can be seen and respected as a viable career and not just a hobby. The filming of Soul Dance is an integral part of our educational outreach. A film episodic series will be created and will tell the stories of the lives of both individual performers and local dance groups. Their rigorous training, hopes, dreams, daily challenges, family support or lack thereof, successes and failures, will be captured and the series will be used locally for education as well as marketed regionally and internationally to highlight the lives of artists in the Caribbean. 

This project is being planned in conjunction with the National Cultural Foundation of Barbados. We will work with hundreds of dancers, teachers, students, youth, and members of the general public over the course of three weeks. The project will positively impact every individual participant, and send ripples of heart-opening, boundary shattering, consciousness shifting inspiration out into the fabric of Barbadian society.

Soul Dance is part of an on-going incentive to cultivate a new dimension of the Performing Arts throughout the Caribbean and Barbados is the first stop. We are already in the process of establishing connections in Jamaica with the goal of launching our first GiveBack Performing arts and Fashion project there in the coming months. We are excited to unfold similar projects throughout the Caribbean, which are tailor-made for each island, taking into consideration their unique arts and cultural heritage.

GiveBack - The Team

Celia Grannum 

Celia Grannum is a Barbadian who takes the sunshine wherever she goes. She completed a B.F.A. in Dance at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts, and pursued a career as a dancer, choreographer and teacher in the U.S., U.K., Japan, Switzerland and The Netherlands. She moved effortlessly between jazz, modern, contemporary and ballet styles, which allowed her to work with the likes of Tony award winning choreographer Wayne Cilento and Rafael Bonachela, Director of Sydney Dance Company, and be a founding member of London’s renowned Ballet Black. She directed her own company in Amsterdam, which was the hub of a vibrant freelance community. Her study and practice of Pilates, Yoga and Mindfulness, Thai Yoga Massage, and Homeopathy, deepened her understanding of anatomy, physiology, and the vital force, and aided her development of an anatomically sound, effective teaching style.

Kris Jobson

Kris was born in Kingston, Jamaica. A consummate artist - a creative and artistic director, dancer, choreographer, speaker, writer, singer, actor and model - he received his B.F.A degree from the prestigious New York University, Tisch School of the Arts. Kris also had the pleasure of training at the Dance Theatre of Harlem, Alvin Ailey and The Joffrey Ballet schools. He has worked on TV shows, commercials, films and various productions as the Lead Talent and as creator/Director throughout Italy, Germany, Switzerland, China, U.S.A., South Africa, Morocco, Austria, Scandinavia, Japan and Thailand. Kris is currently the Choreographer and Principal Dancer for the Andrea Bocelli World Tour for the regions of Germany, Switzerland and South Africa. Having modeled for Calvin Klein, Verri, Fucci, Aimer and Triumph, and appearing on numerous print campaigns, Kris is also part of the Fashion Sector as a Director, choreographer and coordinator of many international Fashion shows such as Mercedes Benz Fashion Week Berlin, Milan, Shanghai and the Vogue Salon Shows in Germany.

Alex Milewski

GiveBack Guest Alex Milewski is a full time movement artist, wellness coach and educator. Since 2006 he has competed, taught and performed around the world. Over the last two years Alex has travelled extensively in Central and South America facilitating dance trainings, intensives and dance-focussed community building activities in underserved communities. His movement style is rooted in BBoying, Martial Arts, Tricking, Contemporary and House Dance. His mission is to lead people through movements and emotions that they have never experienced before, inspiring new thinking and creativity. Alex focuses on this mission full time by continuing to be a student in many styles of movement and performing, competing, and exchanging with dancers and students on a daily basis. He is the founder of Block 1750 - a center for dance and community in Boulder, Colorado.

Ricky Mendez

Ricky Mendez is the founder of Reverie Films, in Miami, FL. Film is Ricky’s passion, and when he is not working on the set of feature films like Bad Boys For Life, or coordinating commercials for major cruise line companies, Ricky channels his creative talent into his own short-film ventures. A child of Dominican parents, Ricky feels the Caribbean running through his veins, and after working on the GiveBack Barbados | Be Moved project in October 2019, he is excited to return to capture Soul Dance on film.

GiveBack - Funding

We are seeking funding to cover the project expenses so that all of the activities and events can be offered free of charge. Barbados is in a strained economic state and many Barbadians are experiencing dire financial situations. As is common the world over, the Arts are the first institutions to suffer in times of economic difficulty. We want every person, regardless of their financial situation to be able to participate in the inspiring, life-affirming activities of GiveBack Barbados | Soul Dance. 

Items to be funded:

Airfare for visiting artists from the U.S.A. and Europe

Accommodation in Barbados

Local transportation for visiting artists 

Scholarships so that all dancers may participate in workshops free of charge

Rehearsal and performance fees for local dancers 

Fees for visiting artists for teaching, choreography and Artistic direction

Fees for visiting film crew for production and post-production

Fees for local film assistant 

Dance studio rental in Barbados for classes and rehearsals

Venue rental and event fees for Dance Awareness Day

Costumes for performances 

Transportation for local artists to pop-up performances 

 

Our entire budget will be used to manifest Soul Dance. If we exceed our fundraising goal, all monies will be used to kickstart our next GiveBack project throughout the Caribbean! Besides the knowledge that you are supporting a unique project which will have far-reaching consequences both in Barbados and throughout the Caribbean, we will keep donors in the loop by providing:

- updates as the project unfolds in April

-  behind the scenes look at rehearsals and workshops  

- sneak peeks of performances

 

GiveBack - Why?

...because Art matters, music matters, learning matters, uplifting each other matters, a sharing community matters, moving our bodies matters, emotional intelligence matters, communication matters, consciousness matters, kinesthetic awareness matters,self-regulation matters, self-expression matters, relationship matters, joy matters, creation matters, giving back matters. It is these things which make us human, and in a world and in a time when our very humanity is being questioned, threatened and undermined, being human matters. 

GiveBack - Challenges

We are very understanding of the fact that our goals will not be achieved in the course of three weeks spent on the ground in Barbados. We see Soul Dance, following closely on the heels of Be Moved, as the second step in a long journey of sharing, reconnecting, educating and inspiring change and growth in the Caribbean artistic community and their audiences.  The dancers who participated in Be Moved recognized that this was ‘more than just dance’, and that as much as we were helping them to refine and re-pattern their physical movements, we were addressing them on an energetic level and sharing invaluable tools to be employed in daily life. The journey of GiveBack will be a long and fruitful one, and it is our dedication to our soul family in the Caribbean and to the island roots which nourished us until we could ourselves take flight across the wide world, which will sustain us over the coming years as this project evolves and expands. 

GiveBack - With Appreciation for all that you do

If you are unable to make a financial contribution to our project, we would greatly appreciate your sharing our fundraising platform with anyone who may be interested in our movement. Whether through social media sharing, or old fashioned word of mouth, we are grateful for your support!
story_txt: GiveBack - The VisionGiveBack is an initiative which facilitates the sharing of ideas, skills, talents and passions between members of the Caribbean diaspora and their countrymen back at home.Barbadian Celia Grannum and Jamaican Kris Jobson met during their freshman year at Tisch School of the Arts, New York University. They became fast friends, aware of an energetic resonance beyond their Caribbean roots. They supported each other through the rigorous training of their program and the challenges of stepping into the world of professional dance in New York City. After graduating, they criss- crossed the globe, and their paths intersected in the United Kingdom, Switzerland and Miami. As their lives expanded to encompass new career pursuits and family responsibilities, their friendship deepened, and they continued to giggle like the freshmen of years prior. Today, they bring their combined talents, experience and creative power together in a venture that is dear to both of their hearts - sharing their light with their community back at home. GiveBack - The ProjectsGiveBack completed it's first project, Barbados | Be Moved, in October 2019, touching the lives of over one hundred performing artists in the course of week.  Be Moved, the documentary, is currently being edited, and a work-in-progess version of the film can be viewed above. GiveBack is returning to Barbados this April to facilitate three weeks of activities as part of Dance Month 2020. The program will include over  160 contact hours  with local performers, and the creation and staging of  10 different performances  for the We Gatherin' year-long community building celebration.This project is entitled Barbados | Soul Dance. The GiveBack team will :- Conduct technique intensives- Mentor and coach local dancers, choreographers and teachers- Create new choreography- Stage and direct pop-up performances which will make dance more accessible to  the general public- Lead community outreach programs to bring the joy of dance to people of all ages-Facilitate mindfulness and stress-reduction workshops- Coach and mentor members of the street dance community- Coordinate and facilitate a DANCE AWARENESS DAY to educate the public about the world of professional dance through:* Demonstrations of training methods for different dance styles and techniques *  Lectures about the life of a professional dancer and the demands of the international dance industry * Choreographic showcases* Open Q&A between the GiveBack team, local artists and the audience   Our aim is to raise the profile of dance in Barbados so that it can be seen and respected as a viable career and not just a hobby. The filming of Soul Dance is an integral part of our educational outreach. A film episodic series will be created and will tell the stories of the lives of both individual performers and local dance groups. Their rigorous training, hopes, dreams, daily challenges, family support or lack thereof, successes and failures, will be captured and the series will be used locally for education as well as marketed regionally and internationally to highlight the lives of artists in the Caribbean. This project is being planned in conjunction with the National Cultural Foundation of Barbados. We will work with hundreds of dancers, teachers, students, youth, and members of the general public over the course of three weeks. The project will positively impact every individual participant, and send ripples of heart-opening, boundary shattering, consciousness shifting inspiration out into the fabric of Barbadian society.Soul Dance is part of an on-going incentive to cultivate a new dimension of the Performing Arts throughout the Caribbean and Barbados is the first stop. We are already in the process of establishing connections in Jamaica with the goal of launching our first GiveBack Performing arts and Fashion project there in the coming months. We are excited to unfold similar projects throughout the Caribbean, which are tailor-made for each island, taking into consideration their unique arts and cultural heritage.GiveBack - The TeamCelia Grannum Celia Grannum is a Barbadian who takes the sunshine wherever she goes. She completed a B.F.A. in Dance at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts, and pursued a career as a dancer, choreographer and teacher in the U.S., U.K., Japan, Switzerland and The Netherlands. She moved effortlessly between jazz, modern, contemporary and ballet styles, which allowed her to work with the likes of Tony award winning choreographer Wayne Cilento and Rafael Bonachela, Director of Sydney Dance Company, and be a founding member of London’s renowned Ballet Black. She directed her own company in Amsterdam, which was the hub of a vibrant freelance community. Her study and practice of Pilates, Yoga and Mindfulness, Thai Yoga Massage, and Homeopathy, deepened her understanding of anatomy, physiology, and the vital force, and aided her development of an anatomically sound, effective teaching style.Kris JobsonKris was born in Kingston, Jamaica. A consummate artist - a creative and artistic director, dancer, choreographer, speaker, writer, singer, actor and model - he received his B.F.A degree from the prestigious New York University, Tisch School of the Arts. Kris also had the pleasure of training at the Dance Theatre of Harlem, Alvin Ailey and The Joffrey Ballet schools. He has worked on TV shows, commercials, films and various productions as the Lead Talent and as creator/Director throughout Italy, Germany, Switzerland, China, U.S.A., South Africa, Morocco, Austria, Scandinavia, Japan and Thailand. Kris is currently the Choreographer and Principal Dancer for the Andrea Bocelli World Tour for the regions of Germany, Switzerland and South Africa. Having modeled for Calvin Klein, Verri, Fucci, Aimer and Triumph, and appearing on numerous print campaigns, Kris is also part of the Fashion Sector as a Director, choreographer and coordinator of many international Fashion shows such as Mercedes Benz Fashion Week Berlin, Milan, Shanghai and the Vogue Salon Shows in Germany.Alex MilewskiGiveBack Guest Alex Milewski is a full time movement artist, wellness coach and educator. Since 2006 he has competed, taught and performed around the world. Over the last two years Alex has travelled extensively in Central and South America facilitating dance trainings, intensives and dance-focussed community building activities in underserved communities. His movement style is rooted in BBoying, Martial Arts, Tricking, Contemporary and House Dance. His mission is to lead people through movements and emotions that they have never experienced before, inspiring new thinking and creativity. Alex focuses on this mission full time by continuing to be a student in many styles of movement and performing, competing, and exchanging with dancers and students on a daily basis. He is the founder of Block 1750 - a center for dance and community in Boulder, Colorado.Ricky MendezRicky Mendez is the founder of Reverie Films, in Miami, FL. Film is Ricky’s passion, and when he is not working on the set of feature films like Bad Boys For Life, or coordinating commercials for major cruise line companies, Ricky channels his creative talent into his own short-film ventures. A child of Dominican parents, Ricky feels the Caribbean running through his veins, and after working on the GiveBack Barbados | Be Moved project in October 2019, he is excited to return to capture Soul Dance on film.GiveBack - FundingWe are seeking funding to cover the project expenses so that all of the activities and events can be offered free of charge. Barbados is in a strained economic state and many Barbadians are experiencing dire financial situations. As is common the world over, the Arts are the first institutions to suffer in times of economic difficulty. We want every person, regardless of their financial situation to be able to participate in the inspiring, life-affirming activities of GiveBack Barbados | Soul Dance. Items to be funded:Airfare for visiting artists from the U.S.A. and EuropeAccommodation in BarbadosLocal transportation for visiting artists Scholarships so that all dancers may participate in workshops free of chargeRehearsal and performance fees for local dancers Fees for visiting artists for teaching, choreography and Artistic directionFees for visiting film crew for production and post-productionFees for local film assistant Dance studio rental in Barbados for classes and rehearsalsVenue rental and event fees for Dance Awareness DayCostumes for performances Transportation for local artists to pop-up performances  Our entire budget will be used to manifest Soul Dance. If we exceed our fundraising goal, all monies will be used to kickstart our next GiveBack project throughout the Caribbean! Besides the knowledge that you are supporting a unique project which will have far-reaching consequences both in Barbados and throughout the Caribbean, we will keep donors in the loop by providing:- updates as the project unfolds in April-  behind the scenes look at rehearsals and workshops  - sneak peeks of performances GiveBack - Why?...because Art matters, music matters, learning matters, uplifting each other matters, a sharing community matters, moving our bodies matters, emotional intelligence matters, communication matters, consciousness matters, kinesthetic awareness matters,self-regulation matters, self-expression matters, relationship matters, joy matters, creation matters, giving back matters. It is these things which make us human, and in a world and in a time when our very humanity is being questioned, threatened and undermined, being human matters. GiveBack - ChallengesWe are very understanding of the fact that our goals will not be achieved in the course of three weeks spent on the ground in Barbados. We see Soul Dance, following closely on the heels of Be Moved, as the second step in a long journey of sharing, reconnecting, educating and inspiring change and growth in the Caribbean artistic community and their audiences.  The dancers who participated in Be Moved recognized that this was ‘more than just dance’, and that as much as we were helping them to refine and re-pattern their physical movements, we were addressing them on an energetic level and sharing invaluable tools to be employed in daily life. The journey of GiveBack will be a long and fruitful one, and it is our dedication to our soul family in the Caribbean and to the island roots which nourished us until we could ourselves take flight across the wide world, which will sustain us over the coming years as this project evolves and expands. GiveBack - With Appreciation for all that you doIf you are unable to make a financial contribution to our project, we would greatly appreciate your sharing our fundraising platform with anyone who may be interested in our movement. Whether through social media sharing, or old fashioned word of mouth, we are grateful for your support!

story:
Welcome to the Savage Ranch Residency House

The Savage Ranch is an intentional creative community located in the Southern California Desert where fantasy becomes reality.  We need your help building a space to host fellow artists for artist residencies and projects where people can find refuge and create their dreams.

Now imagine for just one moment -- The Savage Ranch. The landscape of rolling hills and fiery sky materializes and your protective layers fall away. The veils are lifted and it’s as though you’ve fallen straight from the sky, directly into grace.

 

 

Our Mission

We want to be able to have as many people experience the magic of the Savage Ranch and take what they learn back to their own communities.  In order to make that happen, we need a building that can house more artists to be able to create the utopian vision we've dreamt of. With your help we can make this dream into a reality.  Universal Studios was created on a chicken farm and if they can do it so can we, together!

  • The Savage Ranch Residency House will be open to all who want a unique experience dedicated to giving back to our land, the local community and the universe around us. Residency programs as well as all visitations are offered and your time at the ranch is marked with a purpose.
  • Our vision is to gather together and grow as a community by developing the land to its fullest potential in the most sustainable way possible.
  • Your generous contributions will help us build the space to host artists, creators, visionaries and community leaders on the land and each contribution will come with perks including time at the Savage Ranch Residency House.

YOUR DONATIONS​

With the help of my contractor mother, we will build a permanent yurt structure that will house future artists. This space will be big enough for a few bunk beds & the other half of the space dedicated to a photo, music and dance studio. 

Part of giving back to the land, is that we also house an animal rescue on the Savage Ranch. Operating by 501(C)(3) we can also offer contributors a tax deductible donation for those who would like to do so.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contribution is key into making this dream a reality but there are also things you can do beyond your contribution a be a part of the community:

  • Spread the word! We can't do this without you and the exposure that each person can give by talking to people about our mission and your excitement to be involved.
  • There are other ways to contribute whether it's donating materials, your time, labor, or even spaces to help fund raise to meet our goal.

 

We can't wait to meet you on the Savage Ranch!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Tony and I have a passion for music and local music in particular. I've always been drawn to new, local and slightly under the radar musicians and bands. Being a less than amateur musician myself I wanted a way to get involved and give something back to my local music scene. So this is it...

Micro Music is a pop-up music idea that will go to interesting places that don't usually have live music. I want to be able to give local performers a platform to complement what is already out there and hopefully offer something a little different. I see this as a way to promote local music, local businesses and support some local charities as well.

Micro Music will benefit musicians, local businesses and local charities. Musicians will benefit by having another series of paying events, venues will benefit from increased trade and each event will be linked with a specific charity.

If you decide to contribute to this idea you will be enabling more music, helping a small part of the ever so important local community and just generally making things better. And I will be eternally grateful!

What We Need & What You Get

So why am I doing a fundraiser for this project? To make this work I need some kit. I need good enough equipment to be transportable, easy to set up and robust - and most importantly it has to sound good. But I want it to be cheap enough that its realistic to raise the money. So after some research my ideal amount to raise is £2,000. 

That will allow me to get a good portable PA, quality microphones, a small mixer and all the other bits-and-bobs to make noise. It will also allow some extra things to help me advertise and promote. For example some Micro Music banners and other promotional materials.

For the perks I've kept it simple. I don't really have a product as such that I can lure people with so I've kept the rewards low-key and I hope the idea is enough to inspire you generous people.

The Impact

I am a firm believer in the power of music to change lives. It offers a creative outlet for people, it brings people together, it lets people share ideas and thoughts, it builds local communities and is generally a force for good. Anything anyone can do to increase the amount of local music available to complement what is already there can only be a good thing. Who knows, maybe one day Micro Music's will be available all over the country.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't or don't want to contribute financially but still want to be involved then I would still be very happy to hear from you. Please sign up at the website or Facebook page or maybe give this campaign a share on your own social media. Anything to spread the word will be appreciated.

story:
Français ICI

 

              

 

 

   

 

 

 

 

 

CHALLENGE and RISKS 

Why open a space in the middle of a worldwide crisis?

COVID-19 : Some of the most innovative business ideas have been launched during times of crisis, so we have decided to take advantage of the pause in tourism activities to realize our next dream which was to open a cultural center / concept store. We want to create a space you can virtually visit and call home while international frontiers are still closed and visit in person when international travel resumes. How is it possible to plan what will be the scale of international travel in the next six months? The tourism industry has been hugely impacted and forecasts are planning a full restart only  at the beginning of  2021. This means less walking tours and other public events for us to plan.

  • How do we address this change in the industry?

Through our travel guides, our community will keep traveling through the images it contains, learning, and discovering. So promoting that travel tool by producing a new one and making it available is one solution. It is very important for us also to invest more into digital content. We know images speak more than a thousand words. That’s why launching a TV show is part of our strategy. 

 

Strikes and protests​ : Besides cheese, wine and baguettes, you may have heard that France is also very popular for its strikes and social protests! Sure, you heard about the Gilets Jaunes protests that started in mid-2018 and continued to the end 2019! And then guess what? Another social movement in the form of transit strikes started right away, paralyzing the entire country for 3 months! The Metro, Bus, TGV, Tramway systems were not working, so people had less opportunities to get out and explore a city.

  • So how have we tackled this?

We know that patience is a virtue and that sometimes certain things are not possible given the current state of affairs. For this reason, we have been investing primarily into digital content. We recognize the continued need for investing into great material to facilitate hosting online events at our space that you can follow online.

 

Construction Schedule and Risks: With every construction and renovation project  there are inherent risks of delays and cost overruns.

  • How are we mitigating this risk?

                 We have projected a 3 month construction schedule for the space, which is a conservative estimate for the renovations that will need to take place. We have selected an up and coming designer to design and project manage the renovation who has already successfully designed 2 beautiful concept store spaces in Paris without significant budget and schedule overruns. 

                The project construction will commence in early September, and end at the end of November. Our goal is to have the space opened by the start of the Christmas holiday season. We will keep our supporters apprised of milestones or any delays. You can anticipate the receipt of your gifts within 3 months of the end of our campaign.

story:
Cannabis users by the millions are be utilizing social media to display both their actions and opinions.

AND THEY ARE BEING WATCHED

Today's social networks are trolled by bots and blinds gathering information on these users. Family members and local agencies uses social media to track you. Facebook has been shutting down cannabis sites (here's an example - click here), twitter is full of fake accounts, and Instagram and SnapChat are not forms to maintain your voice and opinions.

We seek to create a cannabis dedicated social network to allow our users to find a safe haven to speak their mind. A place where there can display their lifestyle habits with other like minded individuals.

It shall be a Community based on Compassion and Knowledge!

Join Us in creating this needed social outlet!

When fully complete PotCircles shall be a hybrid of many apps you use today. Our users will be able to:

Text others

create circles of friends

post pics and videos (No Live streaming - sorry, we are just not going to do it)

create and post news and important info blogs

voice chat (through an encrypted system)

arrange a car service, access our coupons and deals in our PotPons section

stay up to date on laws in our knowledge section

and meet up with other cannabis users.

Support us and our growth!

 

Top 10 Referrers ($5,000 +) wins a brand new 27" 3.3GHz 2TB iMac!!!!!!

 

Thank you!

story:
DAH Theatre is the first professional independent theatre company founded in Serbia in 1991, who have been effectively creating highly artistic and socially engaged performances and projects for a quarter of a century. In a country that suffered through war, embargoes, sanctions and bombing, our work has often proven to be a struggle, sometimes even dangerous.

Last year our City left us homeless.

"DAH Theatre is a processed-based theatre company, and it is their process that stands out and influences theatre makers around the world." - Del Hamilton (DAH Theatre: A Sourcebook, 2016)

We have always believed that our work is necessary and important, not only in Serbia, but also in the rest of the world. This year we received living proof for this when a book about our work was published:  DAH Theatre: A Sourcebook, edited by Dennis Barnett and published by Lexington Books, USA, 2016.

We found a new home!

For the past several years we have been constantly fighting a battle to have a space where we can perform both the artistic and the managerial aspects of our work. A month ago, we finally succeeded in finding a space – we moved into a wonderful new space that can accommodate our needs, in the very centre of Belgrade. The best news is that we signed a contract and that we can stay in the space for many years to come. It seems that DAH Theatre has finally found a home.

But our new space needs to be adapted (see specification below) and this is why we have to ask for your help. We can’t do this alone anymore. Every day we write applications for support, work on our current projects, plan future ones and create new performances.

We need your help in order to keep doing this for the next 25 years.

The renovation costs are € 15 000.
The impact of our work is priceless.

Is it a home without friends?

Help us to build a new home which can continue to be a hub for making connections, provoking, inspiring, and encouraging transformation all over the world; a home where we will be able to host you, our friends, visitors, collaborators. It could be an island of light in our city!

Besides donating money directly to our bank account, PayPal or by Moneygram, there are many other ways you can raise money to help us if you are willing to:

  • Organize a performance/concert/ exhibition, in your space/city and donate part of the funds from tickets to DAH
  • Use any manifestation that is already in your repertoire and donate part of the funds to DAH
  • Put the donation boxes during your programs so your audience can donate as well
  • Publicly announce that you are raising money for us and spread the word about our campaign via Facebook, or any other social network.

So far we did amazing things, now help us do the impossible!

Roof reparation - 6000€
The installation of electricity and water - 2000€
Wall Chiselling and smoothing - 1000€
Wall painting - 400€
Front door - 600€
Reconstuction of bathroom and tea-kitchen - 2000€
Furniting of offices - 1000€
Coolers/heaters (AC)  - 1000 €
Web site redesign - 1000€

If we don’t reach the goal, all the collected funds will go to the roof reparation that is the most urgent. If we collect more that the predicted sum, all the rest will go to the renovation of the performing space.

We are hoping that we can count on solidarity of all of you, our theatre friends that know and follow our work. We also know that times are generally hard and that need for support is huge and we do understand if you can not support us now.  

But any donation would be of great help to us, we shall have one wall with all your names in our theatre. But the best would be that our theatre home would become theatre home for many artists in need and of course for all of you dear friends.

Thank you so much for your donations, effort and faith in DAH Theatre!

Yours DAH Theatre
Dijana, Maja, Ivana, Aleksandra and Natasa

This year we received living proof for this when a book about our work was published:  DAH Theatre: A Sourcebook, edited by Dennis Barnett and published by Lexington Books, USA, 2016.
We found a new home!
For the past several years we have been constantly fighting a battle to have a space where we can perform both the artistic and the managerial aspects of our work. A month ago, we finally succeeded in finding a space – we moved into a wonderful new space that can accommodate our needs, in the very centre of Belgrade. The best news is that we signed a contract and that we can stay in the space for many years to come. It seems that DAH Theatre has finally found a home.
But our new space needs to be adapted (see specification below) and this is why we have to ask for your help. We can’t do this alone anymore. Every day we write applications for support, work on our current projects, plan future ones and create new performances.We need your help in order to keep doing this for the next 25 years.
The renovation costs are € 15 000.The impact of our work is priceless.Is it a home without friends?
Help us to build a new home which can continue to be a hub for making connections, provoking, inspiring, and encouraging transformation all over the world; a home where we will be able to host you, our friends, visitors, collaborators. It could be an island of light in our city!
Besides donating money directly to our bank account, PayPal or by Moneygram, there are many other ways you can raise money to help us if you are willing to:

Organize a performance/concert/ exhibition, in your space/city and donate part of the funds from tickets to DAH
Use any manifestation that is already in your repertoire and donate part of the funds to DAH
Put the donation boxes during your programs so your audience can donate as well
Publicly announce that you are raising money for us and spread the word about our campaign via Facebook, or any other social network.

So far we did amazing things, now help us do the impossible!
Roof reparation - 6000€The installation of electricity and water - 2000€Wall Chiselling and smoothing - 1000€Wall painting - 400€Front door - 600€Reconstuction of bathroom and tea-kitchen - 2000€Furniting of offices - 1000€Coolers/heaters (AC)  - 1000 €Web site redesign - 1000€
If we don’t reach the goal, all the collected funds will go to the roof reparation that is the most urgent. If we collect more that the predicted sum, all the rest will go to the renovation of the performing space.
We are hoping that we can count on solidarity of all of you, our theatre friends that know and follow our work. We also know that times are generally hard and that need for support is huge and we do understand if you can not support us now.  
But any donation would be of great help to us, we shall have one wall with all your names in our theatre. But the best would be that our theatre home would become theatre home for many artists in need and of course for all of you dear friends.
Thank you so much for your donations, effort and faith in DAH Theatre!Yours DAH TheatreDijana, Maja, Ivana, Aleksandra and Natasa

story:
Our campaign:

My people, the Nagas have a rich culture and strong identity. We are an indigenous nation comprising of more than 40 different tribes with a population of about 4 million approximately. We live in the northeastern part of India and northwestern Myanmar. The Naga tribes have a shared history, culture and identity. Oral traditions such as folktales, myths, songs, and poems are passed down from generation to generations. Children and young people learned through folktales and legends about survival skills, endurance, moral values, respect for nature and for humanity. However, with the modern influences and exposures to the outside world, the oral traditions and cultural expressions are slowly diminishing in the Naga society. It is being slowly replaced by the western culture and its practices. Many young Nagas find the western culture more attractive than their own, at the same time they are increasingly integrating into it. Given this trend, there is high chance for loss of cultural expressions, traditional values, belief and its practices. When culture is compromised, the history and identity of a nation is threatened. 

Against this backdrop, a project on documentation of folktales was initiated. Its objective is to preserve and promote the legacy of oral traditions in a new written form, that will be made accessible to young and old.

We have published a story book called 'Naga Tales - Dawn' which is a collection of folktales from the Naga people, that speaks about our history, customs, traditions, ethics, and our relationship with nature, spirits and the animal world. Traditionally, our history and stories are passed down from mouth of words, so having this book published and distributed, it will pass on the information and knowledge about our culture and history, and also contribute to the cultural resources for the future generations. 

Appeal for support:

We need your support to raise fund for offset printing of the book. Please help us to realize our objective of preserving  and transmitting our cultural knowledge and values to young people. Your contribution in any amount towards the printing of this book will go a long way in the protection and promotion of our culture and identity.

We plan to print 1000 copies of the book, and need to raise a sum of $10,000 for the printing cost. 

We hope to be able to raise the target amount within a period of 60 days. For a contribution of $100 and above,  we will give out  a complimentary copy of the 'Naga Tales' that contains 10 interesting stories packed with beautiful photographs from the land of the Naga peoples.

Who we are?

We are a group of people - writers, photographers and human rights' advocates, with shared vision and conviction, that joined hands together to work for the promotion of indigenous peoples' rights to their culture and identity. We come from a small town called Tamenglong located in the Naga hills in northeastern part of India. 

My name is Atina Pamei. I am responsible for the coordination of this project. For more than a decade, I had worked on human rights issues particularly on the indigenous peoples rights. I have been actively engaged in lobby and advocacy of indigenous peoples rights at the United Nations and other regional/international fora, particularly on the protection and promotion  of cultural rights of indigenous peoples.

story:
How will the funds be used?

Funds raised through this campaign will be used to purchase an Olive Garden gift card for Gordon Hayward once he signs a contract to play for the Los Angeles Lakers. 

What happens if GH doesn't sign with the Lakers

If logistically possible, funds will be refunded to contributors. If not, funds will be donated to a local LA food bank

How else can I help?

Share this campaign on social media
